loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adzo T., 50, has been widowed for the past 18 years and has the sole responsibility for her three children. In the village she and her children lived a miserable life, so she came to Lomé to engage in business. Having been cast in the role of breadwinner for her family, she began selling cosmetics, candy, and simple groceries, which has been quite successful. Since she is concerned, however, about educating her children, she is asking for a loan of US$ 500 which will allow her to expand her inventory and thus keep her customers satisfied and coming back to her. In that way, she will be able to earn more from her business and do better by her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 50 ans, Madame T. Adzo est veuve depuis 18 ans avec trois (3) enfant en charge. Le niveau de vie au village avec les enfants est misérable, c’est pourquoi elle est venue s’installer à Lomé pour mener ses activités. Devenue chef de famille par la force des choses, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce des produits cosmétique, bonbons et les produits d’alimentation générale ce qui lui réussit bien. Soucieuses de l’éducation de ses enfants, elle sollicite un crédit de $500 pour élargir son étalage et fidéliser sa clientèle. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître ses revenus et mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use: Sales of cosmetics and grocery items  Achat et vente de produit cosmétique et d'alimentation générale

loans.name: Marta

texts.pt:
Marta M. is 43 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She lives in Bagamoyo, Maputo, and she sells basic need products from her house. She joined the program in 2005 as member of a group and she got her first loan in the amount of 960MT. She will begin her fifth cycle as an individual client and she will need 12.000MT, that will be repaid in 7 months. This amount will be fully applied on the business. The loans she has received have greatly helped - she has been able to improve her house's condition with the profits she has made.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Marta M. tem 43 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e tem 2 filhos. Vive no bairro Bagamoyo em maputo e tem o negócio de venda de produtos de 1ª necessiddae na sua residência.Entrou para o programa em 2005 como membro de um grupo e tomou como 1º empréstimo 960MT. Vai agora pra o 5º ciclo como cliente individual e vai tomar 12.000MT para pagar em 7 meses, o qual pretende aplicar no mesmo negócio. Os empréstimos a tem ajudado uma vez que tem comprado bens de casa com os lucros do negócio.

loans.use: Stock Increase.

loans.name: Guilaze Almeida

texts.pt:
Guilaze Almeida M. was born in Massaca district, in Boane, province of Maputo. He is 50 years old; he was raised with both of her sisters who later passed away. After completing the 4th grade he enrolled in a school to be an electrical technician but he was not able to graduate. In the same here he attended driving school.

In 1988 he started working as a driver. The job only lasted a couple of months and after he started working planting potatoes. In 1979 he married his girlfriend and now has 5 kids, of whom 3 are girls. He has a small store and in he also raises chicken in the backyard. He approached Hluvuku-Adsema to request a loan to invest in his chicken business. His dream is to expand his planting area and to do better in the chicken business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização Bairro 1- Boane/ Maputo Cliente: Guilaze Almeida M. Actividade: Agro-Pecuaria Valor De Empréstimo:20.000,00Mt(800 USd) Aplicação:Compra De Frangos Para Revenda Inicio: 28-11-07 Fim: 22-03-09 Guilaze Almeida M., Natural de Massaca,distrito de Boane , província de Maputo, de 50 anos de idade teve duas irmãs estas já falicidas, orfao de pai e mãe. Estudou ate a 4 classe na escola oficial de boane. Depois segue para escola de electricidade da baixa tensão para uma formação na área de elctricidade, nao conseguiu concluir. No mesmo ano vai a escola de condução para tirar a licença de conduçao.

Em 1988 começa a trabalhar na empresa de drenos como motorista do Director. No ano seguinte é promovido à chefe de transportes. O emprego durou poucos meses, largou e começou a assumir a conta própria na área da agricultura na produção de batata reno nas quintas que erdou dos seus progenitores. Um tempo depois para com actividade agrícola, por ter sido comprada a empresa que fornecia-lhe energia para alimentar as suas motobombas que usava para o regadio. Em 1979 compra o seu talhão com a sua namorada, e no mesmo ano casou-se e conta com 5 filhos dos quais 3 são menianas. Tem um pequeno estabelecimento comercial e uma capoeira onde tem criado os frangos para revenda. A sua actividade de criação de frangos fica parada por ter sofrido roubo, neste momento vende apenas produtos de primeira necessidade.

Passado algum tempo decide aproximar-se a Hluvuku-Adsema para remeter um pedido de empréstimo para criação de frangos, actividade. Soube da nossa existência da Hluvuku-Adsema apartir do seu sogro, Sr. Matendeudja, residente no Umpala que é nosso cliente. Entende o credito como uma boa ferramenta que possa ajudar as populacões que nao tem possibilidade de entrar nos grandes bancos maiores. Tem como maior sonho desenvolver a agricultura nas suas quintas e ter uma boa producao na area de avicultura.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Mrs. Flor R. is a single mother. For many years she has worked renting rooms and in addition she sells supplements. She has three children who are all professionals and are working in their own fields, for which Flor feels very proud of them and of all their successful efforts. Currently she has one objective, which is to expand her rentals in order to continue renting rooms and to invest a considerable sum of money in the growth of her supplement business (nectar of cocona) since it produces more income than expenditures. Mrs. Flor R. needs your support in order to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Flor es madre soltera, desde hace tiempo se dedica al alquiler de habitaciones y de manera adicional se dedica a la venta de agregados. Es madre tres hijos que ya son profesionales y se encuentran laborando en otros lares, motivo por las cuales ella se siente muy orgullosa de ellos y de todo el esfuerzo que ha otorgado a sus labores para su exitoso desempeño. Actualmente tiene un solo objetivo, ampliar sus instalaciones para continuar con el alquiler de las habitaciones e invertir una considerable cantidad de dinero para incrementar la venta de agregados (néctar de cocona) ya que le produce más ingresos que egresos. La señora flor necesita de tu apoyo para progresar.

loans.use: To expand her rental spaces

loans.name: Wambizzi C Group

texts.en: Rebecca is 25 years old and married with two children. She offers tailoring services.  Rebecca usually earns UGX 60,000 in profits each week. She wants to use the extra business profits to construct a house and also pay school fees for herchildren. Robina wants to use the loan to expand her brick laying business. Prossy and Eva have retail shop businesses while Resty sells fish for a living.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing machines

loans.name: Kireka B1 A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rose Mary N.. She is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to boost business. Rose is 28 years old and is married to a husband who is a civil servant for work. She has 2 children of ages 7 and 9 and her children go to school. Each week, Rose makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a house. Rose has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 1000000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Rose is joined in her small group by Joweria N., Agnes K., Angelina Nagulo, and Zulaika K.. Joweria N. has a business running a canteen and wants to add capital. Agnes K. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to increase her stock of shop items. Angelina Nagulo operates a business of vegetable selling and wants to boost business. Zulaika K. is currently in the business of running a beauty salon and is requesting a loan to purchase a hair dryer.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Sharifamoh

texts.ru:
Sharifamoh S. lives in the Khuroson area. She is 33 years old, married and has 4 children. She has a community college degree. Her business is selling peanuts. She buys them raw, dries them in the oven and then sells them in the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. The profits from this business are not very big, but Sharifamoh is not discouraged. She has decided to increase her inventory and sales, so as to also then increase profits. This business is the sole income for her family. She would like to use the loan to help increase sales and plans to repay it back in the course of 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Шерова Шарифамох Махмадалиевна проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 33 года, замужем и имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей фисташек. Закупает товар у оптовиков , сушит их в духовке и продает в розницу на рынке. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 2 года. Дохот от торговли фисташками не очень большой , но Шарифамох не унывает.Она решила увеличить оборотную сумму. Это поможет увеличить доход, который необходим для ее семьи, так как этот бизнес является единственным источником дохода ее семьи. А увеличить оборотную сумму путем получения кредита. А погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase inventory and sales

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.es:
Elizabeth, Roxana and Encarnación have been members of the “Nobleza” Communal Bank for two years.

Elizabeth, 38, is a single mother and has one child. She has three Internet stations in her home. Besides that, she also has a car that is used to transport people in Lima, a business managed by her father.

On the other hand, Roxana is 26 years old and has three children. She makes typical woven items like rugs and wall hangings that she sells in the F. Vivanco Market. Sometimes she also sells cheese.

Encarnación is 45 years old with five children. She sells meat to the stores and provides home delivery of animals purchased at the fairs.

Elizabeth, Roxana and Encarnación need a loan for $975 that will be used to purchase thread, dyes, sheep and to pay for auto repairs.

The dreams of these three women are to build their businesses and provide a good education for their children in addition to having more looms and their own homes.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Elizabeth, Roxana y Encarnación pertenecen al Banco Comunal Nobleza hace 2 años.

Elizabeth es madre soltera, tiene 38 años y 1 hijo, Elizabeth tiene cabinas de Internet en su casa. Además tiene un carro que realiza transporte urbano en la ciudad de Lima que esta administrado por su padre.

Por otro lado Roxana es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 3 hijos, Roxana elabora tejidos en telar como alfombras, tapices que vende en el Mercado F. Vivanco. Algunas veces Roxana vende quesos.

Mientras que Encarnación es conviviente, tiene 45 años y 5 hijos, Encarnación vende carne a las tiendas y reparte de casa en casa, los animales son adquiridos en las ferias.

Elizabeth, Roxana y Encarnación necesitan prestamos de 1600 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de hilos, tintes, ganado ovino y para los gastos de reparación de su carro.

Los sueños de Elizabeth, Roxana y Encarnación son implementar su negocios, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, tener más telares y casa propia.

loans.use: Purchase thread, dyes, sheep and pay for auto repairs.

loans.name: Seab

texts.en:
Mrs. Seab C., 27, is married with two children and works for a garment factory, earning about $2.60 each day. Her husband has been working as a construction foreman since 2000, earning around $6 of net income each day.

To commute to work each day, she and her husband have to use a motor-taxi service, which costs them more than $1.50 per day. This is double what it had been in the past, because of the very high inflation rate in Cambodia. To reduce this expense, Seab C. and her husband would like to take a loan from KIVA to purchase a motorbike to use for their family’s transportation. This will be an asset to her and her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to use for the family's transportation

loans.name: Kossiwa Nicole

texts.fr:
Mrs. Kossiwa Nicole A. was born in Lomé on 14 January 1970. She is married and has four children. To meet the needs of her family, she started a business selling pagne cloth and jewelry. She buys pagne cloth and jewelry at wholesale prices at the grand market in Lomé, and re-sells them in the district where she lives, Adidogomé.

Her clientele has grown, and to meet this increasing demand, she is asking for her first loan in order to enlarge her stock with 50 sets of pagne cloth and 10 sets of jewelry.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Kossiwa Nicole est née à Lomé le 14 janvier 1970 à Lomé. Elle est mariée est mère de quatre enfants. Pour subvenir au besoin de sa famille, elle se lance dans le commerce de pagne et de bijoux. Elle achète des pagnes et des bijoux au prix du gros au grand marché de Lomé qu’elle revend dans son quartier de résidence Adidogomé.

Sa clientèle a grandi et pour faire face à cette demande croissante elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour accroître son stock de 50 pièces de pagnes et 10 bijoux.

loans.use: To buy pagne cloth and jewelry

loans.name: Comité Atenas Group

texts.es:
The Atenas Group began in November 2007 when one of its founders learned of the program Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras from a neighbor who had formed her own group. She contacted her friends and neighbors who agreed to participate in the program. The group is made up of very hardworking, active women. The members are involved in various activities such as the sale of notions, handicrafts, cosmetics, ice cream, etc.

The Atenas Group is comprised of 17 members who are primarily located in a rural area. Besides the business activities of each one and working as housewives, they also carry out different activities for fundraising for the group such as raffles, dinners, etc. to benefit neighborhood improvements or emergency cases. It should be emphasized that the group has not had a single late payment of previous loans as they are very responsible. They understand the importance of communication and support among everyone.

They now would like a new loan that will be invested in the purchase of t-shirts, pants, shirts, socks, children’s clothing, among other things. They will also purchase various flavors of ice creams, hairdressing items and cosmetics, and notions, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

El Grupo denominado Atenas tuvo su inicio en el mes de Noviembre del Año 2.007, una de las integrantes se enteró del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras por intermedio de una vecina la cual ya había formado su propio grupo. Luego se propuso contactar con sus amigas y vecinas, las cuales accedieron en participar del programa. El comité está conformado por señoras muy trabajadoras y activas. Las integrantes se dedican a distintas actividades como, venta de mercería, artesanías, cosméticos, helados, etc.

El Grupo Atenas esta conformado por 17 integrantes que se encuentra localizado en una zona principalmente rural. Además de las actividades que realizan cada una y de ser amas de casa, ellas también realizan distintas actividades para la recaudación de fondos para el grupo como sorteos, polladas, etc. de los cuales la recaudación obtenida va para mejoras del barrio o casos de emergencia. Cabe destacar que el grupo no tuvo atrasos en el pago de sus cuotas de créditos anteriores ya que son todas muy responsables, las mismas comprenden la importancia comunicativas y solidarias entre todas.

Ellas hoy desean un crédito nuevo que lo invertirán en la compra de ropas como remeras, pantalones, camisas, medias, ropa para niños, entre otros; también compraran helados de distintos gustos, artículos para peluquería, al igual que cosméticos, y artículos de mercería, etc.

loans.use: Loan will be invested in the purchase of t-shirts, pants, shirts, socks, children’s clothing, various flavors of ice creams, hairdressing items and cosmetics, and notions, etc.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: D. Dilorom is 46 years old. She is married and the loving mother of three children. Dilorom has been selling women's clothing and underwear at the clothing market of Spitamen town, Tajikistan, for the last six years. A dedicated entrepreneur, Dilorom runs her business day after day with a cheerful smile and a desire to meet the needs of her customers. She has gained a wealth of experience and loyal customers along the way. No one else in her market offers the selection and prices that she does. Forced to start her own business after she had to leave her previous job, Dilorom is grateful for the income it has provided through the years. IMON is happy to be able to assist entrepreneurs like Dilorom. She has proven to be an excellent loan client and has never had a late payment. She has requested a loan of $600 for the term of 6 months to help her purchase new inventory and update her product selection. We look forward to continuing to help her business develop and flourish.

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise and clothing

loans.name: Bilquis' Group

texts.en:
Bilquis baji is the wife of M. Munir and lives in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places. She has been living in this city for the last 20 years. She is the mother of two sons. Bilquis baji's husband is a driver by profession and drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). He has been driving this vehicle for the last 8 years. Bilquis baji is a housewife and sews clothes of her neighbors. She successfully repaid her four loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy material (cloth, Zips) to sew school bags to sell. Bushra baji wants a loan to buy clothes to resell. Farhat baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (wires, tube lights and switch boards) for her electric shop. Fozia baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics for her parlor.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Doña Martina está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construcción de una habitación),  esta clienta tiene dos hijos,  el mayor de  9  años estudia su 4to grado y la niña menor estudia 1er grado de educación primaria,  esta clienta no sólo se dedica a enseñar sino que tambien por las tardes  trabaja de la mano con su marido  en el negocio que tienen en el mercado municipal de Nueva Guinea, para así mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia,  Martina actualmente está estudiando una licenciatura en la Universidad URACAN, tiene muchos deseos de superación profesional y personal. En el colegio donde ella labora es muy querida por sus alumnos, padres de familia y docentes por ser una mujer muy humilde pero bien responsable con sus deberes.  Su sueño es  tener una casa bonita como todo cuidadano desea con  todas las condiciones, tener salud, trabajo y que su hijos estudien para que lleguen hacer personas de bien.
texts.en:
Martina is requesting a loan to invest in improving her house by constructing a new room. She has two children, the older of whom is 9 and studies in the 4th grade, while his younger sister is in the first grade of primary school. Martina is not only dedicated to teaching, but she also works with her husband in the afternoons doing manual labor for their business in the municipal market of New Guinea. To improve living conditions for herself and for her family, Martina is currently studying for a degree at the URACAN University. She has tremendous personal and professional goals. In the high school where she works, she is affectionately thought of by her students, their parents and administration for being humble and very responsible with her duties. Her dream is to have a pretty house like those in the city. She wants to be healthy, to work, and to have her children study so that they become good citizens and good people.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en: Carol O. is 30 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions like detergents, toothpastes, brushes, etc. She also sells foodstuffs like melon seed, soup spices, yams, garri, etc. She hopes to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs in large quantities to sell to her customers. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana Q. is a 27-year-old single mother of one child. At the moment, her kid is in school. 

For three years, she has been selling, through hawking, washing detergents, such as Unilever and Omo washing powders, soaps, bleaches, etc.. She balances her stock on her head and walks miles to sell to her customers at their doorsteps. She needs the loan to enable her make progress in her business. Christiana wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of detergents. By increasing her stock, she hopes to make more income to provide her child with a good education. 

She is a member of the group called Ephesians Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee one another and assist each other to repay the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more supplies, detergents like Omo, Parazone, bleach and soaps etc.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.es: Brenda tiene 20 años, es madre de dos hijos y vive con su pareja. Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza desde hace ya 4 años atrás en su casa, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es atender con amabilidad a sus clientes y sobre todo poder dar lo necesario a sus hijos que son la luz por la cual trabaja cada día, desea verlos en el futuro como profesionales. Debido a que estas bebidas son gran consumo, Brenda tiene muy buenas ventas diariamente, además se encuentra ubicada en una zona por donde transitan muchas personas que para refrescarse se toman un tiempo para consumir entre amigos algunas cervezas, y es ahí donde entra a tallar la amabilidad en la atención de Brenda. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, y hasta el momento ha sido puntual con sus pagos anteriores. Con el dinero que solicita comprará sillas y mesas, además de mandar a construir un kiosco para la venta de sus bebidas.
texts.en:
Brenda is 20 years old, the mother of two children and lives with her partner. For the past 4 years she has sold beer from behind her home. What she likes about her work is serving her customers and most of all, being able to provide for her children, who are the reason she works every day; she would like to see them become professionals in the future. Since the drinks have a high rate of consumption, Brenda has good sales every day. In addition, she is in a high-traffic area where many people pass by and stop to have a beer with their friends and receive friendly service from Brenda. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she has been on time with her previous payments. With the money she requests she will buy chairs and tables as well as build a kiosk where she can sell drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a kiosk for her business and buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Vieru

texts.en:
Mr. S. lives in Causeni district. The main activity of this borrower is raising animals and especially cows, grown to produce milk, and pigs for meat. Since 1999 he has private ownership of 2.18 hectares of agricultural land and 0.4 hectares of vineyard. The borrower is the owner of the animals which he keeps in the household.

The business location is in Causeni town. The business was launched in 1994. This is the second loan borrowed from MicroInvest and the purpose of the loan is to purchase two pigs and building materials for pig-sty reconstruction. Future plans of this client are to grow more grape vines and also to increase the number of sales in this district. He is very experienced; he has worked in this field for more than 10 years.

loans.use: purchasing two pigs and building materials for pig-sty reconstruction

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en:
Uuganbayar B. is a 40-year-old man who lives with his wife and two children. Jasray, his wife, works at the shoe factory, and the children go to school. He moved to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, from the countryside a decade ago. During the last 10 years, he has been making traditional belts called Gyargan. The beautiful belts are made from woven silk. Before 1930, this type of belt was used commonly by the lamas, or Tibetan Buddhist priests (50% of Mongolians practice Tibetan Buddhism, or Lamaism, according to the CIA World Factbook). 

Nowadays, very few people know how to make Gyargan belts. He learned to make the Gyargan belt from his aunt. At first, it was hard for him to find clients. But now he has many customers who buy the Gyargan belt to use during the lunar New Year celebration. Uuganbayar weaves only one belt in 3 days, or about 10-12 per month. His monthly income from his business is MNT 160,000-180,000 (1500 MNT=$1 USD). Attached is a very, very short video of Uuganbayar at work!

loans.use: Buying silk

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed I. is thirty-one years old. He is married and has two children, both males. The first is in primary school while the second has yet to start school. His wife is into the palm oil production business. He lives with his family in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming.

Mohammed is a farmer and trades as well. He says he trades in cola nuts. He procures cola nuts from cola nut farmers in the northern part of the country and treks to other towns to sell them. He distributes to customers who retail them. Mohammed wants a loan to procure the cola in large quantities so that he can distribute them to the increasing number of his customers. He aspires to give his children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure cola nuts

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther Idowu is 53 years old and married with seven children.  She sells planks.  Esther is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more planks to sell.  She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more planks to sell.

loans.name: Mema

texts.en: Mema F. M., 43, is married with 3 children.  She has 1 year of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the general public 3 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (about US $148).  SPBD loans are Mema’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase sewing supplies

loans.name: Wangese

texts.en:
Wangese M. is a Tanzanian small business owner. He is a married man.

Wangese runs two businesses in the Kitunda Ward in Dar es Salaam. He has a business raising poultry and also raises crops in a garden. Wangese keeps both broilers and layers in his poultry cages. He also grows varieties of green vegetables and fruit in the graden.

Wangese uses the income he generates from his businesses to meet his family's daily demands. He is requesting a loan to expand his businesses. For this purpose, Wangese needs a loan of Tshs 1,200,000.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
Benilda is 49 years old and is happily married to Pedro D. C. of Liwayway Diffun Quirino.

Benilda has two businesses: the first is selling snacks at the elementary school; the second is managing a sewing business where she tailors clothes such as uniforms, as well as curtains and clothing repairs, etc. Benilda is thankful for having her businesses, for it helps her family with a lot of their necessities. She hopes to improve her business, so she is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000.

Benilda wants all her children to be able to finish their tertiary level of education because she believes that providing them the best education is the only treasure they can give their six children. She is really doing her best to maintain her business and make it sustainable in the future. Especially now that the new school year is fast approaching, she really needs to prepare for her school vending business while also continuing her sewing business.

loans.use: To use as business capital to improve her businesses

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La señora Delia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Juan de Dios”, del distrito de Lampa Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 36 años, es conviviente y madre de 4 hijos; tiene estudios de secundaria completa. Vive en el Barrio Nueva Esperanza.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 2 años, inició su trabajo con un préstamo de S/. 300.00, con el cual compró productos lácteos como queso y leche, etc.

Actualmente solicita un préstano de S/. 1000.00, para comprar leche, yogurt y quesos, luego los lleva a la mina La Rinconada y los vende, ya que solo trabaja por pedido y en algunas ocasiones también prepara comida para vender. 

A ella le gustan las reuniones de su Banco Comunal ya que le enseñan a ahorrar. Su mayor sueño es poner su negocio en la misma mina, educar a sus hijos y comprarse una casita.
texts.en:
Delia belongs to the San Juan de Dios Community Bank in the Lampa district, San Román province, Puno department. She is 36, in a common law marriage, and has four children. She has a high school education. She lives in the Nueva Esperanza neighborhood. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for almost two years. She started her work with a loan for 300 PEN, which she used to buy dairy products like cheese and milk, etc. She is currently asking for a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy milk, yogurt, and cheese. She will then take them to La Rinconada mine and sell them. She only works on orders, and sometimes she also prepares meals to sell. She likes the Community Bank meetings since they teach her how to save. Her biggest dreams are to set up her business in the same mine, educate her children, and buy a little house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy yogurt, cheese, milk and other things

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es: La Sra. Maria Esther L., es cliente antigua, trabajo desde el año 2006, juntamente con su esposo, quien es transportista, ella tiene un hijo pequeño, por lo que se dedica más a esta actividad de repartir a crédito la mercaderia de cosmeticos, ya que anteriormente tambien tenía otra actividad, la de trabajaar como ayudante en la guarderia de Chasquipampa, ella vino recomendada por su Sra. mamá, quien era cliente de Emprender, hasta la fecha ella tiene buen historial y trabaja con puntualidad y responsabilidad en el crédito.
texts.en:
Maria Esther L. is an old customer who has worked since 2005 alongside her husband who is a truck driver. She has one small child. The activity to which she will be dedicating the majority of her loan is selling cosmetics. Previously, she also had another job working as an assistant at the Cashquipampa daycare. She came recommended by her mother, who was a customer of Emprender. Until today, she has had a good history paying her loans on time and working responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Bola

texts.en:
Bola sells clothes and she is also a fashion designer. She has been in this business for the past twelve years. Bola is 49 years old and married with four children.

Bola has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years. She has been investing the loans in her clothes business and this has increased her profitability. She is requesting the loan of N140,000 to purchase more clothes and tailoring materials to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase of more clothes and tailoring materials

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarorn S. lives in Prey Mei Lang Thboung village in Takeo province. She is a tailor in her house. She is also a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Pum Vannak, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice.

Now Mrs. Sarorn S. is requesting a loan to buy more piglets for breeding and she would use the rest of the money to purchase fertilizer to support the rice field. She is 28 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding and for fertilizer to support the rice field.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras De La Ensenada Group

texts.es:
Antonia V. M. tiene un negocio llamado SERVICIOS GENERALES AVM ahí ve plasmado su esfuerzo y sacrificio, ella  se ha dedicado al trabajo D. la carpintería especializándose en muebles D. computo. La señora Antonia vive en los olivos Perú y nos cuenta que al ver que ese tipo D. negocio era una buena inversión decidió  empezar en este rubro, lo hace con la idea D. ayudar a su hijo  ya que el trabajaba como obrero para otra carpintería con el conocimiento D. el sobre carpintería y sus ahorros ella siente que ha logrado su objetivo D. crear su propia fuente D. trabajo lo que también le servirá para sus otros 5 hijos. Con el resultado D. su inversión pueD. ver crecer día a día su negocio ha logrado comprar algunas maquinarias para su carpintería, mejorar su casa y con sus ganancias logra cubrir todos los gastos que requiere su familia  ella actualmente planea comprar un carro ahora con el préstamo que le proporcionara EDAPROSPO comprara mas maquinas para ampliar su carpintería y generar mas trabajo, con todo esto ella pueD. ver que sus metas se están logrando día a día. 

*La Señora Antonia esta D. pie al final D. la columna (parados D. izquierda a derecha)
texts.en:
Antonia V. M. has a business called SERVICIOS GENERALES AVM which she has created through her effort and sacrifice. The business does carpentry work, specializing in computer furniture. Antonia lives in Los Olivos, Peru, and she tells us that when she saw this type of business, she decided it would be a good investment for her savings, and could utilize the skills of her son, an experienced carpenter. It could also serve as future employment for her 5 other children.

As a result of her investments, her business has grown little by little. She has been able to buy woodworking machinery, improve her house, and cover all her family expenses with her earnings. With this loan from EDAPROSPO, she will buy a car and additional machinery. Day by day, she is achieving her goals.

*In the photo, Antonia is standing at the far right.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in her business

loans.name: Martha Del Carmen

texts.es:
La venta de frutas y verduras es el negocio al que se dedica la señora Martha del Carmen M. en la ciudad de Managua en el mercado Ivan Montenegro siendo dicho negocio el sustento de su hogar.

La razón por la que ella espera en que Ceprodel le brinde el crédito es para invertirlo directamente en la compra de las frutas y verduras para así ofrecerlas en su establecimiento y así suplir las necesidades de su hogar compuesta por ella y sus tres hijos a su cargo.

loans.use: Compra de las frutas y verduras

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a single man living with his parents and 3 brothers. He is 22 years old. In 2006, he opened a curtain shop as his own business. Today, Hassan is requesting a loan of US$ 800 to buy merchandise for his work to be able to keep on with his business by increasing his sales and also his income.

loans.use: buy merchandise

loans.name: Marcia

texts.es:
La señora Marcia es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario” Ubicado en Villa Queñuani, del distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Yunguyo, Departamento de Puno; tiene 49 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 03 hijos, vive en el Barrio Central, estudio solo hasta el 1er grado de educación primaria.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela R. hace 9 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de orégano.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar   orégano, y ganado menor para engorde.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan los ahorros y las reuniones,
texts.en:
Mrs. Marcia is a member of the communal bank “Vírgen del Rosario” located in Villa Queñuani, Yunguyo District, Yunguyo Province, Department of Puno; she is 49 years old, is married, and has three children. She lives in the Central neighborhood and she has completed only the first grade. Marcia has been working with Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela R. for nine years. Her first loan was for PEN 300, which allowed her to increase her capital for her business buying and selling oregano. Today, she is requesting a new loan of PEN 500, which will allow her to buy oregano, and small animals to fatten and resell. Marcia's biggest wish is to keep working. She loves to save and going to loan center meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying oregano and sheep

loans.name: Pachapaccari Group

texts.en:
Our socios are part of a communal bank consisting of 10 members in Cusco. The group is called Pachapaccari.

Some of the members are married, others live with their significant other, some have children, and some are single. One of the members is a rafting guide, a chef, and a printer. They will use the loan for various business activities, such as buying ingredients to make breakfast for clients, materials to knit artisanal goods, and carpets to sell.

This is the group’s first loan from Arariwa. The group appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

(One borrower's spouse and child are pictured as well.)

loans.use: Working capital for their businesses

loans.name: Geronima T.

texts.en:
Geronima T. R. is from the village of Lupagan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 71 years old. Geronima T. is widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Geronima T. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Geronima T. is just starting this business.

In 2008, Geronima T. joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Geronima T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from PMPC. Geronima T. is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to finish the fence at their house. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Geronima T. from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to finish the fence at their house

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn M. is from the village of Maac, Guisiliban Camiguin Province. She is 28 years old. Ailyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Ailyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Ailyn has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ailyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ailyn is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ailyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nidia Violeta

texts.es:
La señora Nidia es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo” desde hace 5 años, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 23 años de edad, cuenta con estudios superiores incompletos, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo.
Nidia se dedica a la venta de zapatillas y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles con los que podrá comprar más mercadería como zapatilla.
Su sueño para el futuro es abrir un stand de zapatillas.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
For five years now, Señora Nidia has been a member of the Third of May Communal Bank which is in the Llave District, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 23 years old, has some higher education (not completed) and lives with her domestic partner and her son. Nidia works at selling sneakers and she tells us that with the first loan of 300 New Sols which she solicited from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos she was able to increase her working capital. She will now request a loan of 1,000 New Sols with which she will be able to buy more merchandise such as sneakers. Her dream for the future is to open a stand for selling sneakers. The thing she likes best about her Communal Bank is the savings plan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sneakers.

loans.name: Yolita

texts.en:
Yolita B. is from the village of Tipolo, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Yolita owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She is just starting this business. Yolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.es:
Catherine es una mujer muy laboriosa, tiene 27 años, vive con su pareja y su hija Carol de 4 años, en la casa de su suegra, en un ambiente que le cedió muy amablemente.  
Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de golosinas. A inicios de su negocio se ubicaba al costado de su casa en un kiosco muy precario hechos de esteras. Se levantaba muy temprano para ayudar a su madre en la cocina para después atender su kiosco, sin dejarlo solo por temor a los ladrones. Ahora ya cuenta con unas vitrinas donde puede exhibir sus productos.
A Catherine le gusta su negocio porque conversa y conoce mucha gente, clientes y vecinos, y gracias a las buenas ventas ahora logra ayudar con los gastos de su casa y para terminar de construirla. Ella está muy agradecida con sus padres, por ello desde progresar con su pareja y velar por el futuro de sus padres.
En adelante, planea estudiar corte confección e implementar su propio taller costura en su casa, además de seguir con la venta de los dulces.

Este es el octavo crédito que tiene con MFP, ella asegura seguir siendo puntual en cada uno de sus cuotas, ya que está muy agradecida con los integrantes de este banco que le han dado la oportunidad de contar con un préstamo. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de galletas, gaseosas y demás mercadería acorde a su negocio.
texts.en:
Catherine is a very hard working woman. She is 27 years old and lives with her partner and their daughter, Carol, who is 4, in her mother-in-law's house which she lives in happily.

For 6 years she has been selling sweets. At the start she ran her business from a kiosk by the side of her house made, a little precariously, of rush mats. She got up very early to help her mother in the kitchen so that she could serve in the kiosk afterwards as she did not want to leave it unattended as she feared it may be broken into by thieves. Her kiosk now has some windows to display her products.

Catherine likes her business because it allows her to talk to and get to know many people - both clients and neighbours - and thanks to good sales she is now able to help out with her household's expenses and with the finances to help finish their house's construction. She is very grateful to her parents and will stay on with her partner and watch over her parents' future.

In the future she plans to study dressmaking and set up her own workshop at home, as well as keeping on selling sweets.

This is her eighth credit with MFP and she affirms that she will carry on being punctual with the repayments, as she is very grateful to the members of this bank who have given her the opportunity to get loans. The money that she is asking for at the moment is to buy biscuits, soft drinks and some other merchandise for her business.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise/Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Querer Es Poder Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento QUERER ES PODER, viene trabajando con nuestra Institución desD. el 2007, este banco se caracteriza por ser antiguo,la mayoria D. las socias se dedica al comercio  en la venta D. bolsas nylon , plásticos, CDs, pasankalla, frutas,pantalones,embutidos y otras socias tienen tienda y pensión. 

La Sra. SALOME ocupa el cargo D. presidenta, ella se constituye en jefe D. su hogar ya que se encuentra separada D. su esposo y tiene que mantener a la familia ella sola, con el prestamo comprara por cantidad pasankalla para que aumenten sus pedidos, también ampliara su tienda diversificando sus productos, con estos negocios tiene pensado ahorrar para los estudios D. sus hijos.

La Sra. JENNY Es una nueva socia que tiene como negocio una tienda, con el prestamo comprara material escolar y D. esta manera aumentar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad D. vida.

La Sra. CONSUELO ocupa el cargo D. tesorera, ella tiene una familia numerosa, se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. embutidos, con el prestamo aumentado su producción y sus ingresos D. su familia.  

Todas las socias son personas responsables y dinamicas qu trabajan duro para ayudar en los gastos del hogar y sacar a su familia adelante en muchos casos solas.

El credito lo utilizaran para la compra D. mercaderia e incrementar su capital D. trabajo.

Todas las socias estan agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito
texts.en:
The QUERER ES PODER communal bank has been collaborating with our institution since 2007. It is one of the oldest communal banks; most of its members sell nylon bags, plastics, CDs, pasankalla (a variety of quinoa), fruits, pants, canned meats; others have grocery stores or sell prepared meals. SALOME is the group president. She is head of her household since she is separated from her husband. She must support her family alone. She will use the loan to buy pasankalla to increase her orders and she will also expand her store diversifying her stock inventory. She hopes this business will produce enough to be able to pay for her children’s education. JENNY is a new member; she has a store. She will use the funds to buy school supplies to increase her earnings and improve her quality of life. CONSUELO is group treasurer. She has a large family and she cures meats for sale. She will use the funds to increase production and her family’s income. All of the members are responsible and dynamic; they work hard to help meet household expenses and get their families ahead in life, in many cases, alone. The loan will be used to buy merchandise and increase their working capital. All the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for trusting them enough to grant the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Power From God Group

texts.en: For 10 years, Krubo T. has been selling charcoal at the Red Light Market, which is the largest market in Liberia. She is 39 years old, married and has five children who range in age from 1 to 18 years old. She is very friendly to her customers which keeps them returning. Krubo plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar (LRD) portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more charcoal. Her goal is to have all of her children attend school and to be able to open her own shop one day. Krubo is the leader of this group of five borrowers called "Power from God". In the photo that accompanies this profile, Krubo is the one holding the sign. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, this non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal

loans.name: Dani

texts.en:
Dani is a 27-year-old single man who has worked as a home electrician since 2000. Working on a freelance basis, he works upon request of his clients in his town and the surrounding villages.

Dani is thankful for his first loan from Kiva and today he is asking for a second loan of $1,000 to buy tools and supplies like cables because he will take on a new home project in the coming month and he needs to be ready to meet his customer’s requirements.

loans.use: To buy tools and supplies for his business

loans.name: Emelita Jamolod Group

texts.en:
Emelita J. is from the village of Taguilon. She is the leader of a two-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group member if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Emelita is 32 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Emelita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2007, Emelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Emelita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her sixth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Rosa Yanira

texts.es: Rosa Yanira G. D. B. D. 37 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. San Martín, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo el cual se dedica a trabajar, y junto a sus tres hijos D. 16,12 y 9 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Rosa posee un negocio propio, el cual es una tienda en la que se comercializan productos perecederos, los cuales son D. mucha necesidad en el hogar, ya sea para alimentación como para el mantenimiento del hogar. Este negocio es muy importante para Rosa, ya que es gracias a este que ella pueD. brindarle ayuda a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar. Es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos, en especial aquellos que son más vendido tales como pan, leche, huevos, embutidos y otros más, estos le permitirán mejorar las ventas D. su negocio, permitiéndole invertir aún más en el y D. esta manera mantenerlo estable.
texts.en:
Rosa Yanira G. D. B. is 37 years old and resides in the town of San Martín, located in the Department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband, who is devoted to his work, and their three children (ages 16, 12, and 9) who are in school. Rosa manages her own business, a store where she sells perishable products that are of great necessity in the home and used for feeding one’s family.

This business is very important to Rosa because it allows her to help her husband with all of the household expenses. For this reason she is requesting a loan so that she can buy a large quantity of products, especially those that she sells the most such as bread, milk, eggs, sausages, and other items. This will enable her to improve her sales and invest more into her business so that it remains stable.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a large quantity of perishable products

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 27-year-old man, married with one child. He is a big business dreamer who wants his retail shop to prosper to big levels of sustainability. He currently lives in a mud and wattle house with his family of two in Katikara, Uganda. In his retail shop, Robert sells sugar, soap, salt and other domestic requirements. He is the breadwinner for his wife and child, and is dreaming of constructing a permanent house for the family one day because the mud one he is living in now is not comfortable or safe. He is to use the loan funds to buy sugar, soap, beer to sell in his shop.

loans.use: buying sugar, soap, beer for  his shop

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia T. is from the village of San Jose. She is 41 years old. Lydia is married and has 3 young children. To make a living, Lydia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 75,000 PHP during harvest season.

In 2005, Lydia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Lydia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Rhevy

texts.en:
Rhevy B. is from the village of Franchfort, Bumbaran, Lanao del Sur. She is 50 years old, married and the mother of five adult-aged children. 

To make a living, Rhevy makes and sells food, snacks and other delicacies. Rhevy has just starting her business.

In 2010, Rhevy joined HSPFI to access financial services, improve her living situation and to engage in business. Rhevy is requesting a  loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase inventory and for working capital.  This loan will be Rhevy's first from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

--------------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Lann

texts.en:
The photo shows the family members of Mrs. Lann T., who is 31 years old and married with four small kids, most of whom are enrolled in the primary school.

Lann T. became a crop grower when she was single, a skill she learned from her grandmother. She owns medium land where she cultivates a potato crop, which she will harvest and sell the crop to buyers when they are mature. Her husband assists her in growing crops.

The coming rainfall season allows for farming but Lann T. does not have enough supplies to use on her field. Because she doesn’t have enough money, Lann T. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds to grow.

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en:
Rejoice P. sells plastic plates, cups, and bowls at the shop and requests a loan to stock jugs and cups to sell. Rejoice married a nurse and has three children who all go to school. With the extra profits from the business generated by this loan, she wants to extend the floor of her shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock jugs and cups to sell

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Maritza; ella tiene 37 años de edad y tiene 4 hijos, La socia es conviviente y vive en el distrito de Urcos,  la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene un pequeño stand de venta de pan desde hace 11 años, la socia misma va temprano por las mañanas a la panadería y compra todo tipo de panes al por mayor y calientitos, ella los envuelve muy bien y en una canasta los lleva a vender al paradero del poblado, ella espera pacientemente desde las 6 a.m. que empiezan a pasar todos los carros con destino a las diferentes ciudades y ofrece su pan, la socia  solicita el préstamo para comprar panes al por mayor y venderlos.

La socia agradece y valora el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “QORI ORCCO”. She lives in the Urcos district in the Quispicanchis province, Cuzco department. Her name is Maritza and she is 37 years old and has 4 children. She is in a common law marriage and works in retail. She has a small stand where she has sold bread for 11 years. She goes herself early mornings to the bakers and buys all types of bread warm and wholesale. She wraps them up in a basket and sells them at the town traffic stop. She waits patiently, starting at six a.m., when the cars begin to go by on their way to different cities, and she offers her bread. The member is asking for the loan to buy bread wholesale and sell it. Maritza is grateful for and values the loan, since it allows her to grow with her business and improve her quality of life. She is also committed to making her payments according to the agreed upon schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan to buy bread wholesale and sell it.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 71-year-old businessman who runs a retail shop.  He sells mainly household items.  In addition, he sells charcoal and paraffin and does farming together with his wife.  He was previously employed and went into business because his salary could not support his big family.  John has managed to educate his eight children and he has only two children who are still in school.  John became a member of Wikwayo Mutituni group in Faulu Kenya.  He has benefited from the group because he can save his money.  He has also taken out a loan of 60,000 KES through the group.  He has requested another loan of 55,000 KES.  He will use the money to purchase charcoal and paraffin.  His dream is to purchase a piece of land for farming to boost his family’s income.  In ten years, he wants to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and paraffin

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica Z., a married woman who lives in Brgy. Jolomaynon, Dalaguete, Cebu, earns her living buying and selling livestock. Her husband, Jaime Z., 51, works as a tricycle driver and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are between 19 and 26 years old.

Veronica joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 23000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12000, further uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 12th loan she is requesting PHP 250000 to buy feed and stock for her business so that she can continue to save up for family and business improvements. Veronica Z. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice J. is currently in the business of selling fish, beans and tomatoes at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes to sell. Alice is 38 years old and is married. Her husband works for MAG (Mines Advisory Group). She has 5 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business by stocking more goods to sell and to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: to stock sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia T. is from the village of Siempre Viva Sur, Mallig, Isabela. She is 48 years old. Florencia is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Florencia owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Florencia has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Florencia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Florencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Florencia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Florencia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cristina De Las Mercedes

texts.es:
Cristina de 36 años, tiene un taller de costura y confección. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral rodeada del estero salado de Guayaquil. 

Desde joven ella comenzó a trabajar cosiendo ropa poco a poco con esfuerzo y después de tener sus hijos ella busco alternativas mas eficaces para tener mas clientela. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 07h30 hasta las 20h30pm todos los días. Tiene un pequeño taller de productos químicos en donde trabaja su esposo. 

Para seguir con el taller de costura ella quiere comprar con el préstamo telas, hilos y así elaborar mas ropa. En el futuro quiere entregar ropa a empresas con una buena calidad y precios bajos.
texts.en:
Cristina is 36 years old, and she has a seamstress shop.  She lives along the Perimetral Highway, which is a periurban area that is surrounded by the Guayaquil salt marsh.

When she was young she started working by sewing clothes.  After having her children she slowly, and with effort, looked for more effective ways to have more customers.  She currently works from 7:30 a.m. until 8:30 p.m. everyday.  She has a small workshop with chemical products where her husband works.

In order to keep going with the seamstress shop, she wants to use the loan to buy fabric and thread.  That way she will make more clothes.  In the future she wants to deliver to businesses good quality clothes at a low price.

loans.use: Fabric

loans.name: Amihan's Group

texts.en:
Amihan G. is from the village of Marrakuru, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 50 years old. Amihan is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Amihan is widowed and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Amihan owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general alteration & tailoring services to local community members. Amihan has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Amihan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amihan is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & threads. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Amihan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & threads

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama Dramé  est un homme marié de 37 ans qui vit dans une famille polygame. Il est père de six enfants et habitant  Koko, un des quartiers de Fakola, Préfecture de Kolondièba  dans la troisième région (Sikasso)  République du  Mali. 
Pour mieux alléger sa pauvreté, Monsieur Dramé adhéra au programme du prêt individuel de stockage- commercialisation de céréales de Soro Yiriwaso auquel il est à son deuxième cycle.
Avec ce prêt, il compte avoir 4000 kilogrammes de maïs, 1000  kilogrammes de petit sorgo et 2000 kilogrammes de riz qu’il stockera pour revendre en une période où le cours  sera plus élevé.
 Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants et espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50.000  FCFA qui sera utilisé pour prendra en charge les frais scolaire,  de santé et  nourriture.
texts.en:
Mr. Adama Drame is a 37-year-old married man who lives in a polygamous family. He is the father of six children and lives in Koko, one of the boroughs of Fakola, part of the Kolondieba prefecture in the third region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali.

To alleviate poverty, Mr. Drame joined the Soro Yiriwaso individual loan program for stocking and trading grain cereals, and is beginning his second loan cycle.

With this loan he intends to buy 4000 kilos of corn, 1000 kilos of sorghum and 2000 kilos of rice that he will stockpile to be resold at a time of high selling prices.

He resupplies in neighbouring villages and hopes to attain average monthly earnings of 50,000 FCFA he will use to cover schooling, healthcare, and food costs.

loans.use: Buy grain cereals

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe II” ubicado en el distrito de Cojata, provincia de Huancané, departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 04 hijos, realizó estudios de educación secundaria.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 04 meses,  nos cuenta que su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio de venta de abarrotes, golosinas y otros.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para comprar mercaderías para su tienda.
	
Su sueño para el futuro es tener más capital para su negocio y poder educar a sus hijos.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the communal bank "Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe II" (Our Lady of Guadalupe II) located in the district of Cojata, Huancané province, in the department of Puno.  She is 39 years old, married, has 4 children and has completed high school.
  
She has been working with the Manuela Rosa Movement for 4 months.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency), money that increased the capital for her business selling groceries, candy, etc.  

She is requesting a new loan for 500 nuevos soles. She will use the loan to buy merchandise for her store. 
	
She dreams that in the future she will have more business capital and be able to educate her children. 

What she likes most about her communal bank are the meetings.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Moses Eyapan

texts.en:
Moses Eyapan E. is a 28-year-old man married to Jackline Barongo Onyancha. They have three children aged five years, two years and eight months. They live in Eldoret, Kenya. Moses sells charcoal, earning an income of Kshs 10,000 per month. He has been in this business for the past five years.

Moses was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and he is applying for his first loan of Kshs 20,000 with KADET LTD. With this loan he plans to purchase 15 bags of charcoal which will add more stock to his business inventory and he will be able to maximize profits.

He hopes that with more income he is going to make to purchase a piece of land and build his own rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase 15 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Hurelbaatar

texts.en: Hurelbaatar B. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Hovd province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in a rented fence. His two children both attend a local secondary school. Hurelbaatar operates a coal and firewood selling business in his town with the help of his sibling. They purchase the coal using their truck and sell it at the local market at retail price. He has engaged this business since 2009 after living and working as a herder in the countryside. His business earnings are the only source of his family income. Hurelbaatar is a modest man and is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to purchase more coal and wood for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more coal and wood

loans.name: Luzmila Hilda

texts.es:
Luzmila es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 50 años, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 02 hijos (01 independiente), realizo estudios de educación secundaria.

Trabaja hace más de 07 años con el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos, su préstamo inicial fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de al por menor de productos de confitería y golosinas.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, comprará  ocho paquetes de huevo para venderlos en la panadería.

Su sueño es tener una empresa para vender productos de Herbalife.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Luzmila is a member of the “3 de Mayo II” communal bank in Puno district, Puno province and department.  She’s 50 years old and in a common law relationship.  She has two children, one of whom is independent.  She finished secondary school.

She has collaborated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for over 7 years.  Her initial loan was for 300 new soles that she invested in her retail sweets and snacks business.

Now she is asking for a 600 new sol loan to buy 8 packages of eggs to sell in the bakery.

Her dream is to have a firm to sell Herbalife products.

What she likes about the communal bank is its punctuality and responsibility.

loans.use: To buy 8 packages of eggs to resell at retail in the bakery.

loans.name: Patient Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Patient” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking for a loan of SLL 800,000.00 for each from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata K.. Fatmata is age thirty-five; she was born in Makeni city, where she is currently residing together with her husband and two children. Her husband is a school teacher and her children are attending primary school. For ten years now, Fatmata has been selling cosmetics, toothpastes and brushes, clothes, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: Buys cosmetics, toothpastes and brushes, clothes, etc. in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es: El señor Aurelio se dedica al transporte de servicio publico trabaja en una  línea de taxi llevando pasajeros de el Torno a la Ciudad de Santa Cruz, vive en casa de sus padres tiene su taxi hace poco y con esta herramienta genera ingresos para el y su familia,  con el dinero del crédito comprara llantas y realizara el mantenimiento de su vehículo es  un joven con muchas ganas de superación y esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
