texts.en: Aurelio works in public transport for a taxi line, taking passengers from the Torno to the city of Santa Cruz. He lives in his parent's home. He has had his taxi for a short time and with this means he generates income for himself and his family. With the money from the loan he will buy tires and get some maintenance done on his vehicle. He is young with a great desire to succeed and he is grateful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: Purchase tires and vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Khath

texts.en: Khath K., age 54, sells firewood for a living. He earns a profit of around $1.40 per day. His wife is a local farmer in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. They are blessed with five children, three of whom are married. The two of them are employed in different jobs in order to provide the family with daily revenue. Presently, Khath K. uses a cart for transporting his products, but it is really hard for him push when it contains a large amount of firewood. To preserve his energy, Khath K. would like to buy a cow to pull his cart. This will help to alleviate the physical strain of running his business.

loans.use: To buy a cow in order to pull his firewood cart

loans.name: Sisters Of Bong Mines Bridge Group

texts.en:
Lorpu Tokpah, who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Sisters Of Bong Mines Bridge.  She is 44 years old, widowed, and has three children between the ages of 23 and 14 years. She was only able to attend school through 6th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For 11 years, she has been selling rice, flour, oil seasonings, etc. in the Bong Mines Bridge Community in Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 60,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 24,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more oil, rice, flour, etc. to resell.  She describes herself as an honest woman whose goals are to improve her business and continue to educate her children.

In the photo, Debra is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more oil, rice, flour, etc. to resell

loans.name: Marvin

texts.en:
Marvin M. is from the village of Sta. Clara Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 26 years old. Marvin is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Marvin owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice to sell. Marvin has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 35,000 PHP every harvest season.

In 2011, Marvin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marvin is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marvin from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba T. is divorced and has three children, all of whom she supports on her own. To make a living, she sells a variety of times: maize, vegetables, bowls and containers. She doesn’t have a shop and carries her wares on her head (as shown in the photograph) to sell in different places. She has been doing this for 18 years. She needs to increase her income so that she can pay for her children’s education. She plans to use the loan to buy more containers to sell.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy N. is a 40-year-old single mother of one child. She has been rearing poultry for the last year and her business is doing well. 

This marks her third loan from KADET; she repaid the previous loans well and good time. She plans to buy more chicks for rearing and subsequent sale.

The anticipated extra profits will be directed into the repayment of the loan and expansion of the business. Lucy’s dream is to own a timber yard and have a bigger chicken farm.

loans.use: to buy more chicks for rearing.

loans.name: Gulhumor's Group

texts.en:
Gulhumor I. is the treasurer of this group. She is 21 and in order to earn money for her livelihood, she takes orders and sews women's dresses. She started this activity four years ago with an initial investment of 1,000 soms and now she earns 2,000 soms per month. Gulhumor started sewing a long time ago. She sewed dresses for her younger sisters when they were children. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase fabrics and materials that are needed for sewing. In the future, Gulhumor dreams of opening a sewing workshop.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and materials

loans.name: Diana Derlis

texts.es:
Diana es soltera de 47 años de edad, tiene casa propia  que cuenta con agua y luz, ubicada en el Cerro de la Virgen, a unos 10 minutos del distrito de Guadalupe,  30 minutos de Pacasmayo y a una hora de la Libertad(Trujillo).  Toda éstas zonas se caracterizan por desarrollar la actividad agricola, ganadera y turismo.
Diana se dedica desde hace unos 10 años ha la elaboración y venta de yogurt natural de todos los sabores en su domicilio y también cría aves de corral (gallinas y pollos) para vender.  Ambas actividades le ayudan ha obtener mayores ingresos para solventarse todos sus gastos que tiene.
Con el préstamo brindado por Edpyme Alternativa de 1600 nuevos soles a Diana, lo utilizará para la compra de más insumos para realizar su yogurt de diversos sabores y también para la compra de aves de corral.  Diana cuenta con una clientela  fija la cual le realiza pedidos semanales y sus ventas le permitirá pagar su crédito como mejorar su calidad de vida.
Diana es conocida por ser una persona alegre, trabajadora  y siempre con las ganas de seguir saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
Diana is single and 47 years old.  She has her own house which has running water and electricity.  She lives in Cerro de la Virgen, about 10 minutes from the distrcit of Guadalupe, 30 minutes from Pacasmayo and an hour from La Libertad (Trujillo).  All of these areas are known for their agriculture, raising of livestock and toursim.
Diana has earned a living for the last 10 years making and selling various flavors of natural yogurt, in her home.  She also raises fowl (hens and chickens) to sell.  Both activities help her to earn a large enough income to meet all her expenses.
With the loan of 1600 PEN ($575 USD) offered by Edpyme Alternativa, Diana will purchase more supplies for making flavored yogurt and more fowl.  Diana has a fixed clientele who place weekly orders.  Her sales will allow her to pay back her loan and to improve her quality of life.
Diana is known for being a happy, hard-working person who is always eager to continue moving forward.

loans.use: to purchase yogurt making supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 33-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two siblings. He has owned a barber shop in his town for 10 years and has 15 years of experience in this occupation. He is well known in the whole region for his good business reputation. He helps his family with his income. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his shop’s decor and make some renovations so that he can welcome the customers in a comfortable place. This will be his fourth Kiva loan.

loans.use: to improve his shop’s decor and make some renovations

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
Rom produces rice wine and raises pigs. Her husband sells grocery items at home. 

The couple lives in a village along National Road Number Two, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have one son and two daughters. One is a garment factory worker and the other two are in school.  

She is asking for a loan of US $500 to help with her pig farming by enabling her to purchase additional pigs and feed for pigs.

loans.use: To purchase additional pigs and feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Tania es vecina  de la comunidad de Cimarrón en Cartago. Ella es se ha dedicado a la agricultura toda su vida. 
Ella decidió tener su propia ganadería es por eso que para iniciar desea  un prestmao de  ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de una vaca lechera. Ella esta muy entusiasmada con su nuevo proyecto, ya que le fascina trabajar con ganado y le gusta elaborar otro tipo de productos como como queso y natilla. Doña Tania asegura que sus ingresos mejoran con lo que su familia esta muy feliz.
Ella es socia de la empresa de crédito comunal Nuevas Esperanzas de Cimarrón, una de las 110 empresas de Credito Comunal socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en: Tania lives in the community of Cimarrón, Cartago, Costa Rica. She has made a living in agriculture all of her life. She decided to have her own livestock, and it's for this reason that she is requesting the loan of 500,000 colones to purchase a milk cow. She is very excited for this new project since she loves working with animals and likes to make dairy products like cheese and sour cream. Tania is confident that her income will improve so her family is very happy. She is a member of the Nuevas Esperanzas de Cimarrón community bank, one of 110 community banks with Kiva partner EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Esquipulas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  Esquipulas , sus integrantes  decidieron ponerle  así por que  le tienen  mucha devoción al santito de Esquipulas el santito morenito . Este grupo esta ubicado  en la ciudad de pinotepa nacional Oaxaca .El grupo  esta conformado  por diez integrantes  que se  conocen  desde hace tres años , son vecinas y familiares.

El representante de este grupo se llama  Evodia tiene cuarenta años de edad  estudio  hasta  quinto  grado de primaria, tiene  cinco hijos  tres mujeres y dos varones. Ella se dedica  a la venta  de tamales y necesita  el préstamo para  comprar loa alimentos que necesita para la elaboración para los tamales.  Sus clientes  quieren un lugar mas grande para comer y se sientan mas a gusto con su familia por que el local donde vende sus tamales esta muy pequeño.
La señora Evodia  también quiere hacer mas grande su local para que tenga mas clientes y así ya no salga a vender por que descuida su local.
La señora Evodia  desea  este préstamo para hacer mas grande su local y obtener mas ganancias y empezar otro negocio le gustaría que fuera de ropa.

Gudelia  Agustina  es otra de las integrantes  del grupo Esquipulas. Tiene  sesenta y ocho años de edad  y  tiene  un  total de nueve hijos  cinco mujeres y cuatro varones  mayores de edad. Ella se dedica  ala venta de pescado  y necesita  el préstamo  para comprar  mas pescado  ya que  vende en el mercado y en su casa .
Sus clientes desean  que  aja  mas grande su negocio  y contrate  personal por su edad por que como ya esta grande se la hace tarde y es una persona que los despacha muy bien que hasta le regala un pescado.
La señora  Gudelia  desea  hacer una tienda de abarrotes.

Los otros  ocho integrantes se llaman :
Jorge- compra  y venta de pescado.
Adriana- compra de insumos para la venta  de comida.
Epifania-Artículos de belleza para trabajar.
María  Felipa- compra de insumos  para  la elaboración  de totopos  para la venta.
Aurora Luz- compra de material  para la elaboración  de manualidades  para la venta.
Eduviges-  venta de zapatos.
Adriana- venta y compra de refrescos , tienda de abarrotes.
Josefina- Compra y Venta de semillas secas.

Están muy agradecidas  con el préstamo que le a dado fundación realidad y por las cosas  que han logrado Cohn su negocio como son.: mas ganancias y mejor calidad de vida .
Gracias fundación realidad
texts.en:
This group is called “Esquipulas.”  The members decided on this name because they are very devoted to the Little Saint of Esquipulas, the brown skinned little saint.  The group is located in the city of Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca.  It has ten members who have known each other for the last three years; they are neighbors and family members. 

The group representative is Evodia.  She’s 40 years old and went up to 5th grade.  She has five children: three girls and two boys.  She sells tamales and needs the loan to buy the food she needs to make tamales.  Her customers would like a larger space to sit down to eat with their families because the place where she sells her tamales is very small.  Evodia also wants to enlarge her locale to have more customers so that she won’t have to go out to sell any longer and neglect her locale.  Evodia wants this loan to enlarge her locale and to earn more profits to start another business; she’d like it to be clothes sales.

Gudelia Agustina is another member of the Esquipulas group.  She is 68 years old and has nine children: five girls and four boys, all adults.  She sells fish and needs the loan to buy more fish because she sells both at home and at the market.  Her customers would like her to enlarge the business and hire personnel because of her age; since she’s already older it gets late for her and she’s a person who takes care of them very well, she even gives away a fish.  Gudelia would like to open a grocery store.

The other eight members are:

Jorge - to buy fish.

Adriana - to buy ingredients to make meals.

Epifania - to buy beauty supplies.

María Felipa - to buy ingredients to make fried tortilla chips to sell.

Aurora Luz - to buy materials to make crafts to sell.

Eduviges -  to sell shoes.

Adriana - to buy beverages, grocery store.

Josefina - to buy dry seeds to sell.


They are very grateful for the loan that Fundación Realidad has granted them and for the things they’ve accomplished with their businesses like: more profits and a better quality of life.  Thank you Fundación Realidad.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make and sell tamales.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: This is 33-year-old Fatmata.  She is married and has 3 children aged 13, 10, and 6. She has 1 additional dependant (her mother) who lives with her. In 2005, Fatmata established her timber business. She started her business because she wants to assist her husband in taking care of the home. This is her major source of income. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 900,000 every month. She would like a loan of Le 3,000,000 to buy a power saw. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Fatmata plans to develop her land, to buy an additional power saw and to educate her children. The rising cost of petrol and the cost of a power saw are her challenges. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy a power saw

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Margaret, 33, is a hardworking business lady. She is married and blessed with three school-going children. For the past 11 years, she has been running a general shop to make a living, supplementing this with earnings from engaging in dairy farming. In the next five years, she wants to have upgraded her shop into a mini-supermarket. Her dream is to be financially stable.

Margaret is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy two bags of sugar, a bag of rice, maize flour and a carton of bar soap. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy two bags of sugar, a bag of rice, maize flour and a carton of bar soap.

loans.name: Kwembe Group

texts.en:
Anna, who is in her early 30s, is single with two children.  One of them goes to school. She has been running a fried fish business for 1 year now. She goes to the ferry fish market where fishermen sell fresh fish at 4a.m. She fries them and then takes them to sell at a place near her home, on the road side. She goes home when the fish are sold at around 9p.m. She is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more fish to sell and has successfully repaid this loan. She wants a loan to increase her fish stock and to buy a display case for her fish business. Her dream is to one day be able to buy land.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Kwembe" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase stock and to buy a display case for her fish business.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca”, ubicado en el distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 57 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 6 hijos, todos independientes.  No cuenta con estudios.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un ciclo,  su primer préstamo  fue por la suma de  S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementó a su negocio de compra y venta de vacas y chanchos.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de  S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, incrementará al capital que tiene y  comprará una vaca para su engorde por un mes.  En el negocio a veces sus hijos le ayudan, también dice que trabaja en la chacra.
Su sueño es seguir  con el negocio de venta de ganado.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la ganancia del ahorro.
texts.en:
Pascuala is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Estrellitas Unidas de Titicaca” (The United Little Stars of Titicaca) which is located in the District of Pilcuyo, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 57 years old, widowed, and has six children, all of whom are independent. Pascuala did not receive an education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for one loan cycle. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 PEN and the money helped to increase her business of buying and selling cows and pigs.

This new loan of 500 PEN will increase her capital so that she can buy a cow that she will fatten for one month. Her children occasionally help her with her business. Pascuala says she also works on a farm.

Her dream is to continue working in her business of selling livestock. What she likes most about the Communal Bank is the interest from her savings.

loans.use: to buy a cow for fattening.

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.es: Celedonia es socia del Banco Comunal Los Laureles, tiene 51 años y 6 hijos, dos de ellos todavía estan a su cargo. Celedonia tiene un Bar- Restaurante, ella esta en Finca desde sus inicios, le invitó Morenita y Wiracocha (ambos fundadores de FINCA Peru), cuando ella ingresó sólo habían 2 bancos: Abejitas y Esperanza, y ella pertenecía a Abejitas, recuerda con mucha nostalgia a ella le dieron 50 soles y cada semana tenia que llevar 5 soles, agradece mucho a Finca ya que no solo tiene su Restaurante sino también tiene una Stand en un Centro Comercial, tambien tiene 2 taxis que los hace trabajar, ella creció junto con Finca agradece todo lo que tiene ya que le ayudaron a poder ser mas perseverante y responsable, en sus negocios y con sus pagos, le encanta el ahorro, ahora su meta es poder terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en: Celedonia is a member of the "Los Laureles" ("The Laurels") community bank. She is 51 years old and has 6 children, two of whom are still dependent on her. Celedonia owns a cafe/restaurant. She has been with FINCA since the very beginning. Morenita and Wiracocha, both founders of FINCA Peru, invited her to join. When she did there were only two communal banks: "Abejitas" ("Little Bees") and "Esperanza" ("Hope"). She fondly remembers that she was given 50 soles and that she had to pay back 5 soles every week. She is very grateful to FINCA because now she not only has her restaurant but also space in a shopping centre. She also owns two cabs that work for her. She has grown alongside FINCA and she is grateful for everything she has, because they helped her to become more persistent and responsible in her business and payments. She enjoys saving and her goal now is to finish building her home.

loans.use: to stock up on products for her restaurant.

loans.name: Khut

texts.en: This borrower is from Kompong Speu Province, Cambodia. Khut is 45 years old, married and has eight children. Two of them are married and live separately, and the other children are all single.  Two of her children are employed as sewing factory workers in Phnom Penh city where they can earn enough salary for each month. Presently, Khut has been generating a business as a rice cultivator. To upgrade her family's living standard, she is asking for a loan from HKL a Kiva partner. The purpose of this loan will be to repair her broken house. She hopes that all donors will support her family. She is very thankful in advance.

loans.use: to repair her broken house.

loans.name: Oydona

texts.ru: Ойдона проживает в районе Хамадони. Она вдова. Ей 51 год. У нее детей нет. Она более 15 лет занимается растениеводством. В основном она выращивает овощи и бахчевые культуры. Целью получения кредита является закуп топлива и необходимых удобрений для обработки земли.
texts.en: Oydona lives in the Hamadoni district.  She is 51 years old, a widow and has no children.  She has been involved in agriculture for over 15 years.  She primarily grows vegetables and melon crops.  The goal of this loan is to buy fuel and necessary fertilizers for land treatment.

loans.use: to buy fuel and necessary fertilizers for land treatment

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia Teresa tiene 55 años D. edad y está casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene 3 hijos, ella tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes, ella venD. productos D. primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar y leche también venD. golosinas, fideos, gaseosas entre otros productos más, ella también venD. productos D. belleza como por ejemplo cremas, colonias, perfumes entre otros más D. las líneas D. Avon, Unique y Dupre. La socia está feliz con sus negocios ya que mediante estas actividades ella pueD. estar más tiempo con sus hijos.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra D. más mercadería como por ejemplo sacos D. arroz, sacos D. azúcar y otras cosas más. 

La socia pertenece al banco comunal” UNION, FUERZA Y AMISTAD” y las reuniones del banco comunal son el distrito D. wanchaq D. la provincia del Cusco del departamento D. Cusco.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Member Teresa, 55, is married and has three children from this relationship.  She has a small grocery store.  She sells basic necessities such as, for example, rice, sugar, and milk, as well as sweets, pasta, and sodas, among other products.  At the same time, Teresa also sells beauty products like creams, cologne, and perfume, among other Avon, Unique, and Dupree products.  She is happy with her business since through these activities she can spend more time with her children.

Teresa is requesting the loan to buy more merchandise such as, for example, rice, sacks of sugar, and other things.

She belongs to Unión, Fuerza y Amistad Communal Bank.  The communal bank meetings are in the Wanchaq district in the province of Cusco in the department of Cusco.

Teresa is happy about the loan and is committed to making the repayments.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her businesses.

loans.name: Fabulous Virtuous Women (A) Group

texts.en:
Doreen is 33 years old and lives in Harare. She is married to a pastor; they have one child and look after three more dependents.

Doreen travels to Mozambique and Tanzania to buy clothes which she sells in the local market.  She has been doing this for two years and business is going well, but there is a lot of competition in the market. Doreen will use the loan buy more goods to sell and she hopes to continue to take further loans.  Doreen hopes that the profit will go towards making the family a little better off.  She hopes to be able to open a clothing store in the central business district if things go well.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco, vive con su esposa y un hijo, tienen casa propia, y él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, pipián, pepino y chile guaco, este oficio lo desarrolla desde hace 10 años, lo realiza todos los días de la semana, él aprendió por medio de su padre y hoy en día depende tanto él como su familia, de este cultivo.  
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos, abono y herbicidas, esta inversión le ayudara para tener todo lo necesario para la cosecha, con la esperanza de que tenga una buena produccion.
Su aspiración es ser un agricultor de éxito, obteniendo buenos resultados, con abundantes cosechas, y además ser un buen cliente con moral de pago en la institución.
texts.en:
Francisco lives with his wife and a son, he has his own house, and he works growing corn, pipián fruit, cucumbers, chiles, and guaco plants. He has been doing this for 10 years. 

He works every day of the week. He learned from his father, and now his family depends on this crop. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and herbicides. This loan will hep him to have everything he needs for the harvest, with the hope of having a good production.

His dream is to be a successful farmer, obtaining good results, with abundant  harvests, and to be a good client with a good payment history with the community bank.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 17 years now.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Tashinga Group

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Hopewell from Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe.  He is married with four children, all of whom are still in school

Hopewell runs a agriculture business selling fruit and vegetables. The business has been in operation for 2 years. He says the main challenges he faces are the storage of perishable goods and competition. 

Hopewell has requested a loan of $400.00 to buy vegetables and fruit. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to improve the family's standard of living. In the future, Hopewell plans to open a grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy some fresh produce for sale

loans.name: Bertha Maria

texts.es:
Berta de 57 años de edad, casada, originaria de Granada madre de un hijo, mayor de edad, de oficio comerciante, dueña de una pulpería. Inicio con una pequeña venta de hielo, helados, golosinas a medida que fue vendiendo y ganando clientes introdujo mas productos como avena, sopas, enlatados, papel de baño, productos de limpieza y cuando se dio cuenta  tenia una mini pulpería ya lleva 7 años de negocio y ha sido el primero. 
Ella requiere el préstamo para compra de mercadería tales como arroz, azúcar, aceite, snacks, productos de limpieza, cosméticos. Pues el financiamiento le ayudara a ofrecer variedad de productos que suplen las necesidades de sus clientes. Pues su objetivo primordial es que sea un negocio estable que le ayude a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Bertha, a native of Granada, is married, 57 years old, and the mother of one grown son. She is a business woman and owner of a convenience store. 
She began with a modest trade in ice, ice cream, and candies. As she went on making sales and attracting more customers, she began to introduce more products like oats, soups, canned foods, toilet paper, and cleaning products until she realized she had the makings of a small convenience store. Now she's been in business, this being her first, for 7 years.

She needs this loan to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, oils, snacks, cleaning products, and cosmetics. This financing will help her to offer a variety of products that will meet the needs of her customers. Her objective, then, is that hers be a stable business that helps her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, oils, snacks, cleaning products, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Wendy Pamela

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal La Amistad se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par” por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Wendy, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 7 años de edad el mismo que estudia en  escuela. Actualmente está en su sexto mes de embarazo de su segundo hijo. Su marido es dueño de un taxi en el cual trabaja.

Ella en sociedad con su esposo, además de su taxi tienen una sala de entretenimiento, en el cual jóvenes y adultos se distraen un momento y se desestresan del trabajo o de sus estudios, ella trabaja todos los días en este local el mismo que es alquilado ya que aún no han podido comprar un  local propio, allí también ella vende refrescos, sodas y bocadillos,  además de videojuegos, lleva seis años con su negocio y les va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar sodas, jugos y bocadillos. Lleva tres ciclos en el  Banco Comunal, es la secretaria del banco y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y de gran ayuda.

Su sueño es tener un local propio para no tener que pagar arriendos.
texts.en:
The 'La Amistad' (Friendship) community bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful city of Calceta.  This city is known as 'Calceta la sin par' (Calceta, the city with no equal) owing to the beauty of its women and because, so far as its residents are concerned, there is no more beautiful city in the world.

Here we meet Wendy.  She is 25 years old, married, and has a 7-year-old son who is in school.  She is currently six months pregnant with her second child.  Her husband owns a taxi in which he works.

Wendy works in partnership with her husband.  In addition to the taxi, they also have an entertainment center where young people and adults can have fun and de-stress from their work or their studies.  Wendy works there every day.  The premises are rented as they have not yet been able to buy premises of their own.  Wendy also sells soft drinks, soda, sandwiches and video games there.  She has been in her business for six years and it is doing very well.

Wendy has been a member of her community bank for three loan cycles.  She is the bank's secretary and she likes it because they loans are quick and very helpful.

Wendy's dream is to own her own premises so that she no longer has to pay rent.

loans.use: to buy soda, juice and sandwiches

loans.name: Maame Esi

texts.en:
Even though Maame Esi grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, she is a petty trader. She prepares and sells fried fish and kenkey (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough wrapped in banana leaves) for a living. She primarily sells her kenkey in Cape Coast. Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began five years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their seven children. 

Maame Esi has identified that there is growing demand among consumers for her kenkey. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to a limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize and fish, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty kenkey and fish. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame Esi wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize and fish, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty kenkey and fish.

loans.name: Sithokozile

texts.en:
Sithokozile is a 19-year-old entrepreneur who lives in the Nkayi District, Zimbabwe. 

She rents a shop at the local school where she sells bread, sweets, tea, sugar, snacks, cooking oil and milk. She sells mostly to the teachers and students. With the Kiva loan, she will purchase more groceries in order to increase her sales and profits. She will use the profits to further her studies so that she can achieve a better quality of life. 

As an active member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network, Sithokozile volunteers to teach young women on how to behave. Through Cama, she also helps the elderly by fetching them firewood and water.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
My name is Alejandro V.. I have been working for 40 years as a carpenter. I love this job, and I learned it from my father. From that time I have made several types of wood furniture, like kitchens, doors and cabinets. I feel a great satisfaction because I had the opportunity to provide a college education to my son, thanks to this business. But I still have responsibilities with my family and new projects to make.

I would like to start making wood moldings. There is a good demand in the local market, but I need to buy new machinery to make them. This is why I require an industrial winch. I’m planning to obtain this equipment through a loan of $1200 and to pay back in a term of 1 year. With this new machinery I can make a new product, grow the business, and give a better life to my family

Spanish

Mi nombre es Alejandro V. me dedico a la carpintería desde hace mas de 40 años siento un gusto especial por este oficio, el cual aprendí de mi padre, desde ese tiempo he fabricado varias clases de muebles de madera así como cocinas, puertas y gabinetes. Siento un a gran satisfacción por haber proporcionado una carrera profesional a mi hijo gracias a este negocio, pero aun tengo responsabilidades con mi familia y nuevos proyectos que cumplir, como la elaboración de molduras de madera, las cuales requieren de un torno Industrial el cual planeo conseguir a través de un préstamo de $1200.00 y pagarlos en un plazo de 1 año, con ello podré elaborar un producto diferente en el mercado, el cual tiene mucha demanda y proporcionar mejores condiciones de vida para mi familia.

loans.use: buy machinery and raw materials

loans.name: Ismail Mamedov

texts.en: Ismail is an IDP from occupied Jebrail district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993. Married, has three children. He started his business in 1996, and borrowed four Normicro loans from Baku branch totalling $2200. Now he is willing to borrow $500.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Ciriaca

texts.en:
Ciriaca works with her second son. She has a car which she uses to collect milk from the rural Altiplano de La Paz area and transport it to a commercial dairy called PIL Andina. This is the source of income for herself and her three children, who live in the Villa Bolivar neighborhood of Al Alto. The loan will increase her working capital so that she can purchase the amount of milk demanded by the dairy. She has a good credit history with IMPRO which lets her seek this loan to help raise her income and the standard of living of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Ciriaca trabaja con su 2do hijo; tiene un carro con el que recolecta leche de vaca de las áreas rurales del Altiplano de La Paz (zona rural conocida por ese nombre), para comercializarlo a la empresa industrializadota de leche PIL Andina S.A. Esta se constituye en su fuente de ingreso para la manutención a sus tres hijos, vive en la zona Villa Bolívar de la Ciudad de El Alto. El destino del crédito es para incrementar capital de trabajo, de esa forma comprar la cantidad de leche demandada por la empresa PIL Andina. Su historial crediticio con Impro es bueno, lo que le permite acceder a otro crédito para incrementar sus ingresos económicos u mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en:
A. Anvar began his business selling goods that were useful for the local ecomony: building studs, paint enamel, building mixture, lacquer, and so on. One of his most popular goods was polyethylene tape. When MicroInvest began working in his region, he approached them for a loan $5000 to build his business. But MicroInvest did not loan such amounts, as there was no individual crediting at that time. 
He took out a loan of $400 from MicroInvest, which he put into building his shop. But he did not forget about his idea and borrowed money from relatives to start producing polyethylene tape. 
Today, he would like to increase production of polyethylene tape to meet the demands of repeat clients. The loan will enable him to purchase raw materials required. The loan sum is $1200.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Aged 35, Mrs. Abra A. is married and mother of four children. She abandoned her studies at a young age to take up the business of selling generic pharmaceuticals. It is a flourishing business, and one which needs plenty of resources. Aware of the danger of exposing drugs to the sun, Mrs. A. would like to build a kiosk in order to display the products and to protect them from the sun. This would require significant funds that she does not have. She is therefore requesting a loan of $900 to build a kiosk and stock it with all kinds of generic pharmaceuticals. This will cause growth in her clientele and thus her income. As a result of this loan and the development of her business, Mrs. A.’s socioeconomic standard of living will improve considerably.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 35 ans, Madame A. Abra est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Elle a vite abandonné ses études primaires pour ce se lancer dans le commerce des produits génériques. C’est un commerce florissant et qui nécessite assez de moyens. Consciente du danger d’exposer les médicaments au soleil, elle veut construire un kiosque pour pouvoir exposer les produits et les mettre à l’abri du soleil. Ceci nécessite beaucoup de moyens financiers dont Madame A. Abra ne dispose pas. Pour ce faire elle sollicite un crédit de $900 pour la construction du kiosque et s’approvisionner en toute sorte de produits génériques. Ceci augmentera sa clientèle ainsi que ses revenus. Grâce à ce financement, la condition de vie socio économique connaîtra une parfaite amélioration pour un développement meilleur.

loans.use: To build a kiosk from which to sell generic pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Mrs. Deborah I. is 50 years old, married with 6 children and lives in Benin City.  She has been with LAPO for 3 years and has been running her fruit business since 1999.  She hopes to buy more fruit with the loan amount of $250.  She hopes to pay back the loan in eight months.

loans.use: To buy more fruits

loans.name: Elnara

texts.en:
Elnara is a 30-year-old woman who lives in the southern small village of Fatalikend in the Saatli region. She is married and has two children. She has sold dairy products such as milk and yogurt for more than five years. She has her permanent customers, and many local people and bazaar traders come to her house to purchase dairy every day.

She thinks that now it is time to expand her business because demand for these products has increased very much. Sometimes the number of orders exceeds the number of products her cow can make. She applied for 1200 USD to purchase one milk cow to increase her number of sales, and for two calves for breeding. The estimated cost for one cow is 700 USD and for one calf is 200-250 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase one milk cow and two calves

loans.name: Mauricio Martínez

texts.es:
Mauricio Martinez is a married man with 3 school-age children. His children have been the reason that he tries so hard to provide them with a stable family life and an education for their future. For the past 22 years Mauricio Martinez has sold cosmetics. This is a profitable businesss in his neighborhood, his sales have increased considerably year after year. His start-up capital was from the severance pay he received from where he used to work.

Mauricio has worked with CEPRODEL since a year ago and is pleased with the loans he has been granted as they have been given in opportune moments, helping him to meet the needs of his business and those of his customers. He has a track record of 10 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Mauricio Martínez es un hombre casado y con 3 hijos los cuales se encuentran en la edad escolar. Sus hijos han sido la razón para que el se superara y por ellos es que el se ha esforzado, brindándoles así una familia estable y una educación para el futuro de ellos. Desde hace 22 años Mauricio Martínez tiene su venta de cosméticos. Este negocio es un negocio rentable hoy en día en su sector, sus ventas incrementaron considerablemente al paso de los años. Su capital de inicio fue de su liquidación de donde el laboraba.

Mauricio trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 1 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. El tiene un record de 10 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose G. is married and has three children in elementary school. For the last 17 years, he has been in the business of making sports uniforms for businesses and schools. His company has expanded since it began, and now he works with two employees.

Jose’s business is in a lucrative part in the city of San Lorenzo, where schools, businesses and club sports always need uniforms. With this loan, he plans to buy the material and other accessories he needs to make more uniforms.

loans.use: To buy clothing and accessories to sell in his store.

loans.name: La Xmi

texts.en:
Mrs. Laxmi K. lives in Thecho, Lalitpur, Nepal. She lives in a single family with her husband, Mr. Gopal K., and her children. Her husband is a teacher. Her daughter is studying in grade 10 and her son is in grade 8.

Mrs. Karmarcharya opened a grocery store three years ago to improve the living standards of her family. Due to lack of funds, she can’t buy goods for her shop. So, she is asking for her fourth loan of Rs 25000.00 to buy goods like rice, dhal (lentils), noodles, etc.

She needs the additional income to provide education for her son and wishes to help her husband to improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her shop

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella O. is a fashion designer and also sells drinks. She is married with 2 children and is 37 years old. She hails from Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in business for four years. She needs the loan amount of $700 to buy more male and female materials for sale.

loans.use: To buy male and female materials for sale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 45 year old widow and mother of four living children. She lives in Sagam Siaya in Kenya. She runs a jaggery business that she started in 2000. She buys her products from Mumias Sugar Factory and then supplies the goods to her customers. She requires $800.00 to purchase more supplies.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar products to sell

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en:
Shavkat K. is 33 years old. He is married (his wife's name is Umriniso), and he is the father of 4 children.

Shavkat works hard on the farm, along with Umriniso, in order to make his children happy and to provide them with a good education. In his farming operation, he grows and sells crops such as tomatoes, onions, potatoes, cucumbers, carrots, apricots, peaches, and apples.

With the onset of the sowing season, he is planning to sow onions, potatoes, and carrots, which is why he is seeking a loan. In particular, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000 Somoni ($600), to be repaid within 12 months, in order to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds. After gathering his yield, he wants to sell them to local inhabitants at prices that are lower than in the market. He promises to repay the loan in a timely manner. Shavkat and his hopeful wife are counting on your help, and he expresses his deep gratitude to everyone for supporting him.

loans.use: To take advantage of the upcoming season by purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer and to thereafter sell his fruits and vegetables in the market for affordable prices

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Wilmer G. me dedico a la venta de ropa usada, actividad que realizo hace 5 años, vivo en la casa de mi madre ya que tengo problemas fisicos, me negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de nuestro hogar, ya que solo mi madre y yo salimos adelante juntos en esta situacion de nuestro pais que es muy dificil conseguir trabajos fijos, en estos momentos necesito comprar mas ropa para tener mayores ganancias las cuales las necesitamos para remodelar nuestra casa de habitacion, por lo tanto les solicito ayuda monetaria para poder salir adelante con mi negocio.

loans.use: compra de fardos de ropa usada

loans.name: Estrellas De Panamericana Group

texts.es:
Strips of pork, pickling brine, a little hot pepper, bread and a good and toasted skin are the ingredients in the preparation of the exquisite traditional Bolivian Chola sandwich. These sandwiches are sold in specific parts of the city, primarily in the streets. The sale of these sandwiches is quite common among the 10 women who compose the association “Panamerican Stars,” a long time partner of Pro-Mujer.

Beyond the general street sales, the sandwich also sells well at large events such as soccer games and concerts. Due to the market that is expanding in these specialized sectors it is necessary to increase production of these sandwiches. The women of Panamerican Stars request a loan in order to purchase supplies in bulk. It is guaranteed that the women’s sales will increase as will their profits.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

lonjas de carne de cerdo, escabeche, un poco de ají picante, pan sarnita y un cuerito bien crocante, son los ingredientes para preparar los exquisitos y tradicionales Sándwich de Chola (denominación tradicional en algunos lugares del País) Estos se los vende en distintos lugares de la ciudad por lo general de forma ambulante, esta es una actividad muy común dentro la asociación Estrellas de Panamericana” grupo compuesto por 10 mujeres que trabajan hace mucho tiempo con Pro-Mujer Este tipo de sándwich también tiene una buena comercialización en eventos como ser partidos de fútbol, conciertos y otros, por lo que eventualmente necesitan duplicar su producción, es por eso que solicitan créditos para la compra de insumos en cantidad. Es seguro que duplicaran también sus ventas y mejorar ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies in bulk for preparation of traditional sandwiches.

loans.name: Ismail Rashid's Kichangani Group

texts.en:
Ismail R. is 47 and married with 5 children. For the past two years, he has run a vegetable business. He heads upcountry to places like Iringa and Lushoto once a week to purchase vegetables. He then brings them back to Dar es Salaam and sells them wholesale to vendors in the market. His monthly profit is about US$ 300.

This will be Ismail's first loan from Tujijenge and he is very excited to get started! He intends to use this loan to purchase a large amount of tomatoes to sell in the markets around Dar es Salaam. Ismail will share this loan with his subgroup, whose members guarantee one another in paying back their loans. Others in the group are engaged in a wide variety of businesses, including tailoring, café ownership, tending a grocery store, and utensils seller.

In the photo, Ismail is in the center with the white shirt.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes to sell in the market

loans.name: Mrs. Oin Ly Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people, all of whom live in Cheung Voat Village in Kampong Cham Province, have formed a village bank. Mrs. Oin L. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who cultivates her crops twice a year. In the rainy season, Mrs. Oin L. grows rice, and in the dR. season she grows vegetables. PresentL., however, she faces a small problem in her field, as she needs fertilizer, which is quite expensive. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Oin L. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers in order to make her fields more productive. Her husband, Mr. Kol Min, helps his wife in their rice plantation. They have two children, both of whom are construction workers who contribute to their famiL.'s small income.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainL. end-of-term loans. Twelve members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthL. payment loans. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. This type of loan allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financialL. able to do so. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the veR. end of the loan term, but most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of onL. 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers in order to make fields more productive.

loans.name: Cesar Ramón

texts.es:
El caballero Cesar F. desde muy niño se ha dedicado a la actividad agropecuaria la cual atiende con gran esfuerzo en el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León. Es necesario destacar que este caballero es muy entregado al trabajo por lo que tiene la obligación de mantener a sus cuatro hijos de los cuales dos de ellos están cursando la universidad en estos momentos.

La necesidad qeu hoy en dia atraviesa es que no posee capital financier para invertir en sus cultivos y es por esta razon que acude a Ceprodel para obtener el credito para la compra de un area para desarrollar los cultivos.
texts.en:
The gentleman Cesar F. from a very young age has been dedicated to the activity of agriculture, which he has attended with great strength in the municipality of Telica in the city of Leon. It is necessary to highlight that this gentleman is very involved in his work because he has the obligation to take care of his four children, of whom two are studying at the university at the moment.

The need that he is encountering now is that he doesn't have the financial capital to invest in the crops and for this reason that he approached Ceprodel to obtain a lone to buy an area to increase his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying agricultural materials

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal S., 34, is married and lives with her two children and husband in Battambong province, Cambodia. She opened a beauty salon shop and sometimes she is hired to arrange clothes for grooms and brides for their weddings. On average, she makes US$3 each day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver and he is able to make US$2.50 a day.

Phal S. would like to take out a loan of US$500 to purchase more decorative materials.

loans.use: To purchase more decorative materials.

loans.name: Phidel

texts.fr: Ce brave monsieur vend du poisson au quai de pêche de Boudody. Grâce à cette activité, il arrive à entretenir ses 4 enfants. Il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des bacs afin d'augmenter sa capacité de stocker du poisson. Il a une expérience avérée dans le secteur.
texts.en:
This courageous man sells fish on the Boudody fishing dock. Thanks to this activity he is able to provide for his four children. He is requesting this loan to buy tubs in order to increase his ability to stock fish. He has a solid experience in this business.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fish

loans.name: Salemalama

texts.en: Salemalama A., 27, is single with no children.  She has 2 months of experience in a taro and banana business. She sells to the village people and public 1 day per week. She is a new member, with just one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 80 Tala.  SPBD loans are Salemalama’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is twenty-eight years old. She is single. Comfort lives alone in a rented apartment in a suburb of Accra. She sells porridge and maize in her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed popularly as breakfast by many Ghanaians. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and taken with sugar, milk and bread.

With a large customer base, Comfort wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials such as bags of maize, millet, sugar, and milk to increase production. She also wants to upgrade her maize sales. She hopes to raise good income to build her own shop before she gets into a marriage.

loans.use: To buy millet and maize to produce porridge for sale

loans.name: Saidamo

texts.en:
Saidamo has a very good sense of humor and her jovial spirit helps her face difficult times.  She’s been immersed in raising animals since her childhood and, for that reason, she decided to remain in this industry. 

She works very hard to obtain the income that will satisfy her family’s necessities.  The immense love that she feels from her children and her faithful husband motivates her to keep working hard.  She wishes to buy more animals and, in this way, increase her income.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. 

The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  

While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition.  Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.  To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle for expanding the business

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward N. is thirty-seven years old. He is married and has four children, one son and three daughters. According to him, all his daughters are in basic school while his son has yet to start to school. His wife is takes care of his provision store. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming.

Edward is a barber by profession and at the same time runs a provision store in which he sells products such as sugar, milk, "milo" (a cocoa beverage), toffees, etc. He says he buys his goods from Nkawkaw, a nearby city. His shop is by the roadside in his community. Edward has been in business for five years. He says a severe rain storm brought down his barber shop. He wants a loan to procure various provisions to stock his shop. He aspires to give his children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure provisions

loans.name: Vilma Esperanza

texts.en:
Vilma Esperanza is married with three children, the eldest of whom is currently enrolled in school. Her business is selling bicycle parts and she has a person who works with her to help make sales. Vilma also sells cell phones and phone cards and in her spare time when she is in her house, she raises pigs. Her husband works full time selling building materials and his income helps to support her and their children. Vilma is requesting this loan to better stock her business with more bicycle parts. She would also like to buy more pigs. Vilma’s dreams are to one day have another business and that her children have an opportunity to continue studying.

*******************************************
Translated from Spanish by Andrea Bouch, Kiva Fellow.
*******************************************

Vilma Esperanza, es casada tiene tres hijos y la mas grande esta estudiando. Ella se dedica a vender repuestos de bicicletas y tiene una persona quien le ayuda a vender, también vende teléfonos celulares y tarjetas, y en sus tiempos libres que esta en su casa tiene una crianza de marranos, su esposo trabaja en una venta de materiales de construcción para ayudarla a ella y a sus hijos, su credito lo necesita para seguir surtiendo  su negocio y para comprar mas marranos, sus sueños son tener otro negocio y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: To buy more bicycle parts

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina N., 20, is married with three children. She has many years of experience in the food-stall business. She sells to the general public three days per week.

She has had two previous loans with SPBD, a Kiva partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 1250 Tala (about $520). SPBD loans are Christina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase chicken, oil, onions, garlic, soya, rice, cooking pot

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
S. Nguyễn Thị (538041047) is a 51 year-old female living in the town of Nam Định. She is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living S. owns and operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale. S. has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4500000 VND a month.

In 2004, S. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. S. successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000000 VND from TYM Fund that she used to purchase young livestock to raise and sell in the future. S. is now requesting a loan of 20000000 VND which she will use to expand her business. The loan will be her 6th loan from TYM Fund. S. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: To invest in and expand her business.

loans.name: Maxey

texts.en:
Maxey K. is 42-years old and widowed with four children all in school. She is the owner of Kijjana Pearl Gardens located on old Masaka Road, Kalisizo Town Council. She has a bar and restaurant business selling all kinds of beers and different foods.

She will use her loan to repair her fridge, to purchase a machine for preparing chips, to acquire DSTV, and then she will use the balance to purchase more beers and spirits. Her future dream is to obtain a bigger bar selling beers, wines, spirits and a variety of food types.

loans.use: To repair her fridge, purchase a machine for preparing chips, acquire DSTV,  and use the balance to purchase more beer and spirits.

loans.name: Pulatoy

texts.ru: Асророва  Пулатой – молодая  женщина  1986  года,  замужем,  детей пока  не  имеет.  Она  вместе  с  мужем  Кобиловым  Баходуром  около  четырёх  лет занимается  откормом  скота.  Её  муж  покупает  скот  по  низкой  цене  у  пастухов  и  откормив  несколько  недель  продаёт  их  на  скотном  рынке  Джаббор-Расуловского  рынка.  Когда  Пулотой  узнала  про  нашу  организацию  она  решила  кредитоваться  у  нас.  На  полученный  займ  она  собирается  купить  дойную  корову  и  продавать  молоко,  тем  самым  пополняя  семейный  бюджет.  Баходур  доволен  выбором  жены  и  поддержал  её.
texts.en:
Born in 1986, Pulatoy A. is a young married woman, who does not yet have children. Pulatoy and her husband, Bahodur Kobilov, have been involved in livestock feeding for about 4 years. The husband buys the livestock at a low price from shepherds and, having fed it for several weeks, sells the livestock at the livestock market in the Jabbor-Rasulov district. Once Pulatoy learned about our organization, she decided to obtain a loan from us. She plans to use this loan to purchase a dairy cow and be able to sell milk, and, thus, increase their family budget. Bahodur is happy with his wife’s choice and fully supports her.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Badamhand

texts.en:
Badamhand S. is a 55-year-old widow who lives with her 22-year-old daughter in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. She has raised four children and her husband passed away quite some time ago. She currently lives with her youngest daughter who is a student in a local university. 

Badamhand runs a small sewing shop. She makes various customized clothes for women according to her customers' requests. She started her small shop in 1990 with her old sewing machine. Since then, she has been running her sewing shop for 19 years and has retained regularly visiting customers. She says that with her sewing business, she has been able to raise four children who are all highly educated and doing well on their own now. She requests a loan to purchase necessary materials for her sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her business

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo tiene 57 años de edad, vive con su esposa Martha y con sus 2 hijos que son solteros, pero trabajan para solventar sus gastos propios y apoyar en su hogar. Guillermo se dedica a la preparación y venta de dulces caseros; como rosquillas, biscochos, biscochuelos, etc., estos deliciosos postres los elabora con la ayuda de su esposa, para luego llevarlos al horno que él mismo construyó en su casa. Para la comercialización de estos dulces, cuenta con 3 personas quienes se dedican a venderlos por los diferentes lugares de su zona. A Guillermo le gusta su trabajo porque de esa manera se siente útil, ya que hace 8 años atrás sufrió un accidente que no le permitió seguir laborando regularmente. Pero ahora con su propio negocio, está obtiendo ganancias muy satisfactorias, las cuales está ahorrando poco a poco para llegar a tener una panadería. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que sus compañers le inspiranron confianza desde el primer momento que empezó a trabajar con ellos, además que todos son muy responsables con sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará grandes cantidades de los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus dulces; como harina, almidón, aceite, huevos, azúcar, entre otros.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 57 years old and lives with his wife Martha and two children, who are single and work to pay their own expenses and provide support at home. Guillermo prepares and sells homemade sweets – such as donuts, cookies, cakes, etc. These delicious pastries are made with the help of his wife and then baked in the oven he built in his home. In order to market his products, he hired three people to sell them in different parts of the district. Guillermo enjoys his work because he feels useful. Eight years ago, he suffered an accident and was not able to work on a regular basis. He began saving money a little bit at a time until he had enough to start a bakery. Now that he has his own business, he is able to earn a decent income.

This is his 4th loan with MFP. He enjoys working with his communal bank group, in whom he has had great confidence from the first moment he began working with them. All of them have been responsible with their payments. With the money he is requesting, Guillermo will buy large quantities of ingredients needed to prepare his sweets – flour, starch, oil, eggs, sugar and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Peter Kingori

texts.en:
Peter K. is 57-years-old. He is married to Faith Wanjiru and is the father of five children.

Peter owns a motorbike spare parts shop in Narok that he has been running for three years.

He was introduced to KADET by a friend who is a KADET client. This will be his second loan and he hopes to expand his business from retail to wholesale, and to become a wholesale distributor in Narok. He believes he is a great entrepreneur who can venture into real business once empowered.

loans.use: To increase stock for his motorbike spare parts business

loans.name: Unidos Por El Progreso Group

texts.en:
Pilar A., pictured far right, is the bright and engaging leader of the group Unidos por el Progreso (United in Progress). This group has proven themselves extremely credit worthy after taken out and successfully repaying 5 loans together. Each time they take out a larger loan in the attempt to grow there business even more. 

Pilar started out just selling coal from her house. With every loan she is growing her business even more and now she also sells fried foods, fresh juices, and fish. With this loan, she will add fruits and vegetables to her inventory. Her goal is to grow her business enough to one day open up a full blown restaurtant. Pilar is an extremely hard worker and when she isn´t running her business from her home, she works as a house cleaner for her neighbors. 

You can help Pilar and the rest of the women in the Unidos por el Progreso group achieve their dreams by funding this loan!

loans.use: coal, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo y su hija de 5 añitos que cursa estudios iniciales. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, cuenta con una pequeña vitrina dentro de su casa donde exhibe y guarda sus cosméticos. Adicionalmente, vende carteras, zapatos y joyas. A Liz le gusta aprender las diversas técnicas de venta para convencer a sus clientes de que le compren sus productos, por ello su negocio le es rentable. Además, como su esposo tiene una agencia fluvial que funciona en su casa, Liz aprovecha en ofrecer sus cosméticos a las personas que vienen al negocio de su esposo, generalmente comerciantes de madera, quienes muchas veces le compran de inmediato los productos que tiene en stock.
Este es su 4to crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que todos los integrantes son responsables en sus pagos y amigos entre sí. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más productos de belleza, zapatos, carteras y materiales para elaborar bisutería.
texts.en:
Liz is 29. She lives with her husband and their five year old daughter who is just beginning her education. For two years Liz has been selling beauty products. She has a small display case in her house where she keeps and displays her cosmetics. She also sells purses, shoes, and jewelry. Liz likes to learn different sales techniques in order to convince her customers to buy her products. Therefore, her business is profitable. Also, her husband runs a river tour agency from their house. Liz takes advantage of the opportunity to sell her cosmetics to the people who come to her husband’s business. They are generally wood merchants. Many times they immediately buy the products she has in stock. This is her fourth loan with MFP. What she likes about working with her communal bank is that all of the members are responsible with their payments, and they are friends with each other. She will use the money she is asking for to buy more beauty products, shoes, purses, and materials to make jewelry.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Sheriff Business Group

texts.en:
'S. business' is a group of 5 borrowers led by Mariama S., 37 years old, married with 6 children aged 7-19 years. Their educational levels are 1st grade to high school graduate. She also cares for 1 orphan.

Mariama is illiterate due to the fact that back then, Muslims and the Mandingo tribe did not like sending their girl children to school. Education and leadership were for men only, but now this has changed.

Mariama lives in a poor and deserted community called Bassa town, Perry Community, Brewerville, north of the capital Monrovia, Liberia.

Mariama's business is buying textiles wholesale and selling them retail to the residents of Brewerville, Monrovia, Liberia. This business enables her to feed and cater for herself and her children. Mariama does not have a shop, therefore she carries the cloth around on her head to sell to her customers; rainy can be very difficult for her business.

Mariama has been running this business for 14 years and is grateful for whatever this business has done for her. Mariama has hopes of importing textiles from abroad and owning a store in order to make business easier for her, instead of carrying goods on her head. She sells good textiles at a reasonable price to encourage her customers to keep buying from her.

Mariama needs this loan in order to purchase a variety of textiles that can serve her customers. She also dreams of making a better life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase variety of textiles for resale

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma A. is from Kabacsanan, Iligan City. She is 34, married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Emma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where she sells both food & daily use products in the local community. Emma has had her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings

location.town: Kabacsanan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia A. started her food vending business in October 2008.  She is 46 years old and has four children.  They are living in Lila, Bohol.  She wants to provide for her family and make her business grow.  She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. asking for support in financing her business.  She’s requesting a loan of Php 9,000 to buy more supplies and materials for food vending.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Farming is the main source of income of Julita and her family. The couple are blessed with two children and both of them are already married.

To earn additional income Julita also ventured into the vending of cosmetic products within her village of Rizal, Santiago City. According to Julita, she would like to improve their way of living through her vending business. She would like to borrow additional capital of Php 8,000 from Kiva lenders for the maintenance of her rice farming and vending activities.

Julita hopes that she will be able to obtain the amount she is requesting so that she can generate a bigger income. This amount will serve as a big help to her, most especially in their daily needs in life.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her rice farming and vending activities

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia S. is a woman who has a lot of confidence and is determined to rise above poverty. She is 40 years old and mother to 4 children. She is happily married to Edwin S., a welder who is 42 years old. She lives in a village in Palanas, Jala-jala, Rizal province in the Philippines.

For almost two years she has been in the rice business. The income is not sufficient to sustain the needs of her family, so she also has a sewing business to bring in additional income. With her desire to put poverty behind her, in 2007, Leticia decided to join ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines. Leticia has a bagful of hope because she'll have access to capital for her business.

Now on her fourth loan, she is requesting Php 20,000 pesos to pay for 15 sacks of rice worth Php 22,500. She believes that her business is in demand and will bring her enough income to sustain their day-to-day expenses. She dreams of sending her younger children to school and to renovate her house so its more durable and spacious. She also wants to open a grocery store in the future.

loans.use: Expand her rice business

loans.name: Ceina

texts.es:
La señora Ceina es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 37 años de edad , cuenta con estdios secundarios incompletos, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos.
Se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes y ropa y trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años atrás. En su Banco Comunal su primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de ropa.
Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.2500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà ropa y abarrotes como: azúcar, arroz, fideos, etc.
Su deseo para el futuro es tener su propio capital.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Señora Ceina is a member of the Third of May Communal Bank and lives in the Llave District, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 37 years of age and has some higher education (not completed). She lives with her domestic partner and has three children. She works at buying and selling groceries and clothing, and has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the last three years. Her first loan of 300 New Sols with her communal bank was used to buy clothing. She will now request a loan of 2,500 New Sols with which she will buy clothing and groceries, such as sugar, rice, noodles, etc. Her hope for the future is to have her own working capital. The thing she likes most about the Communal Bank is the savings plan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita C. is from the village of Baguitan, Guipos, ZDS. She is 49 years old, is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Esterlita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector selling agricultural equipment. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Esterlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase general agricultural supplies and equipment. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional agricultural equipment to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Esterlita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional agricultural equipment to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane T. is from the city of Oroquieta. She is 32 years old, married, and mother of 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jane owns and operates a business that provides motorcycle-for-hire services to local community members. She and her husband own 2 motorcycles. They decided to rent out the second motorcycle for PHP 300.00 per day. She has been engaged in this kind of business for about 8 years and earns an income of PHP 10,000 a month.

In 2007, Jane joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities.
