She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. Jane is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials and accessories need for her motorcycle to improve the business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Jane from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Towards purchasing materials and accessories for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  CIRILA, pertenece al banco comunal “ricchary purisun - oropesa”, la socia vive en el distrito de Oropesa dentro del departamento del Cusco, a 30 minutos de la ciudad imperial.

Nuestra socia tiene 49 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 6 hijos los cuales cinco de ellos son mayores e independientes, tienen sus propias familias, la socia vive con su hijo de 23 años el cual aún recibe el apoyo de sus padres en la educación superior, nuestra socia es nueva dentro del banco comunal, ella se dedica a preparar panes, nuestra socia compra sus ingredientes en la provincia de Juliaca ubicada en el departamento de Puno, nuestra socia compra los ingredientes como la harina, levaduras, y otros, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de ingredientes para elaborar los diferentes panes  venderlos en la provincia de Oropesa.

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Cirila belongs to the “Ricchary Purisun - Oropesa” community bank and lives in the district of Oropesa within the department of Cusco, 30 minutes from the city. She is 49 years old, married and has six children, five of whom are grown up and have their own families. She lives with her 23-year-old son, who still receives support from his parents for his higher education. Cirila is new to her community bank. She makes a living baking breads. She buys her ingredients from the province of Juliaca, department of Puno, including flour, yeast and other items. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients to bake different breads to sell in Oropesa. Cirila is grateful and values the opportunity made available from this medium and thus promises to fulfill her payments in the established time period.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: By Faith In God Group

texts.en: Momo S. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called “By Faith In God”. He is 29 years old and is married with a 10-year-old child who is in the 2nd grade. Momo is a high school graduate waiting to enter university. He and his family live and work in Paynesville, Liberia. In the photo, Momo is the one holding the sign. Stephen K. is inset at lower right. Momo’s business is the sale of general goods such as batteries, candles, milk, sugar and rubber slippers. He buys his goods from wholesalers and sells retail on a table to residents of his community. He has been running his business for eleven years and hopes to own a store in the near future. Momo will use this loan to purchase more batteries, candles, milk, sugar and rubber slippers. He dreams of giving his family the best help he can to improve all of their lives. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Jenneh

texts.en:
Jenneh Koromo is a happy and always smiling lady, who has been a member of LAPO,SL for almost 2 years now. She is 40 years old, married with 3 children (all of them boys) and lives with her family in Tegbeh town. The eldest of the children is in secondary school and the other two are in primary school.

Jenneh sells medicine, soap, body oil, water and toothpaste in Tegbeh town market.She has taken 4 previous loans and used her past loans to buy those goods. She has used the profit to pay her children's school fees and feed her family. 

Jenneh said she will use her present loan to purchase medicine.

loans.use: will be used to buy medicine

loans.name: Muharamoy

texts.en: Muharamoy is a lovely 40-year-old woman who lives with her husband and three children. She runs a small fabric business at the market where she offers a variety of fabrics for different tastes and ages. Muharamoy is asking for this loan so that she can buy a larger quantity of goods. The extra capital will enable her to expand her merchandise and thus improve her business and increase her profits. Her dreams are to have her own large store one day but, most importantly, to enable her children to have a better future – one where they can continue to study at the university, become professionals and lead healthy and comfortable lives. On behalf of Muharamoy and everyone at IMON International, thank you for your support! More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface, a 47-year-old father of five, has been making furniture cushions for 14 years and also farms for extra income. Boniface is a hardworking man who strives to meet his family’s needs, including educating his five children.  A member of Faulu Kenya, he has benefited by accessing loans to expand his business.  Boniface now plans to buy a pickup truck for transporting his products to his clients and is therefore requesting a loan of Kes. 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to top up his savings. He hopes to open up his own furniture company in the future and also dreams of buying a lorry for supplying his products in five years.

loans.use: To top up his savings to buy a pickup truck

loans.name: Annia De Las Mercedes

texts.es:
Annia B. de 34 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso (lugar muy humilde, con casas de caña y los caminos son de tierra) de Guayaquil. Su esposo es albañil ellos tienen dos hijos que estudian en escuelas fiscales. 

Annia empezó como vendedora ambulante vendiendo lapiz y plumas en los sectores que mas conocía, pero por la desesperante idea de tener su propio negocio y para evitar el cansancio de caminar decidió invertir sus ahorros en un pequeño local y papelería. 

 Annia ahora tiene una papelería muy surtida, trabaja desde muy temprano vendiendo cuadernos, plumas, papeles etc. En estos meses ha tenido buenas ganancias debido a que la temporada escolar empezó en abril. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, papelería y plumas para su negocio.

En el futuro quiere que su negocio sea mucho mas grande y poder terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Annia B., 34 years old, lives in a peri-urban area in Paraíso (a very modest place, with reed houses and dirt roads) in Guayaquil. Her husband is a construction worker. They have two children who are studying in public schools. Annia began as a street vendor, selling pens and pencils in the areas she knew best. However, with the desperate wish to have her own business and to avoid the exhaustion of walking, she decided to invest her savings in a small stationery shop. Annia now has a wide assortment of stationery. She starts work very early selling notebooks, pens, paper, etc. Lately she has had good earnings, due to the school season beginning in April. With the loan, she wants to buy notebooks, stationery, and pens for her business. In the future, she wants her business to grow much bigger and wants to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks, pencils, stationery

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie P. is from the village of Antipolo. She is 44 years old. Elsie is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Elsie owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling ground pork and beef products known as "longganisa". Elsie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP average a month for these activities.

In 2006, Elsie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to expand her sales of ground pork and beef products. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Elsie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Construction Supplies

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith S. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 37 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Judith joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Judith is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and other farm inputs. This loan will be her ninth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Jackielou

texts.en:
Jackielou B. is from the municipality of Maramag in Bukidnon Province. She is 40 years old. Jackielou is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Jackielou owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Jackielou has been engaged in her business for over 4 years, and she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jackielou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jackielou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jackielou is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jackielou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Jaqueline; ella tiene 26 años de edad y La socia es natural de Urcos es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos pequeños,   la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene una pequeña canasta dónde vende pan de todo tipo en los paraderos de buses, ella espera impacientemente desde las 5 a 6 de la mañana que paren los buses para que los pasajeros puedan bajar y tal vez comprar sus alimentos. La socia compra de la panadería todas las mañanitas muy temprano los panes y los envuelve con telas blancas para que no pierdan la suavidad y el frescor. La socia  solicita el préstamo para comprar pan al por mayor y distribuirlos por todas las tiendas y también para ella.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Qori Orcco Communal Bank. The member lives in the Urcos district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department. Jaqueline is the member. She is 26 years old, and she is from Urcos. She is in a common-law marriage, and she has three small children. She is a small business woman. She has a small basket where she sells all kinds of bread at the bus stops. She impatiently waits from five to six in the morning for the busses to stop. When the passengers are able to get off the bus they might buy her food. The member buys the bread from the bakery very early in the morning. She wraps them in white cloths so they do not lose their softness or their freshness. The member is requesting a loan to buy bread wholesale. She will distribute it to all of the stores, and some of bread is for her. The member is infinitely grateful for and values the loan. This allows her to grow in her business and improve her quality of life. She pledges to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bread

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel N. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 42 years old. Noel is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Noel owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Noel has been engaged in his business for over 20 years.

Noel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noel has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Noel is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure and pay for the laborers who help him prepare his land. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Noel from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure and pay for the laborers who help him prepare his land

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer R. is from the village of San Pablo Proper, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 23 years old. Jenifer is married and has an infant. To make a living, Jenifer owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Jenifer is just starting this business.

In 2010, Jenifer joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenifer is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jenifer from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

location.town: San Pablo Proper, Cauayan City, Isabela

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Chem R. is married and lives with her husband and six childR. in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean Temples.

R. and her husband are farmers and earn an income of USD 4 each per day. R. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase cows to help plow her rice fields. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

This is R.’s first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy cows to help plow her rice fields

loans.name: Samuel Sanguyen

texts.en:
Samuel has been farming for commercial purposes for the last 16 years. He is 34 years old and married to Regina Wangari. They have three children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD. by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to buy maize seedlings for planting. Samuel also has plans to move into the transportation industry in the future by buying his own mini bus. He describes himself as a very hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy maize seedlings for planting

loans.name: Ramon  Antonio

texts.es:
Ramón García tiene 51 años y vive en la ciudadela 20 de Julio dedicado a la fabricación de bolsos y calzado artesanal, tiene 3 hijos y 35 años de experiencia en el oficio con él que ha logrado generar ingresos para el y para sus hijos porque en la actualidad trabaja con dos de ellos.
Sus ventas repuntan en los meses desde Marzo a Septiembre, aunque en los otros meses no le va mal, porque tiene muchos clientes que prefieren sus productos, en este sector hay mucha competencia, pero se sostiene con buenos precios y es muy responsable en la entrega de sus pedidos. Trabaja desde las 8:00  AM hasta las 8:00 PM de lunes a sábados y esta persistencia logra resultados, por eso   recupera su inversión con utilidades, pero no responde rápidamente a sus clientes porque no tiene un capital adicional, con el que trabajar a la misma velocidad que requieren los clientes sus productos, este es la razón por la cual está solicitando su credickiva, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen materias primas e insumos para fabricar bolsos, calzados que ya tiene encargado en el centro de Barranquilla, a propósito de la temporada de fin de año.
Su sueño es convertir su pequeño taller, en una gran empresa con un punto de venta y exhibición para que el público escoja a la medida lo que quiere que Ramón le fabrique.
texts.en:
Ramón García, 51, lives in the "Ciudadela 20 de Julio" neighborhood.  He produces hand-made shoes and handbags.  He has 3 children and 35 years of experience in this occupation, with which he has managed to generate income for himself and his children.  He currently works with 2 of his children.  

His sales are highest in the months between March and September, although in the other months sales are not bad, because he has many customers who prefer his products. In this line of work there is a lot of competition, but he is able to maintain the business because his prices are good and he is very responsible with delivering his orders.  He works from 8am until 8pm Mondays through Saturdays, and this persistence gets results, as he is able to recoup his investment with a profit.  However, he cannot respond quickly to his customers because he lacks sufficient capital to keep up with the pace at which his customers are demanding his products.  For this reason he is requesting a Kiva loan, with which he will buy a greater quantity of raw materials and supplies to make purses and shoes that he already has orders for from stores in downtown Barranquilla for the upcoming season.  His dream is to convert his small workshop into a large business, with a place where he can exhibit and sell his products and where he can produce custom-made items for the public.

loans.use: to buy materials to make handbags and shoes that he already has orders for

loans.name: Nazyhan's Group

texts.en:
Nazyhan D. is the leader of the group. She is 54, a widow. Dhe has 4 children, the eldest one is married and lives separately, another 2 work in Russia and the youngest daughter is a schoolgirl. Nazyhan runs her own business, she has a canteen in the center of the village. Six years ago she had used to cook different dishes at home and sell them in the local market. Out of the profits she has managed to build the canteen and also to obtain cattle. The loan purpose is to open a mini bar in the canteen. In the future Nazyhan is planning to open a café in her village.

Buraima O., is 49 and married. Her husband is a tractor operator. The couple has 4 children,. The eldest son helps his father and the elder daughter is a student. The rest of the children are engaged in rice cultivating. The family enlarges their budget by selling rice. Six years ago after having harvested 10 tons of rice they started to sell it at retail. Out of profits, they are paying daughter’s school fees. Also they have managed to organize their son’s wedding. The loan purpose is to purchase 400 kg of rice for further resale. In the future Buraima wants to open a foodstuff shop in the village.

Salim A., 58 is married. His wife makes her income by working as a charwoman and a cook in the local school. The couple has 3 children. The family earns money by selling rice. They have been doing this for 10 years. The profits have made possible their son’s wedding and house repairs. The loan purpose is to purchase 250 kg of rice for resale. In the nearer future Salim is planning to obtain a car.

Yhval A. is 49 and married. Their family has 2 sons, both of them have jobs in Russia. The family raises money by selling rice. Five years ago they had bought 250 kg of rice for resale, since then their business has made a good incoming. Out of profits the family has managed to build a bath-house,  obtain a car, TV-set and DVD-player. The loan purpose is to increase their stock by purchasing 750 kg of rice. Yhval in the future plans to breed cattle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to open a mini bar

loans.name: Tiberius

texts.en: Tiberius is a married man who rents a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. He has operated his vegetable business for over six years, selling green vegetables wholesale to vegetable-stall operators. Tiberius faces the challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to purchase a pick-up truck to transport and distribute his vegetables. With the Kshs 15,000 he wants to purchase vegetables wholesale and resell them to retailers.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables wholesale to resell to retailers.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
Hilaria es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas D. Rio Blanco” ubicado en el distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia El Collao, departamento Puno, tiene 53 años D. edad, estado civil casada, con tres hijos y grado D. instrucción primaria incompleta.
La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace siete años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que pudo utilizar en la compra y venta D. animales menores. Actualmente tiene nueva actividad que es la venta D. queso, carne, papa, y quinua. Estos productos son llevados desD. Ilave hacia la ciudad D. Tacna.   
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo D. S/ 3000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirá incrementar el capital D. su negocio.
Su sueño es  seguir adelante con su negocio y verlos profesional a sus hijos. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es trabajar en grupo.
texts.en:
Hilaria is a member of the community bank "Brisas D. Rio Blanco", located in the district of Pilcuyo in the province in El Collao in the department of Puno.  She is 53 years old, married, and has three children.  She did not finish primary school.

She began working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos seven years ago.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles, which she used to purchase livestock to raise and sell.  She currently sells cheese, meat, potatoes, and quinoa.  These products are brought from the capital of Tacna.

She is asking for a new loan for 3000 nuevos soles to increase the capital in her business.  

Her dream is to continue improving her business and see her children become professionals.  The thing she likes best about the community bank is working together.

loans.use: Increase the capital in her business

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr: G. Martine est née en 1979 à Bopa au Bénin. Mariée à HOUNHOVI Hector, Martine est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. La famille s'est installée depuis une douzaine d'année environs à Adogléta, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Martine vient en aide à son mari en supportant avec lui les différentes charges familiales, grâce au revenu de son activité. Martine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Martine vend divers condiments de sauce (tomate fraîche ou en conserve, oignons, piments, épices, etc.) et parallèlement, Martine vend des céréales dont le haricot. Martine s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et vend ses produits à son domicile. Martine exerce cette activité depuis neuf ans environs, et a déjà obtenu huit crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Martine a été victime de l'inondation récente qu'il y a eu au Bénin, mais cela ne l'a pas empêché de rembourser son crédit. Dans le but d'agrandir un peu plus son activité et d'accroître davantage ses revenus, Martine sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Martine G. was born in 1979 in Bopa, Benin.  Married to Hector Hounhovi, Martine is the mother of four children who are all in school.  In addition to their children, the couple take care of another child. The family has been living in Adogléta, a neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin for twelve years.  With the income of her business, Martine helps her husband provide the family expenses. Martine did not finish school, so to meet her needs, she sells condiment sauces (canned or fresh tomatoes, onions, peppers, spices, etc.). She also sells grains and beans. Marine stocks up at Dantokpa, Benin's international market, and sells products at her home.  Martine has been in business for nine years and she has already obtained eight loans through ALIDé, all of which have been repaid. Recently, Martine was the victim of the major flooding that occurred in Benin, but that did not stop her from repaying her loans. In order to expand her business and to further increase its revenues, Martine is asking for another loan through ALIDé.

loans.use: To buy Condiments and Grain

loans.name: Dan Mo 1-3 Group

texts.en:
Hang T. N. is 42 years old. She is living in Dan Mo village with her husband and three children. Her children are going to school. She is a farmer. She not only grows rice but also raises chicken and fish. She has had this job for many years. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. 

She has participated in SEDA since 2003 and always repaid punctually. In this loan cycL., she would like to borrow 7,194,000 VND to invest in her livestock.

 About the other borrowers in her group:

 Van T. L. is 62 years old. She raises chickens. She wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to buy feed for chickens.

 Hien T. N. is 32 years old. She makes wooden furniture. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy wood.

 Doan T. D. is 35 years old. She wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to raise chickens.

loans.use: to invest in her livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients for preparing his dishes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary J. is currently in the business of distilling alcohol and tea boiling and is requesting a loan for buying more sacks of sugars and floor to distilation.  Mary is 26 years old and is married with a husband who works as a carpenter. She has five children and two of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to paying school fees and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: for buying more sacks of suger and floor for distilation

loans.name: Lester Isidro

texts.es:
El Senor Lester V., es habitante de la Comarca El Coyolito, del Municipio La Concordia en Jinotega; casado, tiene 41 anos de edad, con 2 hijos, sus estudios son basicos, ya que solo llego a 6to grado de primaria; y desde entonces se dedica a la Agricultura.
Incio en estas actividades con su padres, desde muy nino, sobre todo el le ayudaba a limpiar y regar y su Papa le ayudaba para que estudiara y sus gastos personales.
Cuando el tenia 15 anos de edad, su Papa fallecio, quedando el a cargo de la familia, desde esa edad, ya que el era el hermano mayor.
El se dedico a producir las 5 manzanas que su papa le dejo de herencia a todos, al inicio consiguio un socio para poder sembrar, ya que el no tenia suficiente recursos para hacerlo solo; y esto a la vez le impidio seguir con sus estudios, pues sus prioridades eran otras.
Tambien se dedico a la compra/venta de Frijoles y compra venta de terrenos.
El ahora esta apoyando a sus hijos a que estudien y se preparen, para que mejoren su nivel de vida.
Solicito este credito para la siembra de Hortalizas, espera obtener buenas ganancias.
Dentro de sus metas esta comprar terrenos para ampliar su siembra e independizarse por completo de sus otros hermanos, y que sus hijos puedan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Lester V. is a resident of the region El Coyolito in the La Concordia municipality in Jinotega.  He is 41 years old and married with two kids.  He has a basic education, having only reached sixth grade.  Since then, he's worked in agriculture.  He began working in agriculture with his parents when he was very young, mainly cleaning and watering.  His father helped Lester with his personal finances so he could study.

When Lester was 15 years old, his father died, leaving Lester in charge of his family since he was the eldest brother.  Lester dedicated himself to producing the five parcels of land his father left to the family.  In the beginning, Lester contracted a partner to help him sow the land, since he no longer had sufficient resources to do it by himself.  Taking care of the land stopped Lester from continuing school because now he had other priorities.  Lester also worked buying and selling beans and land.

Right now, Lester is helping his children study so that they can improve their quality of life.

He asked for this loan to grow vegetables, which he hopes will obtain good revenues.  His goals also include buying land to increase his crops, becoming completely independent from his brothers, and having his children become professionals.

loans.use: Growing vegetables

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophy C. (pictured) and her husband, Mr. Nun Buo, have been married since 1982 and have five children. They live along National Road Number Six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. Sophy and her husband sell mango. They buy it under contract from fellow villagers before harvest season and, when the mangoes are fully grown, they take them to sell at the local market. 

Sophy has received a previous loan through Kiva, and she is now requesting her second loan in the amount of $700, which will be used to purchase additional mango for to offer for resale.

loans.use: To purchase mango to offer for resale.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 52 years old and married to Peter S.. They are blessed with five children. She runs a cereals shop, and she has been in this business for three years, earning a monthly income of about $250. She is taking out a loan of 80,000 KES with which she plans to purchase more maize and beans to sell. 

She plans to use the anticipated profit to expand the business. This is her third loan and she paid her previous loans successfully. Her dreams and hopes are to expand her dairy farming business.

loans.use: To buy more maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Tohirchon

texts.ru: Детканов Тохирчон проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 35 лет. Женат. У него четверо детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Тохирчон занимается растениеводством. Он в основном выращивает овощи для продажи. В этой области имеет богатый опыт. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Tohirchon D. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is 35 years old, married and has four children. His wife is a homemaker. Tohirchon does agriculture. He mainly grows vegetables for resale and has a rich experience in this business. He is taking out the loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Oscar Manuel

texts.es:
Oscar es un hombre trabajador que desea seguir trabajando en la elaboración y producción de puertas, cómodas, anaqueles de madera. Tiene un taller de fabricación de mueblería de madera. 

Comenzó su actividad laboral como obrero en un taller de ebanistería poco a poco fue aprendiendo la profesión y ahorrando para tener su propio negocio. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su taller por eso quiere continuar haciendo mueblería con madera. Para ello quiere el préstamo para comprar madera, pinturas y gomas.
texts.en:
Oscar is a hard working man who wants to continue working making and producing wood doors, chests and shelves.  He has a wood furniture making shop.

He started working as a laborer in a cabinet making shop and gradually learned the profession saving up to have his own business.  Currently he works from 7am until 6pm every day.  He has many hopes for his shop and this is why he wants to continue making wood furniture.  For that, he needs a loan to buy lumber, paint and adhesives.

loans.use: to buy lumber, paint and glue.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard was born in 1988 and is newly married.  He prepares bone soup and sells it to earn a living.  He is also employed as a house caretaker.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, his business has been growing.  He hopes to prosper in his business.  He has requested 35,000 Kes to renovate his business premises.

loans.use: To renovate his business premises.

loans.name: Crimildo Agostinho

texts.pt:
Crimildo Agostinho S. nasceu na cidade Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique casado e pai de 1 filha de 2 anos de  idade, ainda nao vai a Escola. Fez 4ª classe não continuou  devido as dificuldades da vida. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta suas sobrinhas que vivem com ele.

Nunca sai da sua cidade natal, possui um negocio proprio de venda de roupa diversa usada e sapatos ha 4 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento mensal de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar uma parte na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu amigo que é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar fardos de roupa usada para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para ampliar o seu negocio e concluir a sua casa.
texts.en:
Crimildo Agostinho S. was born in the city of Matola, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He is married and has a two-year-old daughter who does not yet attend school. Crimildo finished fourth grade but did not continue because of life's difficulties. He lives in his own house with his family and also supports his nieces, who live with him.

He has never left his hometown, and for more than four years he has had his own business selling assorted used clothing and shoes. He has no employees and has a monthly income of 4,000 meticais, which he uses for household expenses. He is also able to save some money in his bank account.

Crimildo has never had loans from other banks, and he learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is a customer of this institution. This is his first Hluvuku loan, and he is asking for 10,000 meticais to buy bundles of used clothing so he can increase the amount of merchandise he has.

He promises to make his payments on time so he can take out other loans in the future. He intends to ask for more loans to expand his business and finish his house.

loans.use: to buy bundles of assorted used clothing

loans.name: Saranchimeg

texts.en:
Saranchimeg is 52 years old and lives with her husband in a house in Zavhan province, Mongolia. All her children are grown up and live separately. Her husband is a retired man who stays home all day. 

She manages a clothing-trading business in her town. She started her business in 2006 with a loan received from XacBank. Since then she has gained much experience and built a strong customer base. She is a polite woman who says, "I am happy to have a chance to receive loans." 

She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase summer clothes from China.

loans.use: to purchase summer clothes from China

loans.name: Makhsat

texts.en:
Makhsat is married and the loving mother of three adult children. She sells foodstuff in her grocery store. Her business is in a very good location which makes it a favorable shopping spot for her customers. She started her business ten years ago. She is a hard worker and usually works late hours after all other market vendors are done with their sales for the day. 

Makhsat would like to get a loan to buy assorted inventory for her grocery store. She is hoping to generate additional profit to provide for the needs of her family and to help her younger daughter through college. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy inventory for her grocery store.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a 42-year-old seamstress, who sews clothes for her neighboring clients to fulfill the needs of her family. She has four children and all of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

Her husband operates a Punjabi food restaurant. He is very skillful in making Punjabi food and Naseem also helps him in preparing food. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy required ingredients such as spices, cooking oil, etc. for making food in larger quantity to be able to sell more and increase the profits. 

He has been operating this business for the past 25 years and Naseem is confident that an investment will help him grow his business further and increase his profits.

loans.use: To buy required ingredients for Punjabi food business.

loans.name: Duo Salem Group

texts.es:
DUO SALEM
Este grupo está formado por don Hilario, de 38 años de edad es soltero,  el  se dedica a ser mecánico automotriz, desde hace 10 años, el nos cuenta que necesita el crédito para poder comprar pintura y herramienta ya que las que tiene ya está  deterioradas  y ese tipo de herramientas  son caras. Es  por eso que necesita capital para invertir en la comprar nueva herramientas y así poder seguir trabajando, también esta don Crescencio, de 30 años de edad  es el líder de este dúo, es casado y tiene 5 hijos, el se dedica a la venta de carne de res y  pollo, desde hace4 años, el  cuenta que solicita el crédito para poder comprar al contado la carne y no deberle a la empresa porque  a veces no traen cabal la carne, además quiere comprar otro congelador ya que el que tiene ya está  viejo, el confía en que este crédito se le va a otorgar y con él puede adquirir más ganancias  y cumplir con esta obligación.
texts.en:
SALEM DUO

This group is formed by Hilario, 38, who is single and has been an auto mechanic for ten years.  He tells us that he needs the loan to buy paint and tools because the ones he has are deteriorated and these kinds of tools are expensive.  This is why he needs capital to invest in the purchase of new tools to stay in business.

Also a member is Crescencio, 30.  He is the leader of this duo.  He’s married and has five children.  He has sold beef and chicken for the last four years.  He relates that he’s asking for the loan to be able to pay cash for the meat and not have any debts with the firm because sometimes they don’t deliver the meat as promised.  Besides, he’d like to buy an additional freezer because the one he has is old.  He trusts that this loan will be granted and with it he’ll be able to acquire more profits and repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy beef and to buy tools and spare parts.

loans.name: Las Flores De Tlacoachistlahuaca Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama las flores de tlacoachistlahuaca, los integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre puesto que así se llama su comunidad donde viven y porque en la casa de señora donde se reúnen tiene un jardín donde hay variedad de flores, es por eso que decidieron nombrar de esta manera a su grupo, esta historia es acerca de la señora Antonia, ya que es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella cuenta con 36 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, Cesar, Marcela y Juan, de los cuales los tres estudian, el mayor está cursando el tercer año de secundaria, otro más en sexto año de primaria y el menor en segundo año de preescolar, ella tiene una tienda de ropa y bisutería, con la cual lleva más de 7 años.

Doña Antonia se decidió por este negocio, ya que dice quería buscar la forma de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, también para darles una muy buena educación a sus hijos, ya que no contaba con el respaldo económico de algún familiar, ella invirtió su crédito en la compra de mas mercancía como son: vestidos, pantalones, faldas, shorts, blusas, playeras, camisas, ropa interior y mas bisutería como: aretes, pulseras, anillos, collares, para así continuar con las ventas de sus artículos. 

El sueño que tiene doña Antonia es el de ampliar un poco mas su local ahí mismo en su casa para continuar con sus ventas y así tenerla mucho mas surtida, y obtener más y mejores ingresos y con eso poder continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios, para que tengan una muy buena carrera profesional.

Ella esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y kiva por el apoyo del préstamo que le otorgaron ya que gracias a esto su negocio empezara a mejorar mucho y su vida y la de su familia también cambiaran.

Las integrantes del grupo las flores de tlacoachistlahuaca y las actividades que realizan son las siguientes: Ángela-venta de perfumes, Rosa Iris-venta de ropa, Viridiana-venta de cosméticos, Ismaela-venta de tamales, Flora Alexis-venta de ropa, María-mercería, Froylan- estética, Divina-frutería.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Flores de Tlacoachistlahuaca.”  The members decided on this name because that’s the name of the community they live in and because the woman’s house they meet in has a garden with a variety of flowers and that’s why they decided to name their group like this.

This story is about Antonia since she’s one of the group members.  She’s 36 years old and the single mother of three children: Cesar, Marcela and Juan.  All three are in school.  The oldest is in third year of high school, another is in sixth year of primary school and the youngest is in second year of preschool.  She has had a clothing and costume jewelry store for over seven years.

Antonia decided on this business because she says she wanted to find a way to improve her and her family’s quality of life and also to provide her children with a good education and she could not count on support from any family member.  She used her loan to buy more merchandise like: dresses, pants, skirts, shorts, t-shirts, shirts, underwear and more costume jewelry like earrings, bracelets, rings and necklaces to continue selling her articles.

Antonia’s dream is to expand her home based store a bit more to continue with sales and to have it much better stocked to earn better income and be able to continue supporting her children’s schooling so that they will have very good professional careers.

She is very grateful to Fundación Realidad and to Kiva for the support from the loan she was granted because, thanks to this, her business will begin to improve a lot and her live and her family’s life will also change.

The members of the “Las Flores de Tlacoachistlahuaca” group and the activities they carry out are:

Ángela - perfume sales,

Rosa Iris - clothing sales, 

Viridiana - cosmetics sales, 

Ismaela - tamales sales, 

Flora Alexis - clothing sales, 

María – notions, 

Froilán - beauty salon and fruit sales.

loans.use: to buy clothes and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel, tiene la edad de 59 años, está casada y vive con sus hijos y su esposa. El va a comprar con el credito los insumos y realizar el pago de la mano de obra de las mejoras a sus cafetal. El cuenta con el terreno ya sembrado desde varios años atrás y quiere fortalecer su cafetal, realizando el abonado y limpieza de su plantacion  para así obtener este próxima año una cosecha de mayor cantidad. El quiere mantener su cafetal en buenas  condiciones para seguir teniendo los mejores resultados de este. El tiene como meta logra todos sus proyectos y fortalecer aun mas su actividad cafetalera. El piensa en futuro de su familia por lo cual cree que con esta mejora a su café le dará mayores ganancias para su bienestar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Daniel is 59 years old, married and lives with his children and his wife.  He plans, with his loan, to purchase supplies and pay his laborers on his coffee farm.  He has had his fields planted for many years.  He wants to strengthen his coffee plantation so that this next year he will have a harvest of greater quantity.  His goal is to complete all his projects and strengthen his coffee plantation business.  He thinks about his family's future, and he believes that improving his coffee crop will give him better earnings and improve his family's well being.  This is the first time Daniel has received a loan from FUDECOSUR.  He had never before taken out a loan from a state bank, but FUDECOSUR offered him the loan with greater ease and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his coffee farm and pay for labor.

loans.name: Felicien

texts.en:
Felicien is 27 years old and married. He's been selling cakes and tea for the past two years. His business is well organized and he works from 8 am until 8 pm every day. He currently employs one person to help him.

Felicien has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more farine [flour] to make cakes and to expand his tea business. He plans to reinvest the profits in his business and to save for his future.

loans.use: to purchase more farine [flour] to make cakes and to expand his tea business.

loans.name: Kasichana

texts.en:
Kasichana is a 49-year-old widow, mother of seven children, aged between three years and twenty years. She is a fish seller with a business that has been in operation for the last twenty years. 

This is her first loan from KADET and with the money she plans to purchase more fish to sell. She hopes to use the profit from her sales to improve her business and to also to support her family.

Her hope is to see her children grow and to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca”, ubicado en el Centro Poblado D. Chipana, distrito Pilcuyo, provincia El Collao, departamento D. Puno, tiene 48 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, uno D. ellos independiente.  Cuenta con educación primaria incompleta.
Ella se dedica a la compra y venta D. animales como vacunos y ovinos, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace cuatro años,  su préstamo anterior fue por la suma D.  S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en la compra D. algunos animales.
Con este nuevo préstamo D.  S/ 3000.00 nuevo soles, comprará dos vacas para engordarlas por seis meses, para luego venderlas en la localidad D. Ilave y Pilcuyo, D. esa manera genera más ganancias.  Nos cuenta que  trabaja junto con su esposo.
Su sueño es mejorar los animales para venderlos a buen precio y tener buenos ingresos económicos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y lo que gana el ahorro
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the “Las Estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca” (The United Little Stars of Titicaca) Communal Bank.  It is located in the central village of Chipana, Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, Puno department.  

She is 48 years old, married, and has two children.  One of them is independent.  She did not complete elementary school.  She buys and sells animals like cows and pigs.  

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four years.  She used her previous loan for 500 soles to buy some animals.  With this new loan for 3,000 soles she will buy two cows to fatten for six months.  Then she will sell them in Ilave and Pilcuyo.  This way she will generate more earnings.  She tells us that she works together with her husband.

Her dream is to improve the animals in order to sell them for a good price and to have better income.

What she likes about her communal bank are the meetings and what she gains from savings.

loans.use: to buy to cows to fatten.

loans.name: Anthony Steve

texts.es: ANTHONY, ES UN JOVEN ESTUDIANTE DE COMPUTACIÓN E INFORMÁTICA, TIENE 20 AÑOS Y ESTA YA EN LOS ULTIMOS MESES DE ACABAR SU CARRERA, ES UN JOVEN ESTUDIANTE CON MUCHOS DESEOS DE SURGIR Y SER EL ORGULLO DE SUS PADRES, TIENE LAS MEJORES CALIFICACIONES EN LA UNIVERSIDAD, TERMINANDO SU PRIMERA CARRERA PIENSA ESTUDIAR INGENIERÍA DE SISTEMAS, Y TRABAJAR EN UNA BUENA EMPRESA, EN SUS RATOS LIBRES AYUDA A SUS PADRE EN EL TALLER DE REPUESTOS DE AUTOS, CON EL RECIENTE PRESTAMO OTORGADO A ANTHONY LO INVERTIRÁ EN EL PAGO DE SU TITULO Y EL COMIENZO DE SU NUEVA CARRERA, UN MUCHACHO CON MUCHA RESPONSABILIDAD Y EMPEÑOSO EN LOS ESTUDIOS Y UNA META POR ALCANZAR.
texts.en: Anthony is a young 20-year-old computing and informatics student. He is in the final months of his degree. He is a young student with a great desire to succeed and make his parents proud. He has the best grades in the university. Upon finishing his first degree, he intends to study systems engineering and to work for a good company. In his free time he helps his parents in their auto workshop. With this recently authorized loan, Anthony will invest in the payment of his degree and the start of his new career. He is a guy with a lot of responsibility. He studies hard and he has a goal to achieve.

loans.use: to pay the qualification and his tuition.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old, single and lives with two family members.

Since 2010, Ali is an owner of a store selling marble, ceramics and flagstones. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.
Ali decided to apply for $2400 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to add more inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to open a new store and to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to pay the annual rent and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам  трудолюбивый, честный предприниматель. Он более 5 лет занимается куплей – продажей сельхозпродуктов. Он в основном торгует овощами. Рустам женат, у него 3 детей. У него на иждивении двое. Он  старается продавать качественный продукт, чтобы привлечь клиентов. Рустам в дальнейшем  хочет открыть собственный ларек по продаже овощей и  расширить  свой бизнес. У Рустама нет  нужных  средств для развития  бизнеса, торговли. Ему нужен займ. Он надеется, что вы поможете ему.  Получение этого займа принесет пользу и развитию бизнеса и семейному бюджету. Рустам заранее благодарит вас за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Rustam is a hard-working and honest entrepreneur.  He has been involved in buying and selling agricultural crops for over five years.  He primarily sells vegetables.  Rustam is married and has three children and also support two more.  He tries to sell quality products in order to attract customer attention.  In the future, Rustam wants to open his own kiosk, where he could sell vegetables, and, thus, expand his business.  Rustam does not have the necessary means to develop his retail business.  He needs a loan and he hopes that you would help him.  Obtaining this loan would bring benefit not only for business development, but for the family budget as well.  Rustam thanks you in advance for the help and support.

loans.use: to open his own kiosk and buy vegetables

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.es:
Joaquina es socia del Banco Comunal Rikchary, tiene 52 años, no tiene hijos y es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 10 años,
Joaquina vende pollos y huevo, tiene una tienda donde tambien vende licores y abarrotes en general, reparte a las bodegas pollo y huevo. Joaquina ha pasado por muchos negocios como restaurante. El primer préstamo ue recibió lo utilizó para poder comprar una congeladora para su negocio, poco a poco pudo progresar, y hacer su negocio, ahora con las capacitaciones y el ahorro que le enseñaron esta progresando y se siente muy orgullosa de ello. Con el préstamo que recibirá lo invertirá en la compra de pollo y bebidas.
Su gran meta es poder comprarse su casa, lo que desea es poder tener una buena estabilidad económica para poder adoptar a un niño que es lo que mas desea.
texts.en:
Joaquina is a member of the communal bank Rikchary.  She is 52 years hold, has no children, and has been a member of FINC Peru for ten years.

Joaquina sells chickens and eggs, which she delivers to other merchants, and has a store where she sells liquor and groceries.  She has also had other business such as a restaurant.  The first loan she received was used to buy a freezer for her business.  Little by little she has been able to get ahead and establish her business.  Now with the training and saving skills she was taught she feels proud.  She will use the loan to buy chickens and beverages.

Her greatest goal is to buy a house and have good economic stability so she can adopt a child.

loans.use: To buy chickens and beverages.

loans.name: Urankhuu

texts.en: Mr. Urankhuu, 20, is a miner who works a mine located far from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. For 2 years he has been working as a miner there. He lives with his family in an old house which is located in the slum district. His house becomes very cold and frosted during the winter because it does not have any insulation in its walls. Therefore, he decided to make the insulation and install a new electric furnace. The loan will be dedicated to purchasing some building materials to make the wall insulation and to purchasing the new furnace.

loans.use: To purchase some building materials to make wall insulation and to purchase a new furnace.

loans.name: Lukhuna Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Lukhuna A Group in Western Kenya! Patrick is the facilitator of the Lukhuna A group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Patrick takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Patrick had a very good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Patrick was only able to harvest seven bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Patrick and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Patrick will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Lukhuna A group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

He is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 27 years old and a single man. He has operated a motorcycle transport business for the last three years, and the business is doing well.  

He has a good history with KADET LTD, and he is applying for his third loan after repaying the previous loans successfully. He hopes to use the loan amount to purchase a new motorbike and employ a driver.

He will save the anticipated profits, pay back his loan and grow his business further. Henry hopes to become a successful businessman in Mombasa and to open a taxi business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike and employ a driver.

loans.name: David Gitimu

texts.en:
David is a married man with three children between the ages of 6 months and12 years old. He describes himself as ambitious.  David operates a retail store where he sells electrical goods. He has been involved in this business for six years. David says his biggest business challenge is the high cost of electrical goods. 

David will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy electrical goods. His business goal is to run more electrical retail stores within the next five years.

loans.use: To add stock of electrical goods to sell.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Teofila has a shop that sells food seasonings, vegetables & spices. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy food seasonings, vegetables & spices.
Teofila has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Teofila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy food seasonings, vegetables & spices

loans.name: Tafaoga

texts.en:
Tafaoga is 29 years of age and is married, with three children.

Tafaoga owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Tafaoga needs a loan of WST 2,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 750, or US $313 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Tafaoga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Tafaoga's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia is married and has five children aged from 26 to 37. She describes herself as an ambitious woman. She runs a general stall and sells items such as paper and plastic cups. She has been in this business for the last ten years. Teresia's business challenge is the high cost of items sold. She will be using her loan of 20,000 KES to buy more paper and plastic cups. In the next five years, Teresia hopes and dreams of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy more paper and plastic cups.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
This is Cherry, 30, a resident of Tanza,Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Danilo, a driver, and mother to her children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Cherry operates a fruit stand. She buys seasonal fruit that is native to the Philippines like bananas and pineapples which are grown mostly in the southern region of Luzon. She also sells other Filipino fruit staples.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fruit to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Cherry dreams of  growing her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of fruits needed in her business.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin is a 23-year-old married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be courageous. He operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, salt, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are wholesale and retail. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the weather. He will use the 10,000 KES loan for agricultural production for agricultural production to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow crops. His business goal is to be a commercial businessman within 5 years.

loans.use: for agricultural production to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow crops

loans.name: Sunilda Regina

texts.es: La cliente vive en el sector de Suburbio en Guayaquil.  Comenzó vendiendo ropa interior, sábanas y edredones; para luego emprender en la venta de productos de belleza de la línea Esika.  Posteriormente, un grupo de amigas también la involucran en la venta de artículos de la línea Yanbal.  Esta actividad le ha resultado muy productiva, sobre todo considerando el momento en el que inició, debido a la separación de su esposo y la necesidad de tener un ingreso económico para su familia.  Labora en la tienda durante la mañana y en la tarde se dedica a repartir sus pedidos de cosméticos.  El negocio de la tienda es atendido por su hija mientras ella sale en la tarde.  Tiene 2 hijos, quienes ya son mayores de edad y tienen compromiso.  Quisiera a futuro, incrementar su negocio de tienda para no tener que salir mucho.  Ahora necesita invertir el dinero del préstamo en abarrotes para la tienda y productos de belleza para su venta.
texts.en:
This client lives in Guayaquil’s Suburbio sector. She started out selling underwear, sheets and comforters and then went into selling Esika brand beauty products.  Later on a group of friends also got her involved in selling Yanbal brand products.  This activity has turned out to be very productive above all considering the moment she started it when she separated from her husband and had to earn economic support for her family.

She works in the store during the morning and spends the evening delivering her customers’ cosmetics orders.  Her daughter watches the store when she goes out in the evening.  She has two children who are adults now and involved in relationships.  She’d like in future to increase the store business in order not to have to go out so much.  She now needs to invest the loan’s money in grocery items for the store and in beauty products to sell.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies and stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
My name is Oscar P.. I sell shoes and seasonal products since 2000 in “El Oriente” community, close to Nuevo Laredo. I would like to have more products to sell in my small store. I want to offer basics items, like: bath soap, laundry detergent, toothpaste, etc. I sell my products in my community and give them a very good price because there isn’t any other store near here and the people have to drive or walk long distances to buy these kinds of products. That is the reason why I’m asking for a loan of $600. With this amount I will buy these products and offer them to the people of the community.

Español

Mi nombre es Oscar P., vendo zapatos desde hace 5 años en La comunidad Oriente, cerca de Nuevo Laredo. Me gustaría tener más productos que vender en mi pequeña tienda. Quiero ofrecer productos básicos como: jabón de baño, detergente, pasta de dientes, etc. En mi comunidad y dar el mejor precio, porque no hay tiendas cercanas que vendan esos productos y la gente tiene que manejar o caminar distancias largas para poder conseguirlos, esa es la razón principal de la solicitud de mi crédito por $600.00, con este importe pretendo comprar Esos productos y ofrecerlos a la comunidad.

loans.use: different basic products

loans.name: Azar

texts.en: Azar S. lives in Aghsu where he owns a small retail store. He sells food, cleaning items, personal hygeine, as well as various other items. Azar is married with two children. Currently his store is attached to his house and with this loan he wants to build a larger location separate from his home.

loans.use: To build a larger location separate from his residence

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Mrs. Martina has had her business for one and a half years. My salon is across from a school, so many people pass by. My problem is that I don't have accessories for hairstyling - dyes and bases, as well as a hairstyling chair. I am requesting $1000 to buy hairdressing accessories and a chair.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Martina tiene su negocio desde hace 1 año y medio. Mi estética está enfrente de una escuela así es que pasa mucha gente por ahí, mi problema es que me hacen falta accesorios para hacer los cortes de cabello, los tintes y las bases así como también un sillón para estética". Solicito $ 1000.00 dlls para comprar accesorios para la estética y un sillón.

loans.use: Invest in the business and buy a chair

loans.name: Itohan

texts.en: Mrs. Itohan U. is 40 years old and married with four children. She started benefiting from a LAPO loan in 2000. She plans to increase her stock (provisions) if granted the loan.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sales

loans.name: Toribio

texts.es:
Toribio A. lives in his own home in the zone of Llojeta Ladera, west of the city of La Paz, with his wife and their two children, age 14 and 12. Toribio works as a builder in a micro-business in our city, and his wife is a domestic worker in a private home. Currently, they live in three rooms built with credit from our institution and their own savings, but they need to build a kitchen.

The credit requested will be used for building a kitchen/dining room, which would add to their small home.

This is the third time they are requesting a loan and the socio-economic analysis conducted favorably qualifies them, and they can access new credit. The two prior credits have been paid in full.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

El señor Toribio A. vive en casa propia en la zona de Llojeta ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 14 y 12 año de edad; el señor Toribio trabaja como constructor en una microempresa del rubro en nuestra ciudad y su esposa es empleada domestica en un domicilio particular. Actualmente ocupan tres habitaciones construidas con créditos en nuestra institución y ahorros propios pero tienen la necesidad de construir una cocina.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una cocina-comedor, que complementaría su pequeña vivienda independiente.

Esta es la tercera vez que solicitan un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder un nuevo crédito. Los dos créditos anteriores han sido cancelados en su totalidad.

loans.use: Building a kitchen

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase on his stock.

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en: Yasin is a young 18-year-old businessman who owns his food store in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Yasin is one of the youngest businessmen in his Varkhanend village in Saatli. He started his business in 2006 when he borrowed money from his friends and opened his small food store. He sells cereals and canned food and other products that don’t need refrigeration. Now Yasin is going to diversify the number of his products and start selling dairy and meat products. For this aim he needs 1200 USD for the purchase of a special food refrigerator.

loans.use: Going to purchase a special food refrigerator

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Rosa Emilia T. is a hardworking lady, married, with a child for whom she is responsible. He has mental problems, so to be able to supply the medicine he needs, she works cutting pork in pieces to increase their income, because her husband works as a laborer with a low income.

Aware of the fact that her husband's income was low, she felt the need to move forward and started selling twenty-eight years ago. She was a housewife, and now she has established her business in the municipal market using twenty loans. She tells us she feels grateful because these loans have helped her financially and also helped her with guidance on how to manage her business.

Mrs. T. has been worked with CEPRODEL for three years now. She tells us that she feels satisfied with the loans she has received because they have come at an opportune time, quickly, and have allowed her to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa Emilia T. es una dama muy trabajadora, casada y con un hijo a su cargo, este tiene problemas mentales por lo que para poderlo apoyar en sus medicamentos ella se dedica al destace de cerdos, para obtener mayores ingresos decide dedicarse a este negocio, ya que su marido es un obrero con poco salario.

Consiente de que el ingreso monetario de su esposo era poco, sintió la necesidad de salir adelante y comenzó a vender desde hace veinte y ocho años, ella era ama de casa, hoy ya tiene establecido su negocio en el mercado municipal, con veinte créditos obtenidos ella nos expresa que se siente agradecida porque le han ayudado en lo económico y que además le sirvieron para tener mayor orientación del manejo del negocio.

La señora T. trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace tres año, nos manifiesta que se siente satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido muy oportunos y brindados de manera muy ágil, y que en su momento le sirvieron para salir a delante con su familia.

loans.use: Buying pigs (Compra de Cerdos)

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita F. is a young mother with three children in elementary school. Her husband makes shoes for a living, and she owns a neighborhood clothing store. Margarita began her working life as a clerk in a book store, but opened her own business after managing to save some capital from that job.

Margarita saw the need for a good clothing store in her neighborhood and used the small amount of money she set adise to set one up in her own house. After she was established there and earning money, she moved the store into a rented location in the nearby shopping center. Margarita is asking for a loan to help purchase more clothing for her store, including shirts, blouses, jeans and skirts.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as shirts, shoes, skirts, blouses, pants and jeans.

loans.name: Titin Suharni

texts.en: Titin, 33, is a mother of 2 children, ages 11 and 2. Every day she sells clothing at the market, such as children's clothes and underwear, earning $20 a day. Her husband, K., also sells clothing door to door and earns $10 a day. To expand her business and earn more income, Titin is requesting a loan of $75, and as a member of MBK, she will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O. is a 42-year-old woman who is married with five children. She lives in Benin City, where she sells provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs. She spent 18 months learning about the business and then established her own in 2003. She has been borrowing from LAPO for four years and is very dedicated to her business. She is requesting a loan of $875 to buy more provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Hout

texts.en:
Hout S. H.’s family has lived in the city of Phnom Penh. One child attends school; another child is a blacksmith, and earns around $50 a month. Hout S. H. is works in a garment factory and makes $2.50 per day. Her husband is a construction worker around Phnom Penh city, and he makes $3 per day.

Hout S. H. and her husband also make Khmer wine (rice wine). Rice wine is one of the popular wines for the local people, especially in rural areas because it is inexpensive and doesn't affect people's health.
