This business has been doing well. Hout S. H. requests a loan from Kiva to purchase some equipment to make rice wine. The rest of money from the loan will be used to purchase more piglets to breed.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to breed

loans.name: Eoeun

texts.en:
Eoeun S. is 45 years old and lives in the central province of Siem Reap, Cambodia. She is the devoted mother of six children, working hard each day so they can attend school, despite being relatively poor. She sells fish in the crowded provincial market, competing with many other vendors each day to make her sales. Her husband is a fisherman and gets up early to secure the day's catch. Together they earn about $5 USD per day working as a team.

Although fishing is their primary source of income, the couple feels they need to invest in a side business to provide a better life for their children. They now want to start raising pigs from home. They will sell these pigs periodically to the butcher for profit.

Her husband is pictured here, because Eoeun S. was not available to be photographed.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Bernith

texts.es:
Mrs. Bernith A. P., partner of the Community Bank, "Santa Isabel" lives in the San Martin region, province and district of Picota, village of Nueva Union. She sells clothes and shoes, complemented by the sale of plastics, and accessories, and a few general goods. Her business is located in her own home in Jr. Union.

After trying other businesses, which she worked outside the house, Bernith decided to switch to a business where she did not have to leave home. She then decided to tackle the sale of shoes, clothes, general goods, accessories and plastics, a little bit of everything so her customers can find all they are looking for.

With a loan of $525, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy clothing, shoes for women, men, and children of different sizes and styles, as well as accessory items, such as earrings, hangers, among other things in large quantities, in addition to basic household necessities in order to keep her business well supplied.

Bernith lives with her husband and 2 children who help her assist customers. She is a secure woman, enthusiastic and continues to do well in life. One of her goals is to buy another rack to organize and display her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Translator

La señora Bernith A. P., socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Isabel” vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de Picota, distrito de Picota, Caserío de Nueva Unión, se dedica a la venta de ropas y zapatos, complementando con la venta de plásticos, pasamanería y un poco de abarrotes, su negocio se ubica en su propia casa ubicado en el Jr. Unión s/n. Después de probar en otros negocios, en los cuales tenía que salir de casa, decidió cambiar por uno en que no dejaría su casa, y decide emprender en el negocio de venta de ropas, zapatos, abarrotes, plásticos y pasamanería, un poco de todo y así el cliente encuentre todo lo que solicite. Con el crédito recibido de S/. 1,500.00, que será pagado en 6 meses, comprará prendas de vestir, zapatos para damas caballeros y niños en diferentes tallas y modelos, además artículos de pasamanería como aretes, ganchos entre otros en grandes cantidades y productos de primera necesidad y plásticos para tener bien surtido su negocio. Bernith, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos que le apoyan en la atención de los clientes, ella es una mujer segura, entusiasta y con ganas de seguir triunfando en la vida, uno de sus objetivos es comprar otro andamio para ordenar y exhibir su mercancía.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, accessories and other goods.

loans.name: Kea

texts.en: Mrs. Kea E. earns income selling fruit in the local market located in the Kan Yuo Village, Kampong Chhnang Province. Aside from this business, she also breeds pigs. Her second business is going well, and, therefore, Mrs. Kea E. would like to expand it. She is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and food to feed them. Mrs. Kea E. has already previously obtained a loan, which she used to start her fruit sale business and then successfully paid back.

loans.use: Purchase of piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria K., 53 year old trader is married with six children. Among these children three have completed college. Victoria supports her husband in providing for the household through the sale of used clothing and mortar. Selling of used clothing is lucrative in Ghana many people patronize it, especially the economically active poor. Mortar is used to pound fufu, which one of favorite diet among most Ghanaians.  She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing and mortar to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her save for her children’s education. She would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To buy increased bales of used clothing and mortar.

loans.name: Nasimjon

texts.en:
N. Nasimjon is 24 years old. In spite of his young age he is working and supporting his parents. He is an expert in DVD recording services. For more than eight years he has provided audio editing of videotape and DVD recordings of the family events of his clients. Nasimjon tries to use modern up-to-date technologies in his work so that he can satisfy the demands and requirements of the customers. 

Nasimjon dreams of getting a higher education. But unfortunately that is impossible as his parents currently are not working. Nasimjon has to work hard because he is the only breadwinner in his family. 

Now he is planning to purchase a new modern computer in order to improve the quality of his work and to expand the business. For this purpose Nasimjon requests 3400 Somoni (US $1000) for the term of 12 months. This is Nasimjon's first loan.  He thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing a new modern computer in order to improve the quality of his work.

loans.name: Jose Dolores

texts.es: El Sr. José habita en un barrio que se llama Hialeah II etapa, en la capital de Managua, tiene 41 años de edad,  su esposa es comerciante en la venta de ropa y ayuda a su hogar a compartir los gastos, tiene  dos hijos de 10 y 12 años de edad, que estudian, el negocio de don José  es la venta ambulante de electrodomésticos, ropa, productos plásticos y una variedad de productos que vende al crédito y al contado, desde hace tres años y sus ventas han sido buenas ya que su negocio ha crecido, el inicio con dinero propio solo vendiendo productos plásticos. Con la solicitud de dinero es para invertir en capital en la compra de mercadería varias para sastifacer con la demanda de pedido a sus clientes. A largo plazo es poder tener mayor inventario y que le permita abrir una cuenta de ahorro, para los gastos de estudios para sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Sr. José lives in the neighbourhood of Hialeah, in the capital of Managua. He is 41 years old. His wife has a business selling clothes, and they both contribute to the household expenses. He has two children, aged 10 and 12, who are both students. Sr. José sells household appliances, clothes, plastic products, and other items on the street for cash or credit. For the last three years sales have been good and his business has grown. He started out using his own money and selling only plastic products. With this loan, he is planning to buy a variety of merchandise to satisfy the demands of his customers. Long term, the loan will enable him to have a larger inventory and allow him to open a savings account for the education of his two children.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing for children and adults, and plastic products

loans.name: Yong

texts.en: Yong V., 32, works with her husband together making rice wine and raising pigs on a plot of land near her house. She earns on average about US$4 each day. This couple has two young children. Yong V. would like to take out a loan of US$400 to purchase more pigs, and the rest of the money is used to help in making rice wine.

loans.use: Raise pigs.

loans.name: Zelea M.

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Zelea G. from Mbarali. She is single but has 3 children, between the ages of 3 and 13. Zelea has been running a local restaurant, “Mama Lishe” since 2002.

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all-local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savory banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

She works at the business for 13-16 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by her mother. She currently earns about 200USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase more rice in bulk. In the future, she plans to establish another business. Zelea thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more rice in bulk

loans.name: Peau

texts.en: Peau K., 25, is married with 3 children. She has 2 years of experience in a chicken farm business. She sells to villagers and shops all around, 2 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). SPBD loans are Peau’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy fencing, cement, roofing, timber and nails to build a shelter for the chickens to live in. Her husband is lending a helping hand to run the business.

loans.use: To purchase fencing, cement, roofing, timber and nails

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La señora Rosa A. es propietaria de una estancia para bebes, hermosa labor a la que se dedica  desde hace 4 años, su esposo es maestro de una secundaria en una conocida escuela de la ciudad. Ahora tienen el proyecto de ampliar la guardería, es por ello que están solicitando este crédito para seguir como una buena opción para las madres  y darles el apoyo en un lugar más amplio y cómodo.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa A. owns her own daycare. She has been in this beautiful line of work for 4 years. Her husband is a teacher in a well-known middle school in the city. She now has plans to expand the nursery, which is why she is requesting this loan. She wants to keep being a good option for mothers, giving them support in a more spacious and comfortable setting.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Nursery expansion

loans.name: Obe

texts.fr: Obe A. est une jeune femme de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants tous à l’école. Elle est depuis 10 ans commerçante de céréales au grand marché d’Atakpamé, une ville située au centre du Togo. Elle espère avec ce crédit approvisionner son magasin pour mieux satisfaire la clientèle. Elle compte sur cette opportunité afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Dans la vue elle est celle qui s’est tenue debout
texts.en:
Obe A. is a young woman aged 45, married with 3 children, all of whom are in school. For 10 years, she has been a retailer of cereals in the grand market in Atakpamé, a city in central Togo. With this loan, she hopes to supply her store to better satisfy her customers. She is counting on this opportunity in order to improve her family's living conditions. In the photograph, she is the one standing.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of maize, millets, beans, and peanuts

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Luisa,  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Unidas”, vive en el Ricardo Palma S/Nº, Distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada,  tiene 46 años y es madre de 2 hijos, 1 que todavía depende de ella.

Se inició con S/. 300.00 por iniciativa propia empezó su negocio vendiendo refrigerios en un kiosco. Tiene 10 años trabajando con el Banco. 

En la actualidad, se dedica a la venta de Pollos a la brasa, y también brinda pensión y vende menú; en su misma casa, donde atiende a los moradores de la comunidad, y con el préstamo de S/3,000.00 que cancelará a plazo de 06  meses,  comprará  insumos como pollos vivos en javas , papas, tomates en sacos , mostazas, salsa de tomate y mayonesa en baldes para complementa el servicio de pollos a la braza; también bebidas refrescantes como gaseosas, aguas minerales.

Hoy, se siente mas independiente y segura, ya que es ella quien toma sus propias decisiones en su negocio y en los ingresos que genera.

Maria Luisa, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Luisa belongs to the "Mujeres Unidas" [United Women] Communal Bank and lives on Ricardo Palma street in the District of Bellavista in the Department of San Martín. She is married, is 35 years old and is mother to two children, one of which is still dependant on her. On her own initiative, she started her business with S/. 300.00 [USD$100] selling refreshments in a kiosk. She has been working with the communal bank for 10 years. Presently, she works selling rotisserie chickens, and she also offers room and board and a daily menu. She works out of her house where she attends to the the local community residents. With the loan of S/. 3,000.00 for which she will pay in 6 months, she will buy live chickens in cages, potatoes and tomatoes by the sack, mustards, tomato sauce and mayonnaise in buckets for the rotisserie chicken sales. She will also purchase refreshments such as sodas and mineral water. Today she feels more independent and secure, since she makes her own decisions about the business and about the income that is generated. Maria Luisa expresses her appreciation to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients such as live chickens in cages, potatoes, tomatoes, mustards, tomato sauce and mayonnaise in buckets, and drink refreshments

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is 34 years old. She is married with three children, all of whom are in school at the junior high and the primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana. 

Ama is a petty trader. She trades in vegetables such as peppers, tomatoes, onions, etc., on a table top in the market square. She procures the vegetables from the wholesalers and sometimes from the farmers in the nearby small communities at low prices. She says food vendors and other retailers normally purchase from her. 

Ama has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure vegetables in large quantities.

loans.use: To procure vegetables

loans.name: Fua

texts.en: Fua L., 63, is married with 8 children.  She has 4 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people/public 3 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about US $116).  SPBD loans are Fuao’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy garden spray chemicals; tools for planting taro, banana, and taamu; and to improve her home.

loans.use: Farming supplies and home improvement

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 59 años D. edad, vive con su esposo, quien se dedica a la venta D. bebidas y con sus dos hijas que son madres solteras. Se dedica a la venta D. jugos, en todas las variedades, un puesto del mercado más cercano a su casa, esta actividad al viene ejerciendo desD. hace 15 años y ve muy bien. Maria trabajó desD. muy joven y ahora le agrada ver que está saliendo adelante. Considera que la rentabilidad D. su negocio es debido a que  venD. diariamente y tiene una clientela regulara que degusta D. sus deliciosos jugos y sabrosos sándwich. Con MFP ya tiene 8 préstamos y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque los integrantes son cumplidos y solidarios. Con el dinero solicitado comprará frutas e ingredientes para sus jugos e invertirá en la compra D. bebidas para el negocio D. su esposo.
texts.en:
Maria is 59 years old, lives with her husband, and sells beverages with her two daughters, who are single mothers. She sells juices of all varieties at a post in the market that is closer to her home, she has been doing this activity for 15 years and likes to see that it is moving forward. Maria has worked since she was very young, and now she is pleased to see that it is moving ahead. Considering that the profitablity of her business depends on what is sold daily, she has has regular customers that try her delicious juices and tasty sandwhiches. With MFP she already has 8 loans and she likes to work with the village bank because there is solidarity among members and they are courteous. With the money requested she will buy fruits and ingredients for her juices, and she will invest in buying beverages for her husband's business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit for juices.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo tiene 55 años, está casado y tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 ya están casados y dos aún dependen él. Es vendedor ambulante y posee un vehiculo con el cual sale a hacer sus ventas por las zonas de Caacupé y una vez por semana hacia la zona de San Pedro.  Cuenta con clientela formada ya que hace casi 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad.  El crédito lo utiliza para compra de embutidos, golosinas y fideos, y con esto aumentara su stock y posibilitara que satisfaga gran parte de su demanda, y mejorar sus ingresos que con el cual cubre las necesidades básicas de su familia y los gastos de la universidad de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Hugo is 55 years old, married, and the father of 4 children -- 2 of whom are married, and two of whom are still dependent on him. He is a traveling salesman, and has a car he goes out with to make his sales in the Caacupé area, and, once a week, the San Pedro area. He has a developed clientele, since it has been almost 2 years since he started this business. The loan will be used to buy sausage, candy, and pasta, which will increase his stock and make it possible for him to meet much of his demand and improve his income so he can cover basic family needs, and college fees for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sausage, candy, and pasta.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther Ainoo is forty years old. She is married and currently has no children. She lives with her husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a commercial town in the western region of Ghana. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Esther sells all kinds of utensils. She buys her goods from Kumasi at affordable prices and sells them in a store at the market square in her community. She also treks to other markets to sell. Esther has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy utensils

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia, 51, lives with her carpenter husband in a government housing project for the poor in San Vicente, Brgy. 178, Caloocan City. Their three children are already living independently with their own families.

Cecilia sells vegetables and fish in her own stall along the busy street of her community. She hires one of her neighbors to assist her in tending her business, especially on busy days.

She earns 2,500 PHP per week, which she uses to maintain her business. She saves a large portion of her earnings for the family's other needs.

loans.use: Additional capital for her vegetable stall

loans.name: Ysolida

texts.es: Ysolida tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y con el menor de sus 4 hijos que aun es estudiante. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de “juanes” (plato típico de la región a base de arroz y carne de pollo) y bebidas en la puerta de su casa, la cual está ubicada frente a un centro educativo, teniendo a los alumnos como sus princiapales clientes. Lo que le gusta de su negocio es que la mantienen ocupada y se siente útil, además de agradarle mucho conversar con sus clientes. Por otro lado, su negocio le es muy rentable, porque el platillo que vende es muy demandado y las bebidas se venden constantemente debido al intenso calor de la región. Para un futuro cercano, Ysolinda quiere mandar a construir un kiosco adecuado para vender con mayor comodidad. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que entre todos sus compañeros se comprenden, son personas tranquilas y demuestran mucha responsabilidad en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más ingredientes para la preparación de sus “juanes” y también adquirira materiales de construcción para arreglar su vivienda, ya que le faltan algunas estructuras y teme que le puedan robar.
texts.en:
Ysolida is 50 years old and lives with her husband and the youngest of her 4 children, who is still a student. For the last 8 years she has sold "juanes" (a typical regional chicken and rice dish) and beverages from the doorway of her house, which is across the street from a school, which means that the students are her main customers. What she likes about her business is that it keeps her busy and she feels useful, and she enjoys talking with her customers. Also, the business is very profitable, because the food that she serves is very popular and she sells a lot of beverages due to the intense heat in the area. In the near future Ysolida would like to build a kiosk so that she could sell food more comfortably. This is her 7th loan with MFP and what she likes about working with her community bank is that the members understand each other well, are pleasant people, and are very responsible with their payments. With the money that she is requesting she will buy more ingredients for the food that she prepares and will also buy construction materials to fix up her house, because she is concerned that she can be robbed the way the house is now.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare food for sale

loans.name: Georgette

texts.en: Georgette is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of 2 children. In 1990, she decided to help her husband in the household by working as a home-based tailor. After this long experience, Georgette is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new sewing machine to satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella L. is from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old. Estrella is married and has 3 school-aged children. Estrella operates a business planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables to sale. Estrella has been engaged in her business for over 22 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Estrella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Estrella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP. These funds will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops for raising. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Estrella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops for growing.

loans.name: Doli Bety

texts.es:
La señora Doli, pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Martín de Porras”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 30 años y madre de 01 hijo, uno que ya viene en camino.

Lleva 02 años, dedicándose a la venta de pescado fresco, motivada por ella misma y así ayudar con los gastos del hogar, contando para esto con un capital de S/.300.00 que fue muy bien invertido, por lo que hoy en día continúa con el mismo negocio pero ya en mayores cantidades y en variedad de  especies, ubicándose en el Mercado Central “Pomarosa”, de su Ciudad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 700.00, comprará pescados frescos en sacos, tanto lo que produce la región como los de la costa del país como: bocachico, palometas, toa, gamitada, tilapias, toyo, pejerey para así mantener surtido su negocio y satisfacer el exigente gusto de su clientela. 

Doli, nos manifiesta que se encuentra muy agradecida con el apoyo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos y así mismo pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres que le ha ayudado a superar dificultades que en algún momento tuvo que pasar pero que ahora los enfrenta con mucha fortaleza.
texts.en:
Sra. Doli is a member of the Communal Bank “San Martín de Porras”, which is located in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 30 years old, in a common law marriage, and an expectant mother with one child on the way.

For two years, she has been selling fresh fish. Doli was motivated to start her business so that she could help with the household expenses. She invested her initial capital of 300 soles very well, and her business continues today. Now she buys in greater quantities and offers a wider variety of fish from her post at the Pomares Central Market in her city.

With this loan of 700 soles, Doli will purchase sacks of fresh fish that are either produced in the region or caught off the coast of the country. These include bocachico, palometas, toa, gamitada, tilapia, toyo, and perjerey, which will keep her business well-stocked and satisfy the demanding tastes of her customers.

Doli tells us that she is very grateful for the support of Manuela Ramos. She is proud that she belongs to a group of women that have helped her overcome difficulties. Now she is able to face obstacles with tremendous strength.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fresh fish

loans.name: Alma Nubia

texts.es: Alma Nubia O.  tiene la edad de 52 años, es una mujer casada. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es carpintería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que inicio con esfuerzo propio anteriormente no tenía un medio de trabajo por lo que no tenia ingresos para mantener a su familia, a pesar de los constantes problemas de salud no pero esto no le impidió seguir con este trabajo a pesar de ser mujer, ha logrado salir adelante.  Es así que decide realizar este financiamiento con el fin de invertir en su negocio para capital de trabajo con herramientas necesarias, materia prima y mano de obra. El deseo de Alma es que su negocio progrese para beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
Alma Nubia O. is 52 and married. She is raising three children. She is a carpenter, and she has been in this business for over five years. She started through her own efforts. Previously, she did not have the means to work, and she did not have an income to support her family. In spite of constant health problems, she kept going with this work. In spite of being a woman, she has been successful. That is how she decided to ask for a loan for working capital to buy necessary tools, raw material, and pay for labor. Alma’s wish is that her business progresses and benefits her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal “Rió Desaguadero” del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 52 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, tiene 05 hijos, vive en el jr. Puno 458, estudio educación primaria incompleta (4to grado).

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 8 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ropa.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 2500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ropa para vender en la feria semanal.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando y convertirse en mayorista.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las facilidades en los préstamos
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the communal bank called Rio Desaguadero, in the Chucuito province of Puno. She is 52 years old and lives with her husband and their 5 children. Francisca was only able to complete her primary education until the fourth grade. She has been working with the organization Manuela Ramos for the last 8 years. Her first loan enabled her to grow her business buying and selling clothing. She will use the new loan to purchase more clothing to sell at the weekly market. She would like to continue growing her business and eventually become a wholesaler.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more clothing which she sells at the weekly market

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena O. is 37 years old and is the mother of seven children. She is already a widow and strives hard to survive in the difficulties of life.

Maria Elena supports her family with her manicure and pedicure business but needs financial support in sustaining her business. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in February 2008 because it has a low interest rate. She’s now requesting a loan of Php 8,000 to buy more supplies and materials needed for her business.

loans.use: To buy more supplies and materials needed for her business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia Z. is from the village of Luz Banson, a barangay in Jasaan municipality located in Misamis Oriental province on Mindanao Island. She is 45 years old, married and has four school-aged children. Lydia owns a shop from which she sells generic drugs to the local community. Lydia has been in business for over eight years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In May 2009, Lydia joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, her third from HSPFI, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell (she has repaid her second loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI). She plans to use all additional revenue to pay for her children’s education.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a 38-year-old married mother of three children. She lives in Mombasa, in the town of Majaoni. Her husband, Francis, is a businessman in Mombasa.
For the last nine years, Deborah has been in the business of selling second-hand clothes in Majaoni. Her main customers are the families in the Majaoni area and passers-by. Deborah is borrowing her first loan from Kiva partner KADET, and plans to purchase two more bails of second-hand clothes, commonly known as "mitumba". She hopes that, one day, she will own a large clothes store and be able to employ several workers.

About KADET
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy two bails of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Sonia Monica

texts.es:
La señora Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Tupac Amaru I” desde hace 6 meses atrás del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 23 años de edad, cuenta con estudios superiores incompletos, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo.
Sonia se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con los que podrà comprar pescado.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa en Yunguyo. 
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
For the last six months, Sonia has been a member of the “Tupac Amaru I” Communal Bank in Yunguyo district of the Puno region of Peru. She is 23 years old, lives with her partner, has one son, and did not finish secondary school.

Sonia buys and sells fish and used her first loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement (for 500 Peruvian nuevos soles) as working capital. She is currently requesting a loan for 500 nuevos soles to purchase fish.

Her dream for the future is to have her own house in Yunguyo.

Her favorite thing about her communal bank is the savings account.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fish

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda E. is from the village of Bacolod, Ozamis City. She is 55 years-old and married with six adult children. Leonarda raises crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from planting and harvesting banana for sale. Leonarda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Leonarda joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonarda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Leonarda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Leonarda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita S., 44, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Oscar S., a carpenter, and they are blessed with five children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. Together, they have been selling wood furniture for many years.

Teresita has been a regular member of Kiva's partner Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than three years. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow 13 times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy more wood and lumber.   Her business lets her earn a profit of 8,500 Philippine pesos per month.  

Now, with your help, she would like a PHP 22,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for buying more wood and lumber for her expanding furniture business.

She prays that they will have earn enough resources to fix their house and that their children will have a better life in the future. 


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: Purchasing wood and lumber for her furniture business

loans.name: Alieva Aigul`s Group

texts.en:
Aigul, 30, is the leader of this group. She is divorced and has no children. She lives with her younger sister in her own house. Aigul is a farmer. In 1995, the local government assigned her family agricultural land and since then, she has been in this business. The land is about 0.63 hectares. In the upcoming spring, she is planning to plant cotton and potatoes. This loan will be used to buy one ton of potato seeds. At tthe present time, her seasonal income of farming exceeds $1,500. Besides this, she works in the local cement factory as a cook. Her salary is about $150. This is her first loan in Mol Bulak Finance.

Anarahon, 30, is a mother of four little children. Her husband is a guest worker in Russia. She also has some land, where she usually plants cotton, corn and potatoes. This year, she is going to plant cotton. She needs a loan to buy potato seeds. In the future, she hopes to save some money that will be enough to buy a car for her husband.

Nursuluu, 23, is also a farmer. She is married. Her family has a total of 0.46 hectare of land. She cultivates potatoes, rice and tobacco there. She needs a loan to prepare for spring sow, which is to plough and buy potato seeds.

Chingiz is 29 years old. He is married with two children. His wife is a school principal in a local school. Chingiz will use this loan to buy one ton of potato seeds. His annual income per month is about $150. He is planning to open a little clothes shop in the future. When he has time, he provides passenger transportation services in Aravan village. For this purpose, he bought a Daewoo Tico.

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: This loan will be used to buy one ton of potato seeds

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.en: Ignacio is thirty years old and married to Carmen Alvarez, who is thirty-four and sells empanadas to neighbors, friends, and Ignacio's clients. The couple has one child together who is beginning elementary school. Ignacio is a mechanic, and he has an established client base. He learned the profession from his cousin, who he worked with for more than ten years. Eight years ago, Ignacio opened his own shop, which has been very successful due to his good service and excellent work. He is seeking the loan to refurbish his house.

loans.use: To refurbish his house

loans.name: Agua De La Caña Group

texts.es:
EL GRUPO DE "AGUA DE LA CAÑA" LLEVA EL NOMBRE DE LA COMUNIDAD QUE PERTENECE AL MUNICIPIO DE PINOTEPA NACIONAL OAXACA. LAS INTEGRANTES TODOS SON COMERCIANTES. ALICIA M. R. Y VERONICA L. VENDEN POLLO FRESCO DESTAZADO. TERESA S. M., LEOVIGILDA H. M. Y ANGELA G. M. VENDEN TAMALES. MARGARITA O. R. Y PORFIRIA L. S. VENDEN COSMETICOS POR CATALOGO. ANDREA G. L. VENDE VERDURAS EN UNA LOCALIDAD. DOLORES H. C. VENDE PAN, Y CAROLINA A. C. VENDE PESCADO Y CAMARON SECO Ó FRESCO SEGUN PUEDA MERCAR EN PINOTEPA O CORRALERO DONDE PESCAN EL MARISCO.

LA SRA TERESA S. M. ES LA REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO. ES CASADA Y TIENE D0S HIJOS DE 14 Y 5 AÑOS DE EDAD.  ELLA VENDE TAMALES PORQUE TIENE MUCHOS AÑOS TRABAJANDO EN EL MISMO NEGOCIO YA QUE ES UN PRODUCTO QUE SE VENDE MUY RAPIDO EN LA COMUNIDAD Y EN CANTIDAD CONSIDERABLE. TRABAJA PARA AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO EN LOS GASTOS YA QUE DESEA QUE SUS HIJOS SE SUPEREN Y ALGUN DIA SEAN PROFESIONISTAS.
CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO QUE SOLICITA A LA  FUNDACION LO INVERTIRÁ EN COMPRA DE INGREDIENTES PARA PREPARAR TAMALES COMO CHILES SECO, MANTECA, SAL, OREGANO, HOJAS DE PLATANO, MAIZ, LEÑA, Y PASAJES YA QUE SE TRASLADA A PINOTEPA A COMPRAR.

CONOCE MUY BIEN A TODOS SUS COMPAÑERAS DEL GRUPO Y NOS COMENTÓ QUE SON PERSONAS RESPONSABLES Y QUE NO FALLARAN CON SUS PAGOS A FUNDACION. NOS COMENTÓ QUE DE CONTINUAR RECIBIENDO EL BENEFICIO DEL CREDITO, A FUTURO PIENSA EN PONER UN LUGAR ESTLABLECIDO PARA PODER OFRECER UNA VARIEDAD DE ANTOJITOS COMO SON SOPES, ENCHILADAS, TAMALES, TOSTADAS, ETC.  ESTA AGRADECIDA POR EL APOYO QUE LE DAN LOS PRESTATARIOS DE KIVA A TRAVES DE FUNDACION REALIDAD Y PIDE CONTINUEN OFRECIENDO CREDITO PARA QUE PUEDAN MEJORAR SU CONDICIÓN DE VIDA TRABAJANDO.
texts.en:
The group "agua de la caña" (sugar cane water) takes its name from the community that is a part of the municipality of Pinotepa Nacional Oaxaca. Its members are businesswomen. Alicia and Veronica sell fresh cut up chicken. Teresa, Leovigilda, and Angela sell tamales. Margarita and Porfiria sell cosmetics from a catalog. Andrea sells vegetables. Dolores sells bread and Carolina sells fresh and dried fish and shrimp that she gets from Pinotepa or Corralero, where they fish for seafood. Teresa is the group’s representative. She is married and has two children, ages 14 and 5. She sells tamales because she’s been working for many years in this trade and this is an item that sells quickly and in good quantity. She works so that she can help her husband with the household expenses and she hopes that her children will succeed and one day take professional careers. She will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients, such as dried chili, lard, salt, oregano, banana leaves, corn, and firewood. She will also use some of the money to pay for trips to Pinotepa, where she buys her ingredients. She knows all of her fellow members very well and tells us that they are very responsible people who will not be delinquent with their payments. She also says that in the future she would like to open an establishment where she can offer a variety of food, such as sopes, enchiladas, tamales, tostadas, etc. She is thankful for the support that the Kiva lenders have given her through “Fundacion Realidad,” and asks that they continue to offer loans so that the ladies can improve their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients and supplies

loans.name: Datchi Ami Holassé

texts.en:
Datchi Ami Holassé K. is 28 years old. She began selling fabrics in 2003 and works as a roaming saleswoman in the Agoé district of Lomé, Togo.

Ms. K. purchases her stock from the Grand Market of Lomé and is now seeking to resupply her products. She is asking for her second loan from WAGES, which she will use primarily to purchase more fabrics to sell as well as any other items she may need to keep her business running smoothly.

As a single mother, this loan will help Ms. K. to support her business and her one child.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics to sell

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana S. was born in 1975. She lives in Ijevan city with her husband, two children, mother-in-law and father-in-law. Liana is a nurse, but she manages her own business: clothes and shoes trading. At the same time she and her family are busy with a swine breeding business.

With the profit from the business Liana’s family was able to construct their own shop, but it is still unrepaired, so Liana still manages her business in a rented shop in Ijevan Central fair.

Liana asks for a loan of 650000 AMD to buy a spring assortment of clothes and shoes to sell. She intends to spend future income to repair her own shop.

loans.use: To buy a spring assortment of clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anh's Group

texts.en:
Anh T. T. is 35 years old. She has two young children. She has a 1.700 sqm paddy in which she grows rice to support her family as far as their food goes. She also raises 3000 chicks for eggs and 8 pigs. The products from her livestock raising are sold retail in the local market. She makes 100.000 Vietnam dong per day. Her husband helps her a lot with her livestock. She has participated in SEDA's microfinancing program since 2003 and repaid punctually. She is the group leader of 6-member group loan through SEDA. In this cycle,  she wants to get 6.322.000 VND to buy feed for her livestock and buy a rice-husking machine.

 About the other members in her group:

 Quy T. Q.  is 27 years old. She has two young children.  She runs a small restaurant that serves breakfast . She can earn 50.000 Vietnam dong profit per day from this activity. Additionally, she raises 8 pigs for meat. Her husband is a carpenter  with an income of 3.000.000  Vietnam dong per month.  But their total income is not enough for all expenditures.  Their living standard is not good. She wants to get 5.886.000 VND to buy some furniture  to improve her restaurant.

 Huong T. N. is 45 years old. She wants to get 7.194.000 VND  to expand her livestock business such as improving the pigpen and buying feed. She will rebuild her house next year.

Trung T. N. is a 36-year-old businesswoman. She has  one son and one daughter.  They are  in secondary school. She has a shop that sells  fresh shrimp  and fish  for wedding parties.  She wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND to  buy more seafood products to meet the demand of her customers.

Phuong T. H. was born in 1966. She has two children who  study pharmacy at the university and attend high school. Every day, she runs a small restaurant  for breakfast.  She wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND to pay school fees, with a part invested in her shop.

Lam Q. T. is a  40-year-old businessman. He has a small wood workshop to make tables, armchairs etc. in the traditional style so he always is busy with  many new orders from clients. Now he needs to borrow 7.194.000 VND to buy a new cutting machine to improve productivity to try to meet the demand of his customers.

loans.use: to buy feed for her livestock and buy a rice husking machinne

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina J. is from the village of Pandan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old. Gina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a business buying and selling vegetables in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Gina is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more vegetables to sell & working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Gina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell & working capital.

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea S. is married and lives with his wife and five children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, known as the most populated city in the country. He is a police officer and earns an income of USD 5 per day. His wife is a grocery seller, earning an income of USD 5 per day. His wife appears in the photograph.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase more groceries to stock his wife’s store. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to expand her business. This is his fourth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock his wife's store

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El Sr. Luis tiene 39 años, está casado con la Sra. Sonia hace 17 años, tienen 3 hijos, todos ellos varones: Walter (21), Juan Luis (14) y Jorge Ramón (13) ,los tres chicos se encuentran estudiando.
El Sr. Luis anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de leche y poseía una carnicería, comenta que comenzó a interesarse por la Veterinaria y comenzó a estudiar hasta que se recibió de Doctor en Veterinaria, desde entonces, exactamente hace 2 años que posee su Agro-Veterinaria donde trabaja en compañía de su esposa.
 En dicho lugar atiende a una buena cantidad de clientes, quienes se encuentran muy contentos con el servicio.
El Sr. Luis solicita el  préstamo para la instalación de una peluquería para mascotas.
texts.en:
Luis, 39, has been married to Sonia for seventeen years. They have three children, all of them boys: Walter, 21, Juan Luis, 14, and Jorge Ramón, 13. The three boys are all students. Luis used to sell milk and had a butcher shop. He says that he became interested in Veterinary Science and studied until he received his degree. Since then he has run Agro-Veterinaria for exactly two years, where he works with his wife. His business serves a lot of customers who are very happy with his service. Luis requests a loan for the installation of a pet grooming salon.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of a pet grooming salon

loans.name: Tomas Andino

texts.es: Don Tomas Andino R. tiene 42 años de edad, vive en la Aldea Agua Caliente de Linaca Choluteca, es un señor muy trabajador que se dedica a su trabajo permanente. Es padre de 4 hijos, los cuales mantiene junto con la ayuda de su esposa. Por medio de su trabajo ha sacado adelante a su familia con mucho esfuerzo. En su tiempo libre trabaja con Caritas de Honduras, una organizacion caritativa de Honduras. El planea utilizar el prestamo para comprar materiales de construccion y asi mejorar su casa para tener una mejor calidad de vida para el y su familia.
texts.en:
Don Tomas Andino R. is 42 years old and lives in the Aldea Agua Caliente of Linaca Choluteca. He is a very hard-working man. He is the father of 4 children, whom he supports with the help of his wife. With much effort, through his work, he has given his family a decent standard of living. In his free time, he works for Caritas de Honduras, a charitable organization in Honduras. He plans to use this loan to buy construction materials to renovate his house and provide a higher standard of living for himself and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials, cement, sand and payment of workers

loans.name: Msombo

texts.en: Msombo W. is an entrepreneur and a married woman running a business purchasing and selling different kinds of clothes to customers at Kigamboni ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the business goods from the wholesale and retail clothes shops at Kariakoo business shopping center and Karume small entrepreneur used clothes city market. Her business plan is to run a wholesale shop as her business income grows. She needs a loan of T.shs 800,000 to buy more clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; La socia esta ubicada en el barrio de Arcopata, perteneciente al distrito de Santiago , provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Natividad; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es conviviente y  tiene 2 Hijos; La socia es una mujer multifacética, ella se dedica entre sus diversas actividades a la venta de pinturas de forma ambulatoria, también trabaja limpiando las oficinas de una financiera de créditos locales, y los fines de semana ella vende cds en la plaza de Huanchac. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en comprar los cds y sus cajitas, y en comprar las pinturas.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a part of the “Vamos Juntos” (We Go Together) communal bank. She lives in the Arcopata neighborhood, within the Santiago province, in the Cusco department. Natividad is 28 years old, lives with her life partner and two children. She is a multifaceted woman. Among her business activities, she sells cosmetics on foot and also cleans offices for a local finance company. On the weekends she sells CDs in the Huachac Plaza. She is asking for this loan so that she can buy CDs, CD cases, and cosmetics. She is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this medium and she is committed to making her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CDs, CD cases, and makeup

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make monthly payments

loans.name: Lemmy

texts.en:
Lemmy L. is a businessman who lives in Kangemi in Nairobi city. He is 37 years old and married to Rachael, who is a housewife. They are blessed with two children. He is a carpenter and has been doing this business for six years with an income of 8,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs.) per month. 

Lemmy learned about KADET LTD. through a friend and this is his first loan of Kshs.10,000 with KADET LTD. He plans to buy timber worth Kshs. 9,200, nails worth Kshs. 300 and paint worth Kshs. 500. His business is situated at a strategic place in Kagemi, where most of his clients live.

He wishes to grow his business to receive better income to sustain the family’s needs. He also plans to make use of the income that he will get to open up another workshop elsewhere so that he can move his family to a bigger house and take his children to a better school.

loans.use: To buy timber, nails and paint

loans.name: Mwania

texts.en:
Mwania K. is a married man. His wife is a business lady and they have two children, aged 10 years old and 3 years old, whom they hope to give a quality education to the university level. 

His business is located at the open-air market called Kongowea in Mombasa and is well-known by the name Mwania K. Spares. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well-known for its many, many tourist-attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches. He has been selling motorcycle and bicycle spare parts to the local people. He has been in this business for eight years now and he says that this business is profitable. The major challenges he has are lack of enough capital and the high prices for the spare parts. 

He is using his loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more motorcycle spare parts to meet the demand of his customers. He hopes that his business will grow and he sees himself opening many more hardware stores, therefore becoming a director. He describes himself as honest, trustworthy and committed to his business.

loans.use: Stock of motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Voi

texts.en:
Voi T. N. is 55 years old with five children. She has been a noodle maker for many years. Every day she makes noodles from fifteen kilos of rice. Her good-quality product sells well at retail in local markets. She earns a 100,000 VND profit from this activity.

As a member of our credit program since 2004, she has been a good borrower. Now she would like a loan of 8,938,000 VND to buy five pigs which she intends to raise next month.

loans.use: To buy five pigs

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda M. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables known as korofo, okra and dodo and is requesting a loan to stock more fish to sell.  

Linda is 41 years old and is married.  Her husband is a builder. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: Stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Carlos Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is forty years old. He owns his home and shares it with his wife and their two young children. They live in the district of Tambogrande, specifically in the village of Guaraguaos Bajo. It is a rural region and fairly tropical. The majority of the population work on small fruit plantations and raise animals.

Roberto owns a small parcel of land which he inherited from his parents. He raises limes on that land and also has a small herd of sheep. These activities provide his family with a relatively constant income stream and a small level of protection in hard times.

The loan will be used to purchase additional farm products to protect his trees and improve production. He hopes to be able to increase his family's income and to provide for the ongoing education of his children. He is very hard working and well respected in the region.

loans.use: to purchase additional farm products

loans.name: Him

texts.en: Mrs. B. is a 50-year-old widowed mother. She has a small shop in the local market in Phnom Penh City. She always gets up early in the morning in order to travel to the place that sells vegetables in bulk, then she brings them to retail to people who come to the market. B. has two children, one of whom (a son) repairs vehicles to earn a living, while the remaining one is jobless. To accrue a daily profit, B. hopes to expand her vegetable business by investing a Kiva loan as capital. Any remaining cash from the loan, B. will use to contribute to her son for buying more vehicle spare parts to perform his repairing service.

loans.use: To expand her vegetable business.

loans.name: José Mario

texts.es: José Mario C. M. de 53 años de edad, reside en  Zacatecoluca, en el departamento de La Paz. José es padre soltero de 5 hijos quienes se dedican a estudiar. Él posee una panadería la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación, lugar muy concurrido en el cual las ventas son muy estables. Sus hijos le ayudan a la elaboración del pan y a atender el negocio cuando José se encuentra afuera repartiendo el pan. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar todos los insumos necesarios como: harina, miel, azúcar, mantequilla y otros más. José es un hombre muy responsable quien trabaja arduamente para brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos, es por esto que para él, mantener las ganancias estables es de mucha importancia, ya que la panadería es su única fuente de ingresos, por ello es necesario esforzarse por mejorarla día con día en su servicio.
texts.en:
José Mario C. M. is 53 years old.  He lives in Zacatecoluca, in La Paz department.  José is a single father.  His 5 children are all studying.  José owns a bakery which is located in his home.  His business is very busy and his sales are stable.  His children help him make the bread and serve in the business when he is out delivering bread.

José is requesting a loan so that he has the money he needs to buy all the necessary supplies for his business such as: flour, honey, sugar, butter, etc.  José is a very responsible man who works hard so that he can provide his children with the best.  This is why, for him, keeping his profits stable is very important since the bakery is his only source of income.  This means that he has to work hard to improve it every day.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Flor Yolanda

texts.es: Flor Yolanda R. A., reside en Sensuntepeque, en el departamento de Cabañas, en donde vive junto a su madre la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y así mismo vive junto a 3 hijos menores de edad. Flor posee una venta de tortillas en el mercado regional de Sensuntepeque, en donde ha trabajado durante 4 años, razón por la que es muy conocida por la mayoría de personas, y así mismo cuenta con varios clientes fijos quienes compran su productos a diario. Flor es la única que trabaja en su hogar, por lo que debe esforzarse mucho por sostener a su madre y tres hijos los cuales dependen por completo de ella. Flor solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor, ya que desea preveer las alzas de este para el nuevo año, por lo que espera aumentar su materia prima y de esta forma seguir brindando un excelente servicio.
texts.en:
Flor Yolanda R. A. resides in Sensuntepeque, in the Cabañas region. She lives with her mother, who dedicates herself to running the home, and also with her three school-age children.

Flor has a place for selling tortillas in the Sensuntepeque regional market, where she has worked for 4 years. It is a good location because it is well known to most people, and there are also regular customer who buy her produce every day. Flor is the only one in her household who works, and so she must work hard to sustain her mother and three children, who depend upon her for everything. Flor is seeking the loan to buy corn in bulk, so she can avoid the effects of the price rises she expects to see in the new year. With it she hopes to increase her stock of her raw material (the corn) and in this way continue offering an excellent service.

loans.use: To buy corn for making tortillas

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna Dudu is currently in the business of selling pans and clothes.  She is requesting a loan to buy more bags of clothes.  Anna is 40 years old and is widowed.   She has 3 children who are going to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to building a house.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Cruz De Los Santos

texts.es:
Don Cruz de los Santos M., es empleado activo de una empresa de acueducto y alcantarillado, desempeñando es cargo de Conductor de Transporte Pesado, desde hace dos años y medio.

Es casado, de 49 años de edad, con tres personas a su cargo, una de ellas es menor de edad, el vive en la ciudad de Managua, en el Municipio de Tipitapa, el el Barrio Yuri Ordoñez.

Este es el primer crédito con CEPRODEL lo solicita para mejora de vivienda, y se encuentra satisfecho con este préstamo ya que le permitirá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia
texts.en:
Cruz de los Santos M. has been working as a heavy goods driver for a water supply and sewerage company for the past two and a half years.  He is 49 years old, married, and has three people in his care, one of whom is a minor.  He lives in Yuri Ordoñez neighborhood, in the city of Managua, in Tipitapa municipality.

This is the first loan that Cruz de los Santos has requested from CEPRODEL.  He is requesting it to make improvements to his home.  He is happy to be receiving the loan since it will allow him to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Koy

texts.en:
Koy P. has been a farming businesswoman for a long time. She lives in the province of Kompong Tom. Since 1998, Koy P. has owned and operated her farm to cultivate a rice crop, from which she makes a profit.   Koy P. is married to Mr. Hout Phorn, age 40, who is a fisherman.  Koy P. has three children, two of whom are learning in the local school, and one at home depends on her care.  

Recently, her family has been facing difficulty with their living conditions because their house needs repairs. To solve the problem, Koy P. would like a loan to purchase wood in order to repair a part of her broken house.

loans.use: To purchase wood in order to repair a part of her broken house.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther M. is a married lady. Her husband works for a security firm and they have three children between 2 and 9 years old, who they hope to provide a good education through the university level. 

Esther's business is located at Vikwatani in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for many tourist sites, including white-sand beaches on the Indian Ocean. 

Esther has a tailoring shop where she makes clothes for local people. She has been in this business for four years. She says the business is profitable and the major challenge she has is her financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy materials to expand her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to be a market leader in this type of business in future. She describes herself as determined and open-minded.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Noreen's Group

texts.en:
Noreen lives in Khanewal which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, and is known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in the area of Shanti nagar with her family in a two-room brick house for the past sixteen years. She is married to K. who is involved in the agriculture profession. He works a small piece of land and grows different seasonal crops on it and sells to his customers. He has been in this profession for the past ten years and has vast knowledge about this work.
 
Noreen is the mother of three children. Only one of them is able to attend school and is getting his education. She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy fertilizers and seeds to grow crops and to get maximum output from his field.  
Noreen is hopeful that an investment will put her husband’s business in a more profitable position and her family will be able to enjoy better financial benefits as a result. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Noreen.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow crops.

loans.name: Rosa Magdalena

texts.es:
Doña Rosa, reside en San Miguel, tiene 44 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de tamales y costura, vive con su hijo de siete años; de este negocio depende ella y sus hijos.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, esta compra es de productos necesarios para hacer los tamales (maíz, pollo, condimentos), con la que pretende aumentar el inventario y también la producción.  
Doña Rosa, tiene como objetivo instalar su propio negocio y estar libre de los financiamientos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 44, lives in San Miguel.  She sells tamales and is a Seamstress.  She lives with her seven year old son.  She and her children depend on this business.

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise needed to make tamales (corn, chicken, condiments) to increase inventory and production.

Rosa’s objective is to set up her own business and to be free of financing.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tamales.

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
La señora Giovanna, es socia del banco comunal Nuevas Amigas del Distrito de calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.
Ella se dedica a la venta de comida, tiene un pequeño restaurante donde se encarga de recibir a sus clientes personalmente y ver que sean bien atendidos.
Con su nuevo préstamos de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles renovará las vajillas; 2 docenas de platos tipo fuente, 3 docenas de vasos grandes, 3 docenas platos para sopa, 2 docenas de platos tendidos, 2 docenas de jarras, 2 docenas de cubiertos.
Son 10 años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, le ha servido para implementar cada vez más su restaurante, porque de ahí depende el futuro de sus hijos.  Su esposo es profesor y el sueldo que recibe es poco y solo alcanza para la comida y algunos gastos básicos del hogar.  Gracias al negocio han podido solventar otros gastos.
texts.en:
Giovanna, is a member of the "Nuevas Amigas" community bnak which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 37 years old, married, and has 2 children.

Giovanna's business is selling meals.  She owns a small restaurant where she greets her customers personally and makes sure that they are well served.

Giovanna will use her new loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles to renew her crockery.  She will buy two dozen dishes, three dozen large glasses, three dozen soup plates, two dozen shallow dishes, two dozen pitchers and two dozen sets of cutlery.

Giovanna has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for 10 years.  They have helped her to equip her restaurant and the future of her children depend on her business.  Her husband is a teacher and his wage is quite small.  It only stretches far enough to buy food and cover some basic household expenses.  Thanks to her business, Giovanna has been able to cover other expenses.

loans.use: to buy crockery

loans.name: Shalom: Dios Con Nosotros Group

texts.es: La Sra. Blanca es conviviente  y tiene 1 hija D. un año D. edad,Blanca es integrante D. la alcancía comunal “SHALOM:DIOS CON NOSOTROS” grupo conformado por 7 socios que se dedican a actividades D. comercio, blanca  tiene su propia librería donD. venD. lápiz, cuadernos  y útiles D. escritorio, saca copias y impresiones desD. hace 7 años este negocio surge a raíz D. que ella quería pagar sus estudios D. enfermería y es así que  gracias  a su esfuerzo y dedicación se compro su terreno, una fotocopiadora y una computadora y a su vez  ha  logrado terminar su carrera D. enfermera, y pueD.  brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida a su hija. El préstamo que  se le otorgo fue para comprar mercadería  para implementar su negocio. Sabemos que Blanca  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo la ayudaran.
texts.en:
Blanca lives with her partner and has a one year old daughter.  Blanca is a member of the “Shalom: Dios Con Nosotros” [Shalom: God With Us] communal bank, maD. up of seven members dedicated to trading activities.  Blanca has her own bookstore where she sells pencils, notebooks and other office supplies, and makes copies and prints.  

This business arose seven years ago because Blanca wanted to pay for her nursing studies.  Thanks to her efforts and her dedication, she bought land, a photo copier and a computer.  In the meantime, she succeeded in completing her nursing career and can now proviD. a better quality of life to her daughter.

The loan Blanca was given was for the purchase of merchandise to begin her business.  With much work and effort, we know that Blanca will fulfill her goals, and that the loans from Edaprospo will help her.

loans.use: purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his children fee in private school

loans.name: Jenour

texts.en:
Jenour is from the village of Tagpako, Gingoog City. He is 21 years old and married. To make a living, Jenour owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, buying and raising pigs for resale. He also provides motorela or habal-habal (motorcycle transportation) services. Jenour has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately $209 a month for these activities.

In 2010, he joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. 

Jenour is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be his 4th loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Marife has a retail shop that sells beauty products like lotions, shampoo & face powder. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional stocks of beauty products from NATASHA & AVON.

Marife is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marife hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional beauty products from NATASHA & AVON

loans.name: Liliam

texts.es: Liliam es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien tiene una pulpería la cual inicio con la venta de chiverías y además comercializa ropa al crédito este último lo inicio hace poco. Ella es casada tiene dos hijos por los cuales labora arduamente. El crédito lo invertirá en mercadería para ambos negocios como granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, maíz), chiverías y ropa (camisas, pantalones, vestidos…etc.)
texts.en:
Liliam is a hard-working woman, who is both vigorous and enterprising. She has a general store that she initiated to sell dairy products. Now, she sells many products, including clothing on credit. She began to sell clothes only recently.

Liliam is married and has 2 children on whose behalf she labors arduously. This loan will be invested in merchandise for both parts of her business: basic grains (rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, corn, dairy products), and clothing (shirts, pants, dresses, etc.).

loans.use: buy basic grains (rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, corn, dairy products), and clothing (shirts, pants, dresses), to sell.

loans.name: Melba Mercedes

texts.en: Melba Mercedes is a married mother of two children, ages 11 and 20. For the last 16 years, she has run a small eatery.  The loan proceeds will help her continue to operate her business, more specifically, will help her purchase basic grains she uses in food preparation.  Melba Mercedes would like to grow her business and increase the income to be able to support her family better.

loans.use: purchase basic grains she uses in food preparation

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es: Mayela, tiene la edad de 52 años, está casada y vive con su esposo. Ella pretende con el crédito realiza la compra de ropa para su posterior venta. Ella tiene el negocio desde varios días atrás y lo que quiere es aumentar las ganancias y las ventas. Con la compra de mas ropa ella podrá aumentar su clientela y darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Ella pretende con esto generar las ganancias para salir adelante con el crédito y ayudarle al esposo con los gastos del hogar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Mayela, age 52, is married and lives with her husband. She intends to use this loan to purchase clothing for her next sale. She has had this business for several days and wants to increase her earnings and sales. With the purchase of more clothing, she will be able to expand her customer base and provide better customer service. She will use this loan to generate the income to get ahead and help her husband with the household costs. This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has no previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided her with a loan that is easier to access and has much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for her next sale.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Eric 25, is a hardworking and determined business man.  He is married and blessed with three children.  Since the year 2002 he has been making a living by repairing automobiles.  In the next 5 years, he wants to own his own garage so that he is able to succeed and make meaningful investments. 

He is requesting for 30,00 Kenya shillings to buy filters and alternators. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for he is now able to support his family and business.

loans.use: to buy filters and alternators

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia, a 48-year-old married woman, lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines where she has owned and operated a retail store to make a living for 10 years now. The store normally gives Virgilia a monthly income of PHP 3,000.

Having joined GDMPC this year to gain access to financial services, she has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional stocks of rice and animal feed to sell. When Virgilia saves enough money, she will buy an LCD television to watch during leisure times in order to keep updated on world events, real-life situations and weather conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of rice and animal feed to sell.

loans.name: Fausta Teofila

texts.es: La señora Fausta de 40 años es casada y tiene una hija. Al ver ella que con el ingreso que su esposo tenia como taxista no les alcanzaba para cubrir sus necesidades básicas, decidieron iniciar un negocio el cual denominaron “Miscelánea Mary” este negocio existe desde hace 9 años en el cual venden abarrotes, dulces, refrescos, lácteos, papelería, frituras, helados y mas.  Fausta desarrollo un gusto por su tienda y ahora mas que un negocio es un proyecto de vida; para ella y su familia ya que les permite tener una fuente de ingresos mas, al mismo tiempo estar  de ser su propio Jefe y le gusta mucho ofrecer un trato amable a sus clientes y tenerles todo lo que ellos necesiten es por eso que solicita un apoyo para compra de mercancía y surtir su negocio.
