texts.en: Mrs. Fausta is 40 years old, married and has one daughter.  Upon seeing that the income that her husband provided as a taxi driver was not enough to cover their basic expenses, they decided to start a business which they called “Miscelánea Mary”(Mary's corner shop).  This business has been in existence for 9 years.  They sell groceries, sweets, refreshments, dairy products, paper products, fried food, ice cream and others.  Fausta has developed a liking for the store and it has become more than a business but her life's project.  It allows them to have a source of income while being their own boss.  She likes to treat her customers kindly and to have everything that they might need.  For this reason she is requesting a loan to be able to buy merchandise and stock her store.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the business.

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es:
El joven José Alberto está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprarle a su hermano menor un aparatos respirador, ya que se encuentra enfermo de Asma y necesita se aparato para poder respirar y tener un vida mucho mejor, 
José Alberto desea que su hermano tenga todo lo necesario para que tenga una vida norma y sin problema de salud, es por eso que solicita su cooperación para poder comprarle a su hermanito el aparato que necesita para respirar y pueda asistir ir a clase y podrá jugar con sus amigos. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su empleo en una tienda de muebles para el hogar como venderos.
texts.en:
Young José Alberto is requesting a loan so that he can buy a breathing device for his brother who has asthma and needs this machine in order to be able to breathe and lead a much better life.

José Alberto would like his brother to have everything he needs to lead a normal life without health problems.  For this reason, he is requesting your cooperation so that he can buy his little brother the device he needs to be able to breathe and attend class and play with his friends.  He plans to repay the loan with the salary that he makes from his job working as a salesman in a store that sells household furniture.

loans.use: to cover his brother's medical expenses

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with five children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a business of selling goats on the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Another major challenge is the price fluctuation in the market. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase goats and pay for transportation to her place of operation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase goats and pay for transportation to her place of operation.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with one child who is too young for school. Her husband, who is employed, also contributes to the provision of family's basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and transport. 

She has operated a retail shop for the past three years; her potential clients are the local community members. She faces a major challenge of theft. She dreams of owning a wholesale shop.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sugar, flour (wheat and maize) and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour (wheat and maize) and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Donatilda

texts.es:
Donatilda es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella, tiene 47 años y 4 hijos, es socia desde hace 8 años.
Donatilda tienen un Restaurante, todo ese tiempo ella pudo aprender mucho acerca de cómo administrar su negocio, y también pudo crecer, recuerda que antes vendía anticuchos y salchipapas y así poco a poco pudo progresar, todo lo que aprendía lo hacia en el negocio, con el ahorro pudo lograr que su negocio pueda crecer, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de sillas, su sueño es poder comprar su casa.
texts.en:
Donatilda is a member of the communal bank "Anabella". She is 47 years old and she has 4 children. She has been a member for the past 8 years. 

Donatilda has a restaurant, and all this time she has been able to learn a great deal about administering a business and she managed to expand it. She remembers the time when she used to sell shish-kebabs and salchipapas (a common Peruvian meal consisting of sausages and potatoes) and this is how she gradually progressed. Everything that she learned she practiced in her business. With her saving she managed to expand her business. She will invest her loan in the purchase of chairs. Her dream is to buy a house.

loans.use: to purchase chairs.

loans.name: God Bless Group

texts.en:
Mariatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. She is about 29 years of age. Mariatu is married and has 3 primary school-going children.

She has been a businesswoman for 20 years now. She sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, pepper, etc. Mariatu and her group members have applied for a loan of 2,500,000.00 SLL in order to expand their respective businesses. She is going to use her share of the loan to buy palm oil, rice, pepper, etc. in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, rice, pepper, etc. in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build another rental room in her house.

loans.name: Ngoan

texts.en: Ngoan, 48 years old, lives in Cho town, Yen Phong, Bac Ninh.  She has two children who are married.  For 10 years, Ngan has been running a restaurant with the help of her husband.  They sell breakfast and have a monthly income of about 5.000.000 Vietnam dong. Since 2007 she has participated in SEDA. The last time, she borrowed 8.288.000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. This time, she would like to borrow 9.632.000 VND, to invest in her restaurant, by buying more chairs and tables.

loans.use: to invest in her restaurant - buy more chairs and tables.

loans.name: Djeneba

texts.fr:
Madame DJENEBA est une femme âgée de 28 ans qui vit avec ses 2 enfants et son époux dans une famille nucléaire à BELE, un des quartiers de la ville de SANANKOROBA, préfecture de Kati,  Région de Koulikoro.
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école,  alors très tôt elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat et à la vente d’habits, mèches et prestation au niveau d’un salon de coiffure.
DJENEBA est à son premier prêt individuel, qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, des douzaines d’habits pour enfants et pour femmes,des cartons de mèches et l’entretien de son salon de coiffure, auprès des grossistes à Bamako et quelques fois au marché de SANANKOROBA auprès de forains. Elle effectue sa vente à la maison et aux marchés de SANANKOROBA, au salon, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Madame DJENEBA espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 45.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, aider le mari à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et réinvestir le reste dans les activités. 
DJENEBA ambitionne diversifier davantage ses activités et devenir grossiste  en habillements SANANKOROBA
texts.en:
Madame Djeneba is 28 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a nuclear family in Bele, a neighborhood of the city of Sanankoroba, in the Kati prefecture in the Koulikoro region.

Not having had an opportunity to attend school, at a young age she became interested in revenue generating activities such as buying and selling clothes and hair extensions, and providing hairdressing services.

This is Madame Djeneba's first individual loan, which she intends to use for the purchase of children's and women's clothing, boxes of  hair extensions, and cleaning products for her hairdressing salon from the wholesalers in Bameko and the stallholders in Sanankoroba market. She sells her products from her home, at the Sanankoroba markets, and from her salon, for cash or credit, to a clientele including both women and men.

Madame Djeneba hopes to make an average monthly profit of  45,000 FCFA, which she will use to repay the loan and to help her husband with the household expenses. She will invest the remainder in her business. 

Her ambition is to diversify her business activities and to become a clothing wholesaler in Sanankoroba.

loans.use: to purchase various items.

loans.name: Genda

texts.en:
Genda is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Genda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Genda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Genda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: 5 De Diciembre (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  la  ciudad de Portoviejo, ciudad de gente honesta y trabajadora con una gran variedad  en su gastronomía, con un clima variable y agradable, cada 15 días se reúnen  los 2 socios y las 10 socias del Banco Comunal 5 de Diciembre. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, servicios, entre otras cosas. Ellos unieron sus esfuerzos para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la Fundación Espoir, este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal  y esperan cumplir muy bien para seguir adelante en la institución.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nevi, tiene 33 años de edad mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen  tres hijos de 11, 9 y 7 años de edad, todos estudian en escuela. Su marido es albañil.

Ella además de ser una gran ama de casa para ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica al comercio, vende productos Avon (perfumes, cremas, bisutería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale a recorrer todos los  días pero solo en las mañanas ya que a esta hora es mucho más fresco y sus hijos están en clases, ya en la tarde tiene que ayudar a sus pequeños con sus tareas,  ella deja  sus productos a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, lleva siete meses en este negocio y lo que más vende son los perfumes y las cremas.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar perfumes, cremas y bisutería sobre todo productos de oferta ya que luego los vende al precio normal y le queda más ganancias. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.

La foto perqueña adjunta es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is a city with honest and hard-working people, a great variety of cuisine, and a variable and pleasant climate.  The two men and ten women members of the 5 de Diciembre communal bank meet in Portoviejo every two weeks.  The members carry out a number of different business activities like general commerce, services, and others.  They joined their efforts to be able to access the benefits that the Fundación Espoir lends. This is the first cycle of their communal bank.  They hope to complete it very well in order to get ahead in the institution.

This is the place where we meet Nevi, age 33.  She is in a common-law-marriage and has three children; ages 11, 9, and 7.  The children all go to school.  Her husband is a bricklayer.  In addition to being a great housewife, she sells Avon products (perfume, creams, jewelry, and women’s accessories) in order to earn something on her own.

She sells door to door, and she goes to work every day.  However, she only works in the mornings because it is much cooler then and her children are in school.  In the afternoons she has to help her little ones with their homework.  She leaves her products on credit, and she collects payments weekly.  She has been in this business for seven months, and the perfumes and creams sell the most.

She will use the loan to buy perfumes, creams, and jewelry.  Above all she will buy products that are on special promotion.  She will later sell them at the normal price, and she will be left with more income.

Her dreams are to get ahead and to give the best to her children.

The attached small photo is a member who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, and jewelry.

loans.name: Mansavo Group

texts.fr: MANSAVO est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Colette Agossi (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 41 ans. Colette Agossi est mariée à un matelassier du nom de Pierre. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Colette Agossi vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Colette Agossi n’a pas fréquenté. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Colette Agossi vend depuis une trentaine d’années, divers produits (conserves, etc.) par le système de distribution. Colette Agossi s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d'élargir son activité, Colette Agossi sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec le second membre du groupe MANSAVO. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: MANSAVO is a group composed of 3 people who all live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group representative, Colette Agossi (the one raising her hand on the picture), is 41. Colette Agossi is married to a mattress maker called Pierre. They care for their 4 children, who all go to school. Colette Agossi lives with her husband and her children. They both take care of the family financially. Colette Agossi never went to school. To meet the financial needs of her family, Colette Agossi has been selling miscellaneous items (canned food, etc.) through the distribution system for about 30 years. She buys those items in a market in Benin. In order to meet the needs of her customers as well as to increase her sales and her income, Colette Agossi, along with the other member of MANSAVO, is applying for a second loan from ALIDé. Thanks to this loan, they will be able to better meet the needs of their customers and make more profit. The first loan has been successfully paid back.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous items (canned food, etc.).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a knapsack sprayer and build a dairy unit.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.en:
For three years I have been selling new clothes and cosmetics. My business is located on a main boulevard in the city in front of a stadium that has a lot of visitors. This helps me sell more. In this season, sales increase. I need capital to increase my inventory and offer my clients a variety in clothes and cosmetics. By selling, I obtain a better income to support my family

Loan Use: This loan will be used to purchase cosmetics and clothing for men women and children

Desde hace 3 años me dedico a la venta de ropa nueva y cosmeticos, tengo mi negocio propio ubicado en uno de los boulevares principales en mi ciudad, frente al estadio el que es bastante transitado, eso me ayuda a vender mas. En estos meses las ventas se incrementan es por eso que necesito capital de trabajo para incrementar mi inventario y brindar a mis clientes opciones variadas en ropa y cosmeticos. Vendiendo mas obtengo mejores ingresos para el sostenimiento de mi familia.

loans.use: Compra de cosmeticos, ropa para caballero, dama y niño.

loans.name: Hamdular

texts.en: Hamdular A. owns a small market in the small town of Devechi, just south of Khachmaz, located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Hamdular wants to remodel her store and increase the quantity and variety of her inventory.

loans.use: To remodel her store and to increase the diversity of her inventory

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia I. is a young and beautiful woman who is 54 years of age. She is married with two (2) children and has been an LAPO client for 6 years. She is experienced in her line of business and worthy of a loan from LAPO. She will use the money ($400) to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Ramziyya

texts.en: Ramziyya I. lives in Ashigli village in the Beylagan region. She is 40 years old. Ramziyya is engaged in cattle breeding, and her brother helps her. She has been a client of Normicro since 2003. She has received four loans totaling $2000 from 2003-2006. She bought two cows with these loans. Now she needs $900 to buy 2 cows.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata B. is twenty five years old, married to a petty trader, and the mother of two children.  With her income from her fish business, she assists her husband in taking care of the family. She is requesting $200 to invest in the business and to purchase a cooler for preserving the fish.

loans.use: Investment in her fish business.

loans.name: Jossefa Alberto

texts.pt:
Jossefa Alberto M. was born in Incassane-Catembe on June 4, 1980. She is 27 years old, she has finished 7th grade and she lives with and supports 5 people. She is married. She used to live with her parents and siblings and go to school. In her free time she helped her mother with fishing work. The family did without basic necessities due to lack of fishing nets which were constantly destroyed. So she pursued a new source of income selling food from her home.

She began fishing 10 years ago, without any formal training. She employs 2 people, one of whom has children. She intends to buy nets with the loan of 13,000 MT [meticals, the currency of Mozambique]. Her workday begins very early in the morning, depending on the tide, around 3 am and ends at 6pm. She buys nets and equipment in Maputo and brings them home on public transport. Winter is the most productive season with the best catches, and the product doesn't deteriorate as quickly. Her average daily sale is 1,000 MT, with shrimp being the most lucrative catch.

Her biggest challenge is the systematic destruction of nets due to ships and boats, which means the nets don't last as long as one would hope and which affect the size catch and the cost of materials. With her profits, she pays salaries, supports her family and continues with the construction of her home. In the future, she hopes to build a boat, but it will depend on her productivity, as it will only begin after she pays back this loan first. She is happy with her work flow, which has improved since she was able to buy more nets with the last loan.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Jossefa Alberto M., nasceu no bairro Incassane-Catembe aos 04 de Junho de 1980, tem actualmente 27 anos, concluiu a 7ª classe, sustenta 5 pessoas e vive com igual número de pessoas e é casada maritalmente. Viveu num ambiente familiar com os pais e irmãos e frequentava a escola e nos tempos livres ajudava a mãe nos trabalhos agrícolas e que passou necessidades comuns da época, por falta de materiais(redes) de trabalho que constantemente se destroem e por isso criou outra fonte de rendimento de venda de produtos alimentares no seu quintal.

Desenvove a actividade de pesca a sensivelmente 10 anos e não tem nenhuma formação na área. Emprega actualmente 2 empregados dos quais 1 tem 2 filhos e outro não. Com o empréstimo de 13.000MT pretende comprar redes. O período de trabalho inicia bastante cedo dependendo do nível da água, assim as 3 horas da manhã e termina as 18 horas. As redes e acessórios compra-os em Maputo e leva-os no transporte colectivo . A época mais produtiva é a de Inverno onde a captura é maior e os produtos não se deterioram com facilidade. A receita média diária é de 1.000MT e o que dá mais lucro é o camarão e faz o registo só no acto da entrega do produto.

A dificuldade que enfrenta é destruição sistemática das redes por destroços de navios e barcos que leva com que as redes não durem o desejável e acaba afectando o nível de captura e avultados investimentos nos mesmos materiais. Com os rendimentos da pesca paga salários, sustento familiar e continuar com a construção da casa. A perspectiva futura é fazer outro barco e para o efeito vai depender do nível de produção e produtividade que for alcançar, todavia assim que terminar o actual crédito vai fazer o balanço. Está feliz com o nível de trabalho pois com o empréstimo melhorou os materiais (redes) de trabalho.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan is 49 years old and is married to Bernarda Alfonzo, who is 40. They have 8 children. The oldest is a student at the university, two others just finished high school this year, and the others are all school aged. The family lives together in their own home in the Simbrón of Roque González.

Juan is a multifaceted person who works in many different fields in order to take care of his family. He farms, raises cattle, and also produces sweet honey that he sells in the capital city. He employs 15 people, and he feels very proud of being able to give others the opportunity to generate their own income.

He wants to continue bettering his quality of life, and he is asking for a loan in order to buy cattle for resale as beef to various butcher shops in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Juan tiene 49 años esta casado con la señora Bernarda Alfonzo, ella tiene 40 años. La pareja tienen 8 hijos, el mayor es estudiante universitario, otros dos culminan sus estudios secundarios este año y los otros aún están en edad escolar; todos viven juntos en una casa propia y viven en la Simbrón de Roque González.

Juan es una persona multifacética ya que realiza diferentes tipos de actividades para poder sostener a su familia, se dedica a cultivar la tierra, a la cría y faneamiento de ganado vacuno, y además produce miel de caña dulce que comercializa en la ciudad capital. Emplea a 15 personas, y se siente muy orgulloso, ya que desea dar oportunidad a otras personas de generar sus propios ingresos.

Anhela seguir mejorando su nivel de vida, solicita el préstamo para comprar ganado vacuno para su posterior venta de carne a diferentes carnicerías de la ciudad.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Every day Leonardo undertakes the hard tasks of agricultural labour with happiness, because he knows that only with strenuous effort will he be able to ensure a good income. The costs of a decent education for his children and meeting essential household costs are the major causes of his complete dedication to the cultivation of potatoes, barley and peas, as well as the raising of livestock to sustain them in periods of crisis. On several occasions, he has suffered numerous losses in his fields as a result of bad weather.

His desire to improve his family’s quality of life has driven him to ask for help from your sympathetic heart in order to acquire 10 sacks of fertilizer, in order to improve the quality of his produce. Let us satisfy his request so that in a short time this desire will be realised.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Las duras tareas del campo las realiza diariamente con mucha alegría Leonardo, porque sabe que sólo con un esfuerzo arduo podrá lograr buenas ganancias. Los costos D. una adecuada educación para sus hijos y L. satisfacción D. las necesidades D. su hogar son las causas principales D. su entera dedicación a L. siembra D. papa, cebada y arveja y también a L. crianza D. animales que lo sostienen en época D. crisis.En muchas ocasiones han surgido cuantiosas pérdidas en sus campos D. cultivo por L. inclemencia del tiempo.

Su anhelo D. mejorar L. calidad D. vida D. su familia lo conducen a solicitar L. ayuda D. tu solidario corazón para adquirir 10 sacos D. abono a fin D. incrementar L. calidad D. sus productos.Posibilitemos su petición para que dentro D. poco este deseo se cristalice.

loans.use: Purchase ten sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Eudomia

texts.es:
Making bread, snacks, cookies and empanadas is the business that Ms. Eudoxia O. does in her own bakery in the outskirts of the Terminal market in the department of Leon.

She has been doing this for 15 years. Due to the fact that the income from her life partner was too low, she needed to improve the conditions of life for her two school-aged children. Today the needs of this humble mother is the acquisition of primary material to make the baked goods. For this reason she is asking Ceprodel to be the beneficiary of credits to continue her humble business. She has a record of 12 credits with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer.

La elaboración de pan, picos, manjares, galletas y empanadas es el negocio que se dedica la seora Eudoxia O. teniendo su propia panadería en las afueras del mercado la Terminal del departamento de León.

Se dedica a este negocio desde hace15 años debido a que los ingresos de su compañero de vida eran suficientemente bajos y por tal razón necesitaba mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus dos hijas en edad escolar. Hoy en día la necesidad que atraviesa esta humilde madre es la adquisición de la materia prima para elaborar los productos de la panadería. Por esta razón es que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos para continuar con su humilde negocio. Su record es de 12 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Bakery

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mrs. Em O. is 49 years old and works as a housewife during the day. As such, she stays at home, looks after the children, and cooks food for her entire family. To support the family, her husband works as a boat laborer and makes, on average, $2.60 of profit per day. They have four children, two of whom are students and two of whom are goldsmiths (a goldsmith typically earns $5 per day). This couple is seeking a loan from Kiva so that they can purchase a motor-bike and some goldsmith tools.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike and goldsmith tools.

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.en:
Alexandre is 27 years old and is originally from the north of Mozambique. His family moved to Ponta D’Ouro 13 years ago, and today only his father and an uncle lives here, the rest of the family is in Maputo (the capital). Ponta D’Ouro is a beach village in the boarder with South Africa, very famous for its tourism, especially among South Africans. Married, Alexandre has a 2 years old daughter. He also helps to support his 2 younger brothers that are still in school. He has another younger brother that is working in South Africa. 

Alexandre studied until 6th grade (only 7th grade missing to finish primary school) and worked as a construction worker for almost 7 years. Soon after, he got a job as a gardener at Ponta D’Ouro campsite, where he worked for 5 years earning MTN 1,200 monthly until January 2008. He decided to resign to focus in what he really likes to be: a photographer. Alexandre charges R15 (~US$1) for a regular size photo and between R50 and R100 (around US$5-10) for posters. He goes to Maputo every week to develop all pictures, paying MTn 300 (around US$15) for both ways transportation. With this business, Alexandre makes approximately MTn 3,500 per month. On top of that, Alexandre has 4 rooms that he rents, making up to MTn 1,500 per month, and still does some construction work when asked. 

This is Alexandre’s first loan with Hluvuku. This MTN 5,000 was used to build a grocery shop next to his house. He lives in a distant part of Ponta D’Ouro, and believes all his neighbors will use his shop. At this first step, he will sell food and basic products. His wife will work at the shop, from 7am to 6pm daily, and will be able to continue to take care of the house. In the future, Alexandre dreams with a second Hluvuku loan to bring electricity to his shop, buy a fridge and start selling drinks (both alcoholic and non-alcoholic) and meat. What an entrepreneur that is eager to succeed in life!

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Sokhom Urn Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhom U. lives in Chom Teav village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 23, married, and without children. She is the group leader of a four women group in her village. She is a farmer and works with her husband, Mr. Yet Nguon. Both of thE. are very hard workers, but they only make a small income. Previously, Mrs. Sokhom U. obtained a loan from AMK that she used to improve her crop. Presently, she is applying for a loan because she would like to live separate from her parents.  Therefore, she hopes to buy a piece of land to build a new house for her and her husband in the village.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Ear

texts.en: Ear L. lives and works in Siem Reap province, home to a large area known as the Tongle Sap river basin where fishing is a vital part of the provincial economy. Ear, 27 years old, raises pigs and earns about $2.50 US per day; her husband is a fish seller at a local market and earns about $5 US per day. They have one child who is too young to attend school. Selling fish has been a stable source of income for the family; however, it is a business with much competition. Ear's husband must go to the market early every morning to sell his fish while they are still fresh; after selling the fish, he has no work for the remainder of the day. She wants to buy him a motorbike he can use as a taxi once he leaves the market each day. Ear is pictured here with the motorbike they hope to buy.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es:
Mrs. Martha Luz P. T., who is a member of the Community Bank “Sembrando Futuro”, lives in the Región San Martín and Province of San Martín and district of Tarapoto. She sells all types of refrigerated goods, such as juices, cakes, humitas (tamales), chicken sandwiches, eggs, etc. She started the business very young and has always enjoyed working with people. The economic situation motivated her to begin this business, and she could see that it was a good option in the neighborhood she lives in. The loan will be repaid in 6 months, and will be used to buy the ingredients needed to prepare her refrigerated products such as sugar, algarrobina (a type of syrup), malt, boxed milk, flour, butter, eggs, corn, and local fruits. Additionally, she will purchase a blender, dishware, and glasses appropriate for the sale of juices. She currently is 25 years old, and is the mother of two minor children who are everything to her. With her friendly manner she attends to her customers who come to see her every morning. In the future she hopes to add a dressmaking shop which will bring economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Martha Luz P. T. es socia del Banco Comunal “Sembrando Futuro”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de San Martín y distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de refrigerios, como jugos, kekes, humitas, sanguches de pollo, huevo, etc. Se inició en el negocio desde muy joven, siempre le gustó estar en contacto con la gente, la situación económica que estaba pasando la motivó a iniciarse en este negocio, por que vio que es una buena alternativa en el barrio donde vive. El crédito recibido de S/. 1300.00, que será pagado en 6 meses, compró los ingredientes que necesita para la preparación de sus refrigerios como: azúcar en sacos, algarrobina, malta, leche en cajas, harina preparada, mantequilla en kilos, huevos en casilleros para la preparación de los kekes, maíz para preparar las humitas y frutas de la región. Además comprará una nueva licuadora, vajillas, vasos apropiados para la venta de jugos. Actualmente tiene 25 años, y dos hijos menores por quienes velar y luchar, con su amabilidad que le caracteriza atiende a sus clientes que le visitan todas las mañanas, en el futuro piensa instalar un taller de costura que le permita una estabilidad económica.

loans.use: Purchase of consumables. Purchase of one blender, dishes, and glassware.

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.en:
M. Rahmatullo is 28 years old. He and his wife, a housekeeper, are raising two children. Rahmatullo’s children are small now, but he is already working hard to ensure the best possible future for them. He makes a living selling foodstuff like pastries, cookies, candies, condensed milk, tea, caned meat, mayonnaise and other items in a store which he rents. Rahmatullo has been in this business for seven years. He is very polite and his store is very popular with local residents, whose patronage allows him to earn a good income for his family.

Rahmatullo has applied for a loan of $600 due in nine months, and will use the loan to buy more items to sell. This will allow him to earn more and meet the needs of his family. Rahmatullo thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in his grocery store.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Rizki is 42 years old. She is married with 2 children; one is 20 years old and one is only 3 months old. She has been a phone voucher seller since 2007. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 40 from her sales.

Riziki is now seeking a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Norn

texts.en: Norn N., 63, is a widowed farmer who resides with three of her children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 1980, she has grown rice to earn a living and is able to make less than one dollar per day. She runs her farm just to support her family and she does not normally sell her output for profit. Her children work in a small rice mill and sell the rice to the market. Norn would like to take out a loan of US$300 to purchase more stone to make a mill. (Mrs. Norn is pictured with her daughter)

loans.use: To purchase more stone to make mill.

loans.name: Nelly Perpetua

texts.es:
La señora Nelly Perpetua tiene 50 años de edad y pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Valerosas II. Vive en la calle Francisco de Miranda 1915, distrito La Esperanza Alta, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa y no continuó estudiando porque su familia  no tenían recursos económicos. Se casó con el señor Jesús Briseño Benítez  y tienen tres hijos de los cuales uno es estudiante y aún depende de ella.
Se dedicaba a buscar pedidos para renovar zapatos y su esposo se encargaba de renovarlos hasta que aprendió a elaborar zapatos y desde ese momento tomó parte del taller familiar.
Con el primer préstamo de 200 soles, cancelados en 4 cuotas, compró material para elaborar calzado.
Con este crédito de 500 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará pegamento, cuero, etc.
Su gran sueño es llevar sus productos a la Argentina.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nelly Perpetua is 50 years old and is a member of the Courageous Women Village Bank II. She lives on Francisco de Miranda 1915 Street, in the La Esperanza Alta district, in the Trujillo province, of the department of La Libertad, in Peru. She completed her secondary education but did not continue studying because her family did not have the economic resources for her to do so. She married Mr. Jesús Briseño Benitez, and they have three children together, one of whom is a student and even still depends on her. In the past, she would seek out shoe repair orders, while her husband was responsible for the actual repair. This transpired until she learned how to produce shoes herself and since then she takes part in the family repair shop. With the first loan of 200 soles, which she repaid in four installments, she bought material to produce footwear. And with this loan of 500 soles, which she will repay in four installments, she will buy glue, leather, etc. Her grand dream is to bring her products to Argentina.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of glue, leather, etc. for the footwear repair.

loans.name: Mejra

texts.en:
Mejra was born in 1969 and she lives in Šerići, a village in Bosnia. She is married and has 8 children. Her oldest daughter is 17 and her youngest son is 4.  Her husband earns 800KM/month and they receive 360KM/month in child support from the government, which totals the equivalent of $740 USD/month to support a family of 10.  

Mejra works as a housewife, growing vegetables and raising cows to feed her family.

Mejra is requesting a loan of 1,200KM ($800 USD) from Women for Women International to purchase food for her cows to survive the winter. The loan is important for her, because her cows' milk and milk products are crucial to feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy food for cows

loans.name: Las Solidarias Group

texts.en:
Elida L. is only 23 years old, but is living without a job and in extreme poverty. She has no children and is unmarried, which, where she lives, is very rare for a woman of her age. Unlike many of her peers, she decided at a young age that she wants something more with her life and wants to be able to provide for her children someday. 

She is a highly motivated young woman and wants to start a small clothing business. This will be her first loan and she plans on traveling to another city, where she can buy used clothing at a good price, and then sell them in her area. She dreams of having a big clothing store with all the top designers. She also wants to go back to school and get a college degree. 

She realizes she has a lot of work ahead of her, but knows what she wants and is ready to go get it. She did say she is nervous about starting her own business because she has never had anything of her own, and wants to be successful in this. 

Elida also knows that this is her one chance and she is going to do everything she can possibly do to make her dreams come true!

loans.use: Used to purchase clothing for her business

loans.name: Vaepa

texts.en: Vaepa M., 46, is married with 7 children.  She has many years of experience in the fishing business. She sells to the villagers and general public 7 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Vaepa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase fishing canoe, electric torch, and batteries

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia es socia del Banco Comunal Lila.
Aurelia es casada, tiene 34 años y 7 hijos, Aurelia vende leña en su casa que adquiere de los productores que le traen a su domicilio. Además Aurelia los días sábados y domingos viaja a las ferias en donde vende ropa.
Aurelia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña, chompas, faldas, mandiles.
Los sueños de Aurelia son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Aurelia is a member of Communal Bank Lila. Aurelia is married, is 34 years old, and has 7 children. Aurelia sells firewood in her home, which she acquires from producers who bring it to her residence. Additionally, on Saturdays and Sundays Aurelia travels to regional markets where she sells clothing. Aurelia needs a loan of 2000 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of firewood, sweaters, skirts, and aprons. Aurelia’s dream is that her children finish their studies and hopes to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase firewood, sweaters, skirts, and aprons.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice K. is 38 years old, married with 4 children. Her husband runs a hardware shop, whereas Alice offers  a service of decorating for functions. Their eldest child is 20 years old while the youngest is 13 years old.

Alice is using the loan to  purchase more chairs, tents and decorations. Her services earn her an average profit of  USH 400,00 (1 USD = 1,970.00 USH) per month in a good season. Her dream is to establish a reputable decorating service firm.

loans.use: To purchase more chairs, tents and decorations.

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es:
José  Mauricio P. R. es un caballero de 28 años de edad, vecino de  una comunidad  rural de Costa Rica situada 45 kilómetros al sur de San José llamada San Cristóbal Norte. San Cristóbal es una zona un poco montañosa donde se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, agricultura de hortalizas, café y otros, artesanía, ganadería y muchas otras actividades. José Mauricio es soltero y vive con su mamá, su hermana y su sobrino. Él tiene una finca en donde trabaja en el cultivo de hortalizas y con ganado en la producción de leche.
La lechería es una actividad que ha heredado de de su familia ya que sus padres por muchos años la han desarrollado. Actualmente José Mauricio ordeña seis vacas, actividad que le lleva la mitad de su tiempo. Dentro de sus proyectos se encuentra comprar una máquina de ordeño que le podría economizar mucho tiempo que ocuparía en mejorar algunos aspectos de su misma actividad. Don José Mauricio vende leche y queso a los vecinos de su comunidad los cuales se muestran muy satisfechos al poder adquirir productos frescos y elaborados en un ambiente de confianza por gente conocida. 
José Mauricio tiene ocho años de ser socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN), una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. En todo ese tiempo ha recibido 15 microcréditos para producir en su finca  y todos los ha cancelado responsablemente. Actualmente está solicitando un crédito de US$ 1.200 para comprar la máquina de ordeño a veinticuatro meses pagadero en cuotas fijas por mes. Su intención es intensificar la producción y poder así mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
José Mauricio P. R. is a 28 year old man from a rural community of Costa Rica situated 45 kilometers south of San Jose, called San Cristobal Norte. San Cristobal is a mountainous area where people make their living from such activities as business; cultivation of vegetables, coffee, and other crops; handicrafts; cattle, and many other activities. Jose Mauricio is single and lives with his mom, his sister, and his nephew. He owns a farm where he grows vegetables and has dairy cows for the production of milk. Dairy farming is a business that he learned from his family; his parents have developed the business over many years. At the present time, Jose Mauricio milks six cows, which takes up half of his time. He wishes to purchase a milking machine which would save him a great deal of time and allow him to improve other aspects of the dairy operation. Jose Mauricio sells milk and cheese to his neighbors in the community, and they have been very satisfied with being able to buy fresh products made in an atmosphere of trust by someone they know. Jose Mauricio has been a member of the group Empresa de Credito Comunal San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN) for eight years. This is one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. During that time he has received 15 microloans in order to run his farm. He has paid off each one responsibly. At this time he is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy the milking machine over 24 months to be paid in fixed installments each month. His intention is to increase production in order to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: This loan will be used to buy a milking machine that costs $1200.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady F. est mariée avec 07enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Face Néma depuis 2 ans et demi. Son activité est la vente de tissus teintés. Elle veut  renforcer son commerce pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Khady F. is married and raising 7 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Face Néma for two and a half years. Her business is selling dyed cloth. She wants to bolster her business so as to improve living conditions for her family. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cloth for re-sale

loans.name: Ianeta

texts.en: Ianeta F., 37, is married with 4 children.  She has 1 year of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people/public 3 days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about US $116).  SPBD loans are Ianeta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. All of the loan will be used for maintaining her business. The plantation is going but just needs improvement.

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila es socia del Banco Comunal Chaska Lucero.
Teofila es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Teofila viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende verduras, abarrotes, frutas y de las ferias compra cereales que luego vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Teofila necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de maiz, quinua, kiwicha.

Los sueños de Teofila son que sus hijos sean profesionales y comprar un terreno para su casa.
texts.en:
Teofila is a client of the Chaska Lucero Communal Bank. She is 32 years old, and lives with her two children and their father. Teofila travels to different regional markets, where she sells vegetables, groceries and fruit. From the markets, she purchases grains which she later sells in the Abastos market in the city of Ayacucho.

Teofila needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of corn, quinua and and amaranth.

Teofila dreams that her children will be professionals, and that she can purchase land for her house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn, quinua and amaranth.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 48 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their five children. Khaled has owned a coffee shop. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new coffee machine and some merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Khaled has requested a loan. 
Khaled is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and clients feel comfortable going to his coffee shop. His clients are his friend, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Khaled decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent work and he always wanted to have a coffee shop. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: Khaled will use the loan to purchase a new coffee machine and some merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther O. is a young lady of 25. She is single and does not have children. She lives with her mother in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. She is a seamstress by profession. Esther designs and sews for clients and to sell on a retail basis. She has a workshop by the roadside in her community. She says she has four apprentices under training. 

Esther has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy textile materials and other sewing accessories. She desires to expand her business and save for her future before she enters into marriage.

loans.use: To buy textile materials

loans.name: Michael Odhiambo

texts.en:
Michael is a married man and the father of an 8-month-old girl. He has been a tailor for three years after finishing two years of training at a center in the neighborhood of Nyalenda. He is now working in downtown Kisumu. With the proceeds from his loan, he would like to buy an overlock machine which he will use in finishing his various types of garments. He would also like to purchase some more materials including fabric and threads.

Right now, Michael earns a salary as he works alongside about 40 other tailors in the large company called Blackberry. He would like to branch out on his own, and has the confidence that he will be successful. His dream is to get a small place at the lake market. Michael currently specializes in men’s and women’s clothing and children’s school uniforms. He makes shirts, pants, skirts and dresses, and also repairs damaged clothing. Michael is a hard-working man who desires to support his family.

K-MET, the NGO giving the loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional MFI. Rather, it is a development organization focused on raising health standards in Kenya. For more information about K-MET, please use the following link: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=24

loans.use: To buy a new machine and more materials

loans.name: Seremos El Triunfo Del Mañana Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal se denomina “SEREMOS EL TRIUNFO DEL MAÑANA”, y está conformado por 12 socios, ellos pertenecen al barrio de Huancaro.

Nuestros socios alternan sus diferentes actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ellos timen sus diferentes puestos de ventas de frutas en el mercado Virgen Asunta de Huancaro, ellos recepcionan las frutas que son traídas desde la zona selva de de Perú, en camiones y los venden al por mayor a nuestros socios, que son los que posteriormente la venden al por menor, hay todo tipo de frutas, siendo las más comunes, las naranjas, las mandarinas, los plátanos, los duraznos, blanquillos, manzanas, pomelos, limas, y según la época varían los tipos de diversidad de frutas, para seguir con su comercio estos socios piden un préstamo, de este modo ellos seguirán comprando al por mayor sus frutas y los venderán en sus stand.

Nuestros socios se encuentran muy agradecidos por el apoyo otorgado y valoran este préstamo, comprometiéndose a cumplir con el pago respectivo en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
This community bank is called "Seremos el Triunfo del Mañana" (We will be Tomorrow's Triumph) and is made up of 12 members from the Huancaro neighborhood. Our members alternate their home activities with retail business; they have different stands selling fruit in the Virgen Asunta de Huancaro market. They purchase wholesale fruit trucked in from the jungle regions of Perú and later sell them retail. They sell all kinds of fruit, the most common are oranges, tangerines, bananas, peaches, blanquillos, apples, grapefruit, and limes. The variety of fruit available depends on the season. To continue their businesses these members request a loan that will allow them to keep buying fruit in bulk at wholesale prices to sell from their stands. Our members are very grateful for the support provided and value this loan, committing themselves to make their respective repayments during the time scheduled.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale fruit.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.
Margarita es soltera, tiene 40 años y 1 hijo, Margarita realiza trabajos en telar como pasadizos, alfombras, actividad que realiza con apoyo de personal dependiendo de la demanda, sus productos lo vende en su casa. 
Margarita necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lanas y tintes.
Los sueños de Margarita son construir el segundo piso de su casa y tener una bodega en su casa.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Alondras Community Bank. Margarita, 40, is single and has one child. Margarita makes loom weavings like rugs. She hires people to help with the work, depending upon the demand. She sells her products from her home. Margarita needs a loan for 800 PEN to buy wool and dye. Margarita’s dreams are to build a second floor on her house and to have a grocery store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool and dye

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy R. is from the village of Sagrada Familia, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 26 years old. Joy is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Joy operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Joy has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Joy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to harvest. Joy is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Joy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

location.town: Sagrada Familia, Tambulig, Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter G.'s main source of income comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. He is 52 years old, married and has six school-age children. They are from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Walter has been in his business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Walter joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Walter has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Walter is requesting a new loan of 18,250 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be his second loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand his business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Odette

texts.fr: M. Odette est née le 15 Mai 1981 à Adja au Sud du Bénin. Odette réside à Cocotomey, une ville située au Sud du Bénin depuis deux ans. Odette est mariée à un militaire nommé SIDI Basile, et est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Grâce à son activité de vente de produits vivriers (maïs, …), Odette supporte avec son mari les dépenses de la famille. Odette achète ces produits à Adja au Mono (Bénin) et les vend à son domicile à Cocotomey. Odette est à son premier crédit, mais a déjà deux ans d’expérience dans la vente de produits vivriers. Odette souhaite accroître cette activité, et sollicite pour cela un financement auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Achat de 5 sacs de 100 Kilogrammes de maïs

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Catalina es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor D. Locumba” del distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Yunguyo, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 46 años D. edad, estado civil casada, tiene 05 hijos, vive en la comunidad D. Chinumani, ella no tuvo la oportunidad D. seguir estudios.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años es una D. las socias fundadoras, inicio su préstamo con la suma D. S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. compra venta D. detergentes.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar diferentes tipos D. detergentes, los cuales los venD. en la feria zonal, además la señora se dedica a su chacra.

Su mayor deseo es hacer crecer su capital para poner una tienda al por mayor.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Sra. Catalina is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor D. Locumba”, which is located in the District of Yunguyo, Yunguyo Province, Department of Puno. She is 46 years old, married, and has 5 children. She lives in the community of Chinumani and was not able to continue her studies.

Catalina has been working with Manuela Ramos for several years since she is one her group’s founding members. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 soles and was used to increase her operating capital for her detergent business. She is now requesting a new loan of 1000 soles so that she can buy different types of detergents that she will sell at the regional fair. In addition, Catalina engages in farming.

Her greatest wish is to increase her capital so that she can open a wholesale outlet. She enjoys her Communal Bank meetings and the simplicity of her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase detergents

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Erlinda S., 55 years old, is married to Marcial S. and is a resident of Baybay, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. Her husband earns income from their own parcel of rice land. On average he earns only P5,000 every trimester. Because of this, the family was experiencing a financial crisis.

To help her husband in raising their five children, Erlinda decided to engage in business. She opened up a little sari-sari (variety) store in her home. For twenty-three years she has been able to sustain the business and is able to help in supporting her family. Now she is earning an average net income of not less than P3,000, which is so helpful for their family income.

As a new member of Honeybee Center under the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People) program of Paglaum MPC, Erlinda is given the privilege of obtaining P5,000 as her first loan to add to the capital of her existing sari-sari store business.

Erlinda is very much interested in, and thankful for, the savings and education programs of Paglaum Coop.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Sann

texts.en: Mrs. Sann M. lives in Hang Heng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Ung Vannak, is a coconut seller. Although they try to work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support their family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sann M. is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. This couple has four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Badenya sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 27 ans et 1 enfant. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Konobougou, sous préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de commerce. Elles font le commerce d’articles divers et collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci d’avoir constamment un appui financier pour leurs activités. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec l’institution et comptent l’utiliser pour acheter, des condiments alimentaires et  une grande quantité d’articles divers. 
Les produits sont achetés en grande partie à Bamako, mais les céréales sont achetées sur place et toutes les marchandises sont revendues sur place, au marché et au bord du goudron à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles estiment pouvoir  réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 25 000FCFA  par mois. Les bénéfices seront partagés entre autres la nourriture,  la santé et les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group Badenya are married women averaging 27 years of age and one child each.  They live with their husband and children in large traditional families residing in the village of Konobougou, Sub-prefecture of Barouéli, Region of Ségou, Republic of Mali.  The group members know one another through ties of community and commerce.  They do commerce in a variety of goods and are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in want of continual financial support for their businesses.  They are on their first solidarity loan with this institution and intend to use it to buy some condiments and a large quantity of various goods. The products are purchased mainly in Bamako, but the grains are purchased locally.  All the goods are sold locally to customers composed of women and men at the market and along the asphalt. The group members think they can each realize an average profit of 25,000 francs CFA per month.  The profits will be spread among such things as food, health care, and the businesses.  

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items

loans.name: Peter

texts.es:
Peter tiene 28 años, es padre de 2 hijas y vive con su pareja, quien le ayuda mucho.
Desde hace 10 años se viene dedicando al transporte de pasajeros, para él lo mas importante es trabajar arduamente, ya que de antemano quiere brindarle todo lo necesario a sus hijas que estudian y son su razón de ser.
Él es propietario de un motocarro y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares y trata con varias personas. Además le es muy rentable, pues él mismo administra las ganancias y se encarga de su mantenimiento.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que en equipo tiene la oportunidad de salir adelante. Además que son personas organizadas y muy trabajadoras. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a reparar su motocarro y así trabajar sin preocupaciones. También invertirá el negocio de su esposa, quien se dedica a la venta de pescado en un puesto del mercado.
texts.en:
Peter is 28 years old; a father of two girls who lives with his partner, who helps him out a lot. For 10 years he has been working in passenger transportation. The most important thing for him is to work very hard, because he wants to give her daughters who study and are her reason for being, everything that they need. He owns a motorized rickshaw and what he likes about his work is that he gets to know a lot of places and deals with a variety of people. Furthermore it is very profitable, because he is managing the profits and is in charge of the maintenance. This is the first time he asks for a loan with MFP and what he likes about his communal bank is that in his team he has the opportunity to move forward; they are also very organized and hard working people. With the money he is requesting he wants to repair his rickshaw to keep working without any worries. He will also invest in the business of his wife who is devoted to selling fish in a market stand.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Zolaida

texts.en:
Zolaida B. is from the village of Malaubang Ozamiz City. She is 39 years old. Zolaida is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Zolaida owns and operates a service-based business, providing laundry services for local communities. Zolaida has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $75 a month from this activity.

Zolaida joined the Kiva field partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Zolaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Zolaida is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services she provides. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services

loans.name: Phy

texts.en: Phy S., 27, is married and lives with her two school-aged children in Kompongchnang Province, Cambodia. S. is employed in a local garment factory, and she is able to earn an income of USD 2 per day to help cover her family's expenses. She has been with this business since 2008. Her husband is a merchant who sells silk products, earning an income of USD 5 per day to help assist the family. S. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. And they are seeking to improve their businesses as well as to meet daily necessary expenses. As a result, S. is requesting a loan of US $500 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the expected loan to purchase more silk products for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy silk products to sell.

loans.name: Deok

texts.en: Mrs. Deok P. is 34 years old and lives with another family member in Kompong Tom Province. Here she built a pigpen next to her house where she breeds many pigs. This is how she earns a living. Through this, she is able to raise and sell pigs at least two times per year. She has a partner in her husband, who always leaves home to work in the construction sector. The couple now has two kids who are enrolled in school. Deok P. is taking out her loan to buy more building accessories and will provide them to her husband to use for construction.

loans.use: To buy more building accessories.

loans.name: Veronica Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Verónica es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan de Dios” desde hace 4 meses, vive en el distrito y provincia de Lampa, departamento de Puno, tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Ella estudio hasta quinto de secundaria, se dedica a la venta de artesanía.

Verónica nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela R., que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 200.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar lana, bayeta (tela), etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es ser una gran empresaria.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el bajo interés.
texts.en:
Verónica has been a member of the community bank "San Juan de Dios" for 4 months. She lives in the district and province of Lampa, in the department of Puno. She is 36 years old, married, and has 3 children. She studied through the 5th grade of secondary school. She sells artisan-made crafts.

Verónica tells us that she used her first loan of 500 nuevos soles from Movimiento Manuela R. to increase her business capital.

She is requesting a loan of $75 with which she will buy wool, cloth, etc.

Her dream for the future is to be a major business woman.

The thing she likes most about her community bank is the low interest rate.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool, cloth, etc

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: La Señora Paulina es cliente D. Emprender desD. el año 2002, trabajo con grupo solidario "Gardenia", ella y su familia viven en la zona D. Chiaraqui, más conocida como la "muela del Diablo", un lugar turistico que se encuentra  a dos horas D. caminata desD. Chasquipampa, ella tiene un kiosco al lado D. la escuela, en el que venD. abarrotes, refrescos y golosinas para los habitantes del lugar y para los estudiantes, la señora tiene hijos ya casados, solo mantiene a uno D. 12 años que se encuentra estudiando. el esposo es jardinero en las épocas que no tiene que trabajar en su tierra D. cultivo, le  ayuda a su esposa en la venta D. los productos es una cliente buena, ella se transporta a pie desD. esa localidad para sus pagos y tramites del crédito, ya que no existe transporte urbano ni provincial a ese lugar, por lo que es conveniente para ella este trato preferencial. El dinero del credito lo utilizara en la compra D. refrescos y cerveza para surtir su kiosco. Esta Muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Paulina has been a client of Emprender since 2002. She works with the Gardenia Communal Bank. She and her family live in the Chiaraqui area, which is better known as the “Muela del Diablo” (Devil’s Tooth). It is a tourist spot, which is a two hour walk from Chasquipampa. She has a kiosk at the siD. of the school. She sells groceries, soft drinks, and sweets to the residents and students. She is married and has children. She is only supporting one, the 12 year old who goes to school. Her husband is a gardener. During the times that he does not have to work on the land he has planted, he helps his wife sell her products. She is a good client. She comes from her location on foot to make her payments and complete the loan transactions. There is no urban or provincial transportation in this area. This arrangement works well for her. She will use the money from the loan to buy soft drinks and beer to stock her kiosk. She is very grateful to Empender and Kiva for the confidence given in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks and beer

loans.name: Kpatagno

texts.en:
Kpatagno M. is 26 years old, married to a house painter, and has one child. She lives and works in the Hédzranawoé district of Lomé selling shoes and purses. She sells her products in the Grand Marché of Hédzranawoé, a popular spot for consumers in the area.

This will be her third loan with WAGES, which she will use to resupply her stock. She will spend the majority of this loan on shoes and the remainder on purses and any other items needed. Thank you for contributing to Mrs. M.’s continued success.

loans.use: Purchase of shoes and purses for resale

loans.name: Tope

texts.en:
35-year-old Tope is the mother of one kid. Her husband is a civil servant and they live together in Lagos.

Tope sells clothes, underwear and bras in her shop and she has been in this business for the past eight years. She is happy with the living standard of her family but hopes to improve upon it. She assists in taking care of the home with proceeds from her business.

Tope wants to expand her business in future. She hopes for the loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more clothes, underwear and bras to sell.

Tope is a member in LAPO micro-finance with a good repayment record and she promise to pay back her loan at the due dates. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, underwear and bras to sell

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Maria Del Carmen C. está agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayudo a mejorar su negocio. 
Está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio ya que le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía, ya que pudo ampliar un poco más el negocio y quiere ponerle más variedad de producto a su negocio.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio, ya que su esposo se encarga de los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Del Carmen C. is very thankful for your assistance with her previous loan, which helped her improve her business. She is once again asking for a loan in order to invest in this business. The business still lacks variety in merchandise, as she was able to grow the business and now wants to offer a better variety of products for her business. She plans to pay back her loan with the earnings that she gets from her business, as her husband meets the family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve the variety of merchandise in Maria's store

loans.name: Joi's Group

texts.en:
Joi A. is from the village of Northern. She is 37 years old. Joi is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Joi is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Joi owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling of "Longganisa" processed meat in the local community. Joi has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Joi joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Joi is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 15th loan taken out by Joi from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living standards of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for the business.

loans.name: Roona Farhnaz Group

texts.en:
Ahmad Javed son of Q. is 37 years old and the leader of 'Roona Farhnaz' group. He is a married and an educated man who has a general store. He has been involved in this business for more than 6 years. He got his first loan and completed his stock. He is a good client.

He is happy with this loan process. When he found AFS and started his partnership and until now he has never been faced with any difficulties, therefore, he would like to take out his second loan to purchase more stocks like beverages and sanitary products. He would like to thank lenders around the world who help those who really want to expand their businesses.

loans.use: purchase more stock like beverages and sanitary products

loans.name: Elmira's Group

texts.en: Elmira N. is the leader of this group. She is 23. Two years ago, with an initial investment of 10,000 soms (approximately 217 USD) she rented a store and began to sell convenience goods. In this way she earns 3,500 soms (approximately 76 USD) per month. To earn additional income, Elmira’s husband works in construction. With the money received from this loan, Elmira plans to purchase various goods in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future she wants to expand her business and build a new house. Klara K. is 28. She works as an operator at a gas station and her husband is a bus driver. A year ago, with an initial investment of 1,000 USD, Klara opened a kiosk where she sells convenience goods. In this way she makes 13,000 soms (approximately 282 USD) per month. She and her husband also breed cattle to earn more income. Now, Klara wants to obtain a loan to purchase a calf for breeding and also various goods to increase the turnover of her business. Nazgul T. is the treasurer of the group. She is 35, is married, and her husband works as a builder. Five years ago, with an initial investment of 10,000 soms (approximately 217 USD), Nazgul bought a cow and started to breed cattle. She also sells milk to make money and, in this way, she makes 3,400 soms (approximately 74 USD) per month. She has three daughters and a son, all of whom study at school. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase sheep to increase the number of her livestock. In the future, she plans to purchase a container and a vehicle. Erlan I. is 25 and is married. He works as a security guard in a factory and his monthly salary is 6,000 soms (approximately 130 USD). He has a two-year-old daughter so his wife stays at home to take care of her. In order to make money Erlan also breeds cattle, sometimes selling some after fattening. In the future he plans to repair his house and purchase a vehicle. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase goods for her store

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Ramón vive en concubinato con la señora Efigenia Aquino hace más de 10 años, tienen 3 hijos en edad escolar, viven en un barrio cercano al centro de la ciudad de Itá.
El mismo posee una despensa en su domicilio donde surte a sus vecinos y a ocasionales clientes de todo tipo de insumos y artículos de primera necesidad para el hogar como ser bebidas en general, arroz, azúcar, yerba, lácteos y otras mercaderías.
 Opera con la Fundación Paraguaya hace mas de 1 año en forma excelente, además de la despensa el señor Ramón posee un taller mecánico donde realiza servicios de reparación y mantenimiento de todo tipo de motocicletas, lo cual también le genera buenos ingresos.
