El préstamo que solicita es para aumentar su stock de mercaderías comprando mercaderías tales como: bebidas en gral., lácteos, yerba, arroz, etc.
texts.en:
Ramón has lived with Efigenia Aquino for the past 10 years. They have 3 school-aged children and live in a neighborhood close to the center of the city of Itá.

He has a store in his house where he supplies his neighbors and occasional customers with all types of groceries and basic need items for the home such as drinks, rice, sugar, yerba, dairy products and other products.

He has worked excellently with Fundación Paraguaya for more than a year. In addition to the store, Ramón also has a mechanic shop where he has repair services and maintenance of all types of motorcycles, which also generates good earnings. The loan that he is requesting is to increase his stock of merchandise by purchasing items such as: drinks, dairy products, yerba, rice, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of drinks, dairy products, yerba, rice, and other products.

loans.name: Amor Y Paz 4 Group

texts.en:
Albaneli is the coordinator of her group Amor y Paz 4 (love and peace). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. She says that her most difficult challenges are to build her house to a bigger and better structure.

Albaneli is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and increased her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying shoes and electrical stuff like blenders, fans and small radios to sell by payments to her clients. She will use the profits to buy a refrigerator and school supplies for her children, and by saving she will invest in her business because she wants to improve it. She is dreaming to have enough money, health and love to share what she gets with her family and people around, and she knows with Esperanza and her group she will be able to accomplish her dreams. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying her favorite things which are to eat and dance a lot.

Albaneli's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and unreliable electricity.

loans.use: To buy electrical goods and shoes.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose M. is 21 years old. She is single and does not have any children. Her business is located at mwingi, a business area served by Thika branch. She makes clothes at her tailoring shop and sells them to local customers. She also sells fruits such as bananas in her tailoring shop. She says that this business is profitable and that the only major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy more materials for making clothes. She hopes to grow her business and be able to serve her customers more efficiently. She also hopes to expand her business and provide employment to someone who can help her in the business. In the future, she sees herself married. She also hopes to build her own home. She describes herself as very hardworking, caring, sociable, and patient.

loans.use: Materials for making clothes

loans.name: Rahbarjon

texts.ru: Айтматов Рахбарчон проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Рахбарчон не имеет высшего образования. Занимается торговлей на рынке. У него магазин, где он продает конфеты и печенья. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 2 года. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара, так как в сентябре спрос на его товар увеличится. Этим он сможет получить хорошую прибыль и удовлетворить свои потребности.
texts.en:
Rahbarjon Aymatov lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 30 years old. He is married and has three children. His wife is a homemaker. Rahbarjon does not have a high education. He sells on the market. He has a store where he sells candy and baked goods. He has been in this business for two years. He is taking out a loan to increase the variety of his inventory because the demand for his merchandise will increase in September. By this he make more a good profit and meet his needs.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory assortment

loans.name: Annastacia

texts.en:
Annastacia is a married lady with one child who operates Ebenezer Labour Services.  For a fee she helps people to get employment.  Annastacia has been in business for two years.  She is an enterprising lady who also sells ladies underwear.  

Annastacia has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to repair her computer at the employment bureau and to buy more underwear for resale.

loans.use: Repair her computer and buy underwears for resale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where she has been farming for six years. Her mixed farm produces eggs, vegetables, fruits and maize, which she sells to the local market. She also operates a phone business in the same area.

Christine is 41 years old. She is married with two children who are 17 and 19. Both children attend school. She has been pictured with her cow since it was not possible to get a photo of her in her poultry farm.

She has requested this loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to expand her poultry farming. This loan will enable her to increase her stock of poultry and consequently increase her income. She says that this income will improve her life and that of her family and she will be able to expand her business and provide for her family. In the future, she wishes to have 2,000 chickens and be the main supplier of eggs at the local market.

loans.use: To expand her poultry farm

loans.name: S. Elisabeth

texts.fr: H. S. Elisabeth est née le 22 Décembre 1979 à Savè, dans le département des Collines au Bénin. Mariée à KOUKOUI Brice, un frigoriste, Elisabeth est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Elisabeth vit avec sa famille depuis quatre ans environs au quartier Sodjèatinmè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Elisabeth vient en aide à son mari dans les charges du ménage grâce au revenu que lui génère son activité. Elisabeth n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis sept ans, Elisabeth mène comme activité la vente de sachets en gros, des couches à jeter, des papiers de toilette et divers autres produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est aussi au marché de Dantokpa que Elisabeth s’approvisionne. C’est la première fois que Elisabeth sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un concours financier en vue d’élever le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle et son chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en: S. Elisabeth H. was born on December 22, 1979 in the Collines Department of Benin.  Married to Brice Koukoui, a refrigerator man, Elisabeth is the mother of two children, both in school.  Elisabeth has lived with her family in the Sodjèatinmè neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for about four years.  Elisabeth is able to help her husband meet the needs of the household thanks to the revenue generated by her business.  Elisabeth did not go to school.  For seven years, Elisabeth has run a business selling bags, disposable linens, toilet paper and various other products at wholesale in Danktopa, the international market of Benin.  Elisabeth also gets her supplies in Danktopa.  This is the first time that Elisabeth has requested financial aid from ALIDé, in the hopes of increasing her business level and growing her customer base and her sales.

loans.use: Purchase of trash bags, disposable linens and various other products.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta B. is from the village of Bagong Tanza. She is 61 years old. Loreta is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Loreta owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Loreta has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Loreta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Loreta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Loreta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Loreta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items for sale in general store

loans.name: Express Group

texts.en:
Happy A., in her late twenties, is married with two daughters. For the past two years, she has sold cosmetics (lotions) and charcoal. She works from 4pm to 5pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $53.

This will be Happy's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to increase her business and pay school fees for her children, and has paid those loans back successfully. She hopes to use the current loan to increase her cosmetics and charcoal inventory.  She dreams of one day looking for land on which to build a house.

Happy will share this loan with her loan group, Express, which totals 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the picture, Happy is second from the right, in the front row wearing pink.

loans.use: To increase cosmetics and charcoal inventory.

loans.name: Edilma Dioselina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal La Rosa De Guadalupe. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

Para la señora Edilma este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque a través de las reuniones a aprendido mucho. Tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera y de una relación que tuvo tiene 4 hijos de 11, 10, 9 y 4 años, los mayores están en la escuela, tiene una casa propia donde vive con sus hijos.

Tiene un puesto en el mercado de Charapoto donde vende frutas y legumbres, trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 17h00, trabaja con la ayuda de su ex suegro. Sus productos los compra a los campesinos que llevan sus productos al mercado y otra parte la compra a comerciantes mayoristas allí mismo en el mercado.

Este crédito es para comprar más productos para surtir su puesto. Sus sueños son que sus hijos tengan una buena educación y que nunca les falte nada.
texts.en:
The “La Rosa de Guadalupe” communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  This area is known for its traditional culture and for its location, minutes from the provincial beaches of San Jacinto and San Clemente.

This will be Edilma’s third loan cycle with the communal bank.  She likes it because she’s learned a lot in the meetings.  She’s 34 years old and is the single mother of four children, ages 11, 10, 9, and 4.  The oldest are in school and they all live in her home.

She has a stall in the Cahrapoto market, where she sells fruits and vegetables, and works every day from 6:00 AM to 5:00 PM.  She gets help from her former brother in law and buys some of her products from the farmers who take them to market, and the rest from wholesalers at the market itself.

She will use the money from this loan to buy more products to stock her business.  She wants her children to have a good education and not be in need of anything.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophy P. and her husband, Mr. Sok Men, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have two daughters, one of them is a garment factory worker and the other one attends school. Her husband is a pedicab driver.

Sophy stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her daughter’s salary. She is asking for a loan of $500 to build a restroom for the  family’s use, and to connect her house to a private water and electricity utility service.

loans.use: To build a restroom and connect house to water & electricity service.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine K. K. is thirty years old. She is married and her husband works with Better Health Care. They have three children aged between eight years old and three years old. Her business is located in a busy commercial area known as Mlolongo and she is served by the Kitengela branch. She has a grocery store in which she stocks vegetables and fruit. She has been in this business for three years now and she says most of her customers are repeat customers. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 70,000 to buy vegetables and potatoes to expand her business. In future, she hopes to be a wholesaler. She describes herself as very hardworking, punctual and honest.

loans.use: Vegetables and Potatoes

loans.name: Hector Bartolo

texts.es:
Héctor de 60 años, es un hombre trabajador que ha hecho lo posible para que sus hijos y esposa tengan lo mejor. Comenzó ha reciclar desperdicios hace varios años cuando vio que era rentable venderlos. 

Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas ha podido trabajar comprando y recolectando desperdicios y reciclajes. Trabaja desde muy temprano para poder vender a un buen volumen los desperdicios. El comprar a empresas aluminio, vasos ente otros para venderlos a un mayor valor. 

Uno de sus objetivos es seguir trabajando para darles una buena vida a sus hijos de 11 y 7 años por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar reciclajes y desperdicios. En el futuro quiere seguir trabajando y que su familia este bien económicamente.
texts.en:
Héctor, 60, is a hard working man who has done everything possible to ensure the best for his wife and children.  He began recycling scraps several years ago when he saw that they were a profitable thing to sell.

Living in an urban area called Orquídeas, he has been able to work buying and collecting scrap metal and recyclables.  He starts working very early in order to sell a good volume.  He buys metal and glass from companies and resells them for a better price.

One of his goals is to continue working in order to provide a good life to his 11 and 7 year-old children, so he would like this loan in order to buy recyclables and scraps.  In the future, he hopes to continue working and for his family to do well economically.

loans.use: to buy recyclables

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida A. is from the village of Upper Dicayas,Dipolog City. She is 32 years old, married, and has three school aged children. Loida operates a family member's business in the food sector, making and selling salabat in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Loida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Loida is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional ginger for her business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Loida from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.About PMPC:


Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: use to purchase ginger for her business

loans.name: You

texts.en:
You L. is 58 years old.  She is married and is devoted to eight children, four of whom are working in a garment factory, and the other four are students at the public school. She stays at home to manage the family housework such as cooking meals and caring for her children. She is married to 61-year-old Khiev Nait, who supports the family by working as a chief of the village. 

You L. is concerned that the local school where her children attend is so far from her house, and they must ride their old bicycles. It is hard for them because their bicycles are getting old and worn.  To encourage her children, she would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorcycle for her kids.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle for kids to go to school

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.ru: Норбеков Комилчон поживает в Гиссарском районе. Ему 40 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам он имеет средне - специальное образование, товаровед. По специальности проработал пять лет. Сейчас он занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи и сажает фруктовые деревья. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян и топлива.
texts.en: Komiljon N. lives in the Gissar Region. He is married and has four children. His wife is a homemaker. Komiljon has a technical degree as a retail store buyer. He has worked in his specialty for five years. At present he  grows produce. He has a land plot near his house, were he grows vegetables and plants fruit trees. He has been in this line of work for 15 years. He is taking out a loan to purchase seeds and fuel.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fuel

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
El señor Juan Bautista C. H. tiene 34 años concubino con la Sra. Guillermina Arias Villca mas de 5 años tienen dos hijos menores viven en la comunidad de Pisly a 92 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba. 

El sr Juan es agricultor produce papa, papaliza, el necesita capital para comprar abono orgánico que en esta época los precios son baratos,  el sr. Juan es una persona humilde trabajadora y responsable, para él es muy difícil acudir a los Bancos de la ciudad que les piden muchos requisitos. Por eso se tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esa zona a otorgar crédito, el sr. Juan esta muy contento de haber conseguido un crédito, ahora va comprar el abono orgánico y tendrá lista para la siembra de esta año, así va tener ahorro para el estudio de sus hijos como también para mejorar la vivienda que es tan  precaria.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Bautista C. H. is 34 years old and has lived with Sra. Guillermina Arias Villca for more than five years. They have two young children and live in the community of Pisly, which is 92km away from the city of Cochabamba.

Sr. Juan is a farmer who produces potatoes and other tubers. He needs capital to buy organic fertilizer since prices are low at the moment. Juan is a humble, hardworking, and responsible individual, but it is difficult for him to access loans from banks in the city because they have too many requirements. For this reason, he has taken the initiative to leave his district in order to apply for a loan.

Sr. Juan is very happy to have received this loan. Now he will be able to buy organic fertilizer so that he can be prepared for the next planting this year. Juan can now save for his children’s education and make home improvements that are overdue.

loans.use: Purchase organic fertilizers

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is a-43-year-old widow. Her husband was a mason who died in 1999 from an illness. Since the death of her husband, Tamar has to work hard to generate income to support her children. The children are  Yanti, 25 years old and married; Regis, 23 years old and married; 	Yeskiel, 15 years old and in the third year of junior high school, and Steven, 12 years old  and in the sixth grade of elementary school.

Tamar lives with her children in Airnona Village. To make a living, Tamar sells various vegetables such as water spinach and mustard greens at the traditional market in Kupang as well as at her house. She started her vegetable business using the limited capital that she had. 

Raising her children while taking responsibility as the head of the family is challenging for Tamar, and so are the many competitors at the market. 

Tamar recognizes that the vegetable business is not always run well. She wishes to improve her business by selling other products such as tomatoes, chilies and other cooking spices in order to generate a better income. To do so, Tamar is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 3,000,000 from TLM to purchase new stock to be sold. She hopes that TLM is willing to help her in improving her business.

loans.use: to add new items to her stock of produce for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy party supplies, such as gifts for every occasion and all types of paper supplies

loans.name: Bettyna Alesandra

texts.es:
La señora Bettyna es socia del banco comunal Manos Unidas del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y tiene un solo hijo.
Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, lleva trabajando con Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, esta actividad no le quita mucho tiempo y puede atender su hogar sin ningún problema ya que los pedidos son por catálogo.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 colonia, 2 talcos para pies, 1 perfume para niñas, 1 juego de collar, 2 lápiz labiales, 1 sombras, 1 base de maquillajes, 1 cuarteto de sombras, 1 champú, 1 juego de aretes, 2 lápiz delineadores, 1 colonia para hombres.
Su esposo es empleado en una empresa y ella lo ayuda con algunos gastos, gracias a este negocio ha podido cubrir algunas necesidades. "Gracias a Manuela Ramos por darme la oportunidad de tener un capital propio".
texts.en:
Bettyna is a member of the Manos Unidas communal bank, located in the Yarinacocha district within the Ucayali department.  She is 27 years old, married, with one son.

She sells beauty products via catalog.  She has been working with the Manuela Ramos organization for two years.  This activity doesn’t take much time and she can take car of the home while she does her catalog orders.

With this 1,000 PEN she will buy a bottle of cologne, 2 foot talcs, 1 bottle of girl’s perfume, 1 necklace set, 2 lipsticks, 1 umbrella, 1 foundation, 1 eyeshade, 1 shampoo, 1 set of accessories, 2 lip liners, and 1 bottle of men’s cologne.

Her husband works for a company and she helps with some of the household expenses, thanks to this business.  “Thanks to the Manuela Ramos Movement for giving me this opportunity.”

loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Baraka Alanine Group

texts.fr: Nkubonage Z. est entrepreneur, conseillère du groupe d’affaire « Baraka Alanine »,  âgée de 39 ans, mariée, mère de 8 enfants. Son mari est un chauffeur mécanicien indépendant. La cliente Nkubonage Z. est vendeuse des articles divers au marché communal de Katindo -Alanine.  Il ya 4 ans qu’elle est exerce cette activité. Elle démarra son business avec  250$ reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec  les habits à revendre (10 boubous, 50 bodys, 70 jupes, 30 écharpes foulards). En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants jusqu’au niveau de BAC +5.  La cliente Nkubonage Z.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire «  Baraka Alanine » est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en: Nkubonage Z. is an entrepreneur, and an advisor to the "Baraka Alanine" group, composed primarily of women . She is 39 years old, and a married mother of eight. Her husband is a self-employed driver/mechanic.  Nkubonage Z. sells various items of clothing at the Katindo-Alanine town market.   She has worked in this field for the past four years, having started out with $250 from her husband. This new loan will enable her to stock up on dresses to sell (10 boubous - African robes, 50 "bodys", 70 skirts, and 30 headscarves). Furthermore, she is seeking to grow her business and to see to her children's education up to BAC+5 (post-secondary education).  Nkubonage Z.  would like to thank Hekima for helping those excluded from ordinary banking activities.

loans.use: to purchase 10 boubous (African robes), 50 "bodys", 70 skirts, and 30 headscarves

loans.name: Fenne

texts.en:
Fenne is 35 years old and is a married woman. She has three children aged 10, 8, and 3. She is a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice and corn for 10 years. She also raises pigs to sell.

Fenne has requested a loan and plans to use it to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and feed. In the future, she hopes for her children to be successful.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and feed.

loans.name: Yass

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, single and lives with four family members.

Yass has had a food market since 2000. He has 10 years of experience in this field, a good reputation and is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to renovate his market and to purchase additional foodstuff for his store. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his market and to purchase additional foodstuff for his store like cheese, juices, bread, daily use and dairy products.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is married with two adult children. She earns about Php 3,000 per month raising pigs.

Leonida raises pigs so that she can have a source of income. With her diligence she earns a minimum of PHP 3,500 whenever she sells one of her raised pigs. To sustain the daily feed needed by her pigs, Leonida is asking for a loan to buy piglets that she can sell in the future. 

In the future, Leonida hopes that her piggery will further improve so that she can provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets that she can raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is 32 years old, married and has two children aged nine and seven. Richard is a farmer form the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. He tills his own land where he grows corn and rice crops. He plans to use his loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. Richard hopes for this loan to help improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rommel

texts.es: Rommel de 32 años vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 3 y 8 años; allí se dedica a la elaboración de avisos y materiales publicitarios, negocio que inició cuando se graduó en la escuela de diseñador gráfico, su experiencia práctica la construyó cuando trabajó en una agencia publicitaria como creativo y finalmente cuando decidió darle curso a su espíritu emprendedor, se independizó y emprendió su aventura de negocio. Al principio, hizo toda una labor publicitaria para dar a conocer sus servicios, y también  lo hizo realizando trabajos publicitarios a microempresas vecinas, donde se dio a conocer en el mercado. Hoy sus clientes, amigos, vecinos lo refieren y sus compradores han  ido creciendo paulatinamente, por la gran satisfacción que genera en ellos la calidad de su trabajo.   Su credikiva es el  primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará un computador debido a que tiene uno solo y con esta deficiencia pierde muchos clientes. Su sueño más adelante es tener su propia agencia de publicidad y en el futuro generar fuentes de empleo.
texts.en: Rommel is 32 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena with his wife and two children, ages 3 and 8. He makes a living making advertisements and promotional materials, a business he started when he graduate from graphic-design school. He gained experience when he worked in the creative department for an advertising agency and finally decided to rein in his entrepreneurial spirit and go out on his own and start his own business. At first, he did all the labor to familiarize himself with his services, and he also started doing publicity for his neighboring small businesses, which helped him learn his market. Today, his clients, friends and neighbors all recommend him and his buyers have been growing steadily thanks to the great satisfaction found in the quality of his work. This loan with Kiva is Rommel's first with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and he plans to purchase a computer because he only has one and that deficiency makes him lose many customers. His dream for the future is to have his own advertising agency and generate sources of employment.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Sop Mame Thierno Group

texts.fr:
le groupe est crée le 09 décembre 2010jour de l'inauguration du banc villageois regroupe 16 femmes qui sont tous du même quartier et ont de bonnes relations entre elles. leur activité principale c'est le petit commerce Awa est la responsable du groupe , âgée de 44 ans, elle est veuve avec 03 filles, un garçon , 4 petits fils.
Awa gère une boutique chez elle avec le prêt elle compte renforcer sa boutique. Elle veut aussi acheter des tissus qu'elle va donner à ses enfants pour qu'elles font la vente marché ambulante.Elle mène cette activité depuis 15 ans.
Elle va jusqu'à Mauritanie pour acheter sa marchandise. Avec le prêt elle veut promouvoir l’épanouissement et le bien être de la famille.
texts.en:
This group was created on 9 December 2010, the day the local village group fund was established. It comprises 16 women who all live in the same area and have good relationships with each other. Their main activity is running small retail businesses. Awa, the group leader, is 44 years old, widowed, and has three daughters, one son, and four grandsons.
Awa runs a store at her home. With this loan, she intends to strengthen her store. She also wants to buy fabric to give to her children to sell door-to-door. She has run this business for 15 years.
She goes all the way to Mauritania to buy her merchandise. With this loan, she wants to promote the flourishing and well-being of her family.

loans.use: To buy and re-sell cosmetics.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат проживает в городе Худжанд. Ей 40 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Саодат более 5 лет занимается торговлей. У нее имеется магазин со смешанным ассортиментом. Она в основном продает продукты питания и хозяйственные товары. Кредит берет для покупки безалкогольных напитков, масла, яиц, сахара, мыла, зубной пасты и щетки.
texts.en: Saodat lives in Khujand. She is 40 years old. She is married. She has two children. Saodat has worked in trade for more than five years. She has a general store. She mainly sells food and household goods. She is taking out a loan to buy soft drinks, butter, eggs, sugar, soap, toothpaste and brushes.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, butter, eggs, sugar, soap, toothpaste and brushes.

loans.name: Anvarshoh

texts.ru:
Анваршох четный и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и любящий отец одного ребёнка.  Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Когда ему было 23 лет он начал выращивать картошку, морковь и лука и продолжает это. Таким путем он зарабатывает денег на содержание свою семью. Его жена помогает ему по посеву семена и переработки земли.  Он также занимается скотоводством. Анваршох хотел бы получит займ в размере 1100$ США для покупки скота, горюче смазочные материалы, минеральных удобрений и семена. Он заранее хочет, поблагодарит всех кредиторов за их поддержку и поощрение. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Anvarshoh is an honest and hardworking man. He is married and is a proud father of a child. Anvarshoh is a farmer and has been growing potatoes, carrots and onions since he was 23 years old. This is how he makes a living for his family. Anvarshoh's wife helps him to work the land and plant seeds. Both of them also raise cattle. Anvarshoh wold like to receive a loan of 1100 USA dollars to purchase more cattle as well as diesel fuel, fertilizer and seeds. He would like to thank in advance to all of his lenders for their support and encouragement!

loans.use: To purchase cattle, diesel fuel, fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: Edgar tiene 48 años, esta casado con Ada de 53 años, y fruto de esta relación tiene 2 hijos con quienes viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de LLochegua. Edgar es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se gano el aprecio de todos sus clientes gracias al buen trato que ofrece hacia ellos. En su bar recreo, negocio que posee, esta apta para todo público, cuenta con una piscina para niños y adultos, juegos mecánicos, y los más exquisitos platos típicos preparados a base de productos de esta región, que son los que le dan un realce a su bar recreo de Don Edgar, que es como le llaman. Todo turista que llegue a este distrito siempre se queda contento con las ganas de poder volver otra vez. Edgar esta feliz con el negocio que tiene y el apoyo que recibe de su adorada esposa e hijos, quienes siempre están al tanto de los clientes. Este es su primer cerdito con MFP, por lo que el se compromete en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1500 comprara más utensilios de cocina para su bar recreo.
texts.en:
Edgar is 48 and is married to Ada, 53. They live with their two children in their own home located in Llochegua district. Edgar is a very hardworking person who has earned the appreciation of all of his customers thanks to his good relationships with them.

His business, a recreation bar, is suitable for everyone. He has a swimming pool for children and adults, amusement park rides and the most delicious typical dishes, prepared with local products, all of which enhance the appeal of Mr. Edgar’s recreation bar, as people refer to him. The tourists who come to this district are always delighted and want to return in the future.

Edgar is happy with his business and with the support he receives from his beloved wife and children, who are always well informed about the customers. This is his first loan from MFP and he is committed to making all of his payments on time. He will use the 1,500 to buy more cooking utensils for his recreation bar.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils for his recreation bar.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is 55 years old and lives in Ramon Magsaysay Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and has five children. For the past four years, she has operated a business selling dried fish. Each month she earns almost 3,000 PHP doing this business. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to purchase more dried fish for her retail business. In the future, Julieta hopes that she can provide for her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish

loans.name: 06 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Lan has a manufacturing business sewing curtains. She is applying for a loan to purchase machines to do tailor-made clothing and repairing service.

Lan is 39 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of an eight-member group: the 06 Đông Vệ solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2010, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lan has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Lan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lan hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase machines to do tailor-made clothing and repairing service

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 30 years old, married and has two children who are 5 and 7 years old. For the last three years, she has made a living by selling a variety of goods like bananas, soft drinks and sugar. Her shop is open from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day, and she is applying for a loan from Kiva and Vision Finance Company to expand her business and increase her income. Her goal is to provide her family with greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, soft drinks and sugar to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Shirley Janette

texts.es:
Shirley Jeannette
doña Shirley, ella ha venido desempeñando su negocio desD. que fape le brindo la confianza en darle un crédito para invertir en su venta D. frijoles volteados, nos comenta que gracias a a esa oportunidad solicita ahora su segundo crédito para la compra D. mas producto para compra D. frijoles y materiales para la elavoracion D. frijoles volteados su anhelo es seguir invirtiendo en su negocio  y sobre todo crecer,y seguir apoyando a su esposo para sacar adelante a sus dos hijos, ya que aun están pequeños y el deseo D. ella y el D. su esposo es que sus hijos tengan siempre lo necesario.
texts.en: Shirley has been managing her business since Fape (Kiva Field Partner) has imparted the trust in her with a loan. She invested in her refried beans business. She tells us that she is thankful for that opportunity. She now requests a second loan to purchase more products, more beans and other materials she needs to make refried beans. Her goal is to keep investing in her business and especially to make it grow. She will continue to help her husband to proviD. for their two children. They are still young and her wish and that of her husband is for them to always have what they need.

loans.use: to purchase beans and other ingredients necessary to make refried beans.

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is 31 years old. He lives in the village Ganakhleba, Adjara Region with his parents. They are 60 years old. Gela’s family earns on living through agricultural activities. They have 0.4 hectare of land, where various vegetables and fruits are grown. Harvested greengrocery is sold to local retailers. Along with the abovementioned the family has a milk cow and sells home-made cheese. Total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris (approximately 360 USD). 

Gela requested credit for construction of a greenhouse. He will be able to grow the vegetables not only summer and fall but also on spring and winter seasons as well. It will positively impact the income of the family. Gela plans to reinvest the increase in income in family farming activities, in order to expand it and make more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse construction

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna Isabel de 36 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, desde hace 5 años, ella le da gracias a Dio porque le ha ayudado en su negocio y con la ayuda de él y sus hijos. El financiamiento que solicita es  para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, vestidos entre otros. Doña Reyna espera obtener buenas ganancias de este negocio, ya que está consciente de que, le falta capital para trabajar así seguir con su negocio. el sueño de ella es que sus hijos tengan su propio negocio y así superarse poco a poco.
texts.en: Reyna Isabel, 36, has three children.  She’s been selling clothes for five years.  She thanks God because He’s helped her in her business and with His help and her children’s.  The loan she’s requesting is to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits and dresses, among others.  Reyna hopes to earn good profits from this business because she’s aware that she needs capital to continue in business.  Her dream is that her children have businesses of their own so that they can get ahead that way little by little.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Emberg

texts.es: Emberg habita en su propia casa junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa y tres hijos. Emberg se caracteriza por ser muy trabajador, dedicado y responsable. Tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse al comercio. Él se dedica a la venta de variedad de calzado. En su negocio los clientes pueden encontrar todo lo que buscan relacionado con calzado. Tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse a este negocio y gracias a la ayuda de Dios y a sus esfuerzo a logrado mantenerlo vivo durante estos años. La ubicación del negocio es muy estratégica ya que se encuentra sobre la carretera principal de la zona donde el habita. Es una zona muy concurrida y visitada sobre todo el negocio de Emberg que siempre se encuentra a la vista. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de variedad de calzado para todas las edades, gustos y preferencias. De esta manera espera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Emberg lives in his own house with his family group which is made up of his wife and three children. Emberg is a very hardworking man who is dedicated and responsible. He has been a merchant for a long time. He sells a variety of footwear. In his business his customers can find everything they are looking for related to footwear. He has been in this business for a long time and thanks to God's help and his hard work he has been able to keep it going all of these years. The location of his business is very strategic since it is on the main roadway of the area where he lives. It is a well trafficked and frequented area, especially Emberg's business which is visible. He has decided to ask for this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in buying a variety of footwear for all ages, tastes and preferences. In this way, he hopes to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of footwear such as: sandals, loafers, tennis shoes, etc.

loans.name: Malekha West Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Malekha West Group in Western Kenya! 

Enock takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed his family and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to ensure quality farm produce. In the recent 2011 season, Enock had a good maize yield harvesting 8 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Enock was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. With income from maize sales, Enock will educate his children and invest in business.

Enock is the facilitator of the Malekha West group. He is pictured with his group members in the photograph. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Malekha West group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Enock and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma  lives in  Uganda. She is married and has 10 children, none of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (relatives).        
Fatuma has a banana selling business. She has been in this business for 10 years and she works six days out of every week. Fatuma sells her products at the market, by means of retail. She has requested for a loan of 1200000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas.   
The main business challenges for Fatuma include transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and to own a delivery van to ease transportation problems. Fatuma lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a 26 year old posho (maize flour) mill owner in Kilifi.

He is married and a father of one child. He has been in this business for the last 5 years and he is doing great. 

He was introduced to KADET  and this marks his third loan to finance his business. 

He plans to purchase spare parts and service his posho mill. He will use the anticipated profit to educate his child and repay his loan. 

He hopes to be successful in his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for and to service his posho (maize flour) mill

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 32-year-old single man. He has no children yet. He describes himself as determined. 

Geoffrey operates a retail store where he sells sugar, salt, tea leaves, bread, and flour, etc. He has been involved in this business for three years. He says his biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving his store. He will use this loan of KES 20,000 to buy items such as sugar, salt, tea leaves, and soap, etc. for resale. His business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: To buy more tea leaves, sugar, rice, and soap for resale.

loans.name: Maryland

texts.en:
Maryland is eighteen years of age and is married with two children. She owns & operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  She has 1 year of experience in this business.  She needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase raw ingredients, such as flour, sugar and cordials, to produce products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve the business.

In 2011, Maryland joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Maryland's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients, such as flour, sugar and cordials, to produce products for sale.

loans.name: Djekadi  5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe DJEKADI 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Kapala, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le pois sucré avec NASSATA debout en première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et la semence pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants et de semences agricoles

loans.name: Rita Sobeida

texts.en:
I have a small grocery store that sells groceries such as eggs, milk, breads, butter, candies, and soda waters. I have had this business for three years. This is a family business since my husband and children help me on weekends or when I am preparing their food. The income we recieve from this store help us with feeding and educating the entire family.

Loan Use: Purchase softdrinks, cookies, candies, breads, milk, eggs and other products

Tengo una pequeña pulperia en la que vendo productos de consumo popular, como huevos, leche, panes, manteca, dulces, sodas. Mi negocio lo tengo desde hace 3 años. Este negocio es familiar ya que mi esP. e hijos me ayudan en las horas que me toca hacerles su comida o los fines de semana que pasan en la casa. Los ingresos que percibimos nos ayudan con los estudios y alimentacion de toda la familia.

loans.use: Compra de refrescos, galletas, dulces, panes, leche, huevos y otros.

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.en: D.'s Bakery serves the public with different kinds of breads such as brown bread, sugar bread, butter bread, tea bread and many more. The baker, Miss Adlaide D., has her own oven but has no capital to buy flour in bags and margarine for baking. She is seeking a loan of $950 from Kiva. She is hardworking and capable of paying it back.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Hudson Busuru

texts.en:
Hudson is a married man with nine children, all in primary school. He has not undergone formal training, but has apprenticed in radio repair.
He started his business in 2002 after he began earning money by selling second-hand and new clothes on public buses while he was employed as a bus conductor. Now he does radio repair along with selling clothes, and he has trained three boys in radio repair since he started. With loan from PEMCI, he plans to buy radio spares to sell to his clients. He will also buy more stock for his clothes business. By making his radio service available to the local people and providing inexpensive, decent clothes to his customers, he is able to support his family's needs.

loans.use: To increase stock for radio repair and clothing business

loans.name: Dubersa

texts.es:
We bought land more than two years ago, but with family expenses we have not been able to build. I'm requesting a loan of $1,000 to begin construction on the land, so we can have our own house and don't have to pay rent. Our family is growing and they need to be secure in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Tenemos más de 2 años que adquirimos el terreno pero por gastos familiares no hemos podido construir. Estoy solicitando un préstamo de 1,000.00 dlls. Para empezar a construcción, en el terreno para tener nuestra propia casa, y dejar de pagar renta. Ya que tenemos más familia y necesitan estar seguros para un futuro.

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Tofia

texts.en: A wife and 32 year old mother of 2 children, Tofia owns a ¼ acre of cabbage garden.  She sells the products at the local market in town, and the journey back and forth has taken its toll on her.  To transport the resources back and forth, she hires a local transport to deliver it.  In the previous months, the weather has been unreliable and damaged a large amount of crops.  Therefore, she has requested financial help to purchase a fence for the protection of crops and fertilizers for growing crops of good quality.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and barrier fence

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a 47-year-old mother of eight, with four children still depending on her. She sells wood, a business she has been doing for the past 6 years. Her suppliers get the wood from Kilwa, southern Tanzania, a forested region. The business is sometimes slow because the government limits the wood-gathering, to prevent deforestation.
She is in need of $425 to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Emi

texts.en: Emi is 52 years old and a mother of a 17 year old daughter. She has been selling some fried snacks and vegetables in her small shop. She can earn $12 per day and its just enough to cover her family's daily needs. She is requesting a $50 loan to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Jorge Rafael

texts.es:
He has been an auto mechanic since he was fourteen years old. He started his shop with some friends and acquaintances. Due to the quality of service provided, the shop has been expanding. Currently it has an average of thirty clients a month that come buy constantly for service and preventative maintenance. He has three people working with him in the shop. The purpose of the loan is to maintain his own vehicle in good condition since that is the way he gets around the fastest to purchase parts. Also there are times that he needs to go where the damaged cars are to fix them there and then move them to his shop. His car is very necessary to him and therefore he considers it very important keeping it in good condition.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Es mecánico desde hace catorce años, el taller lo inicio con algunos amigos y conocidos pero al ver el servicio y la calidad que prestaba se a ido ampliando con el negocio hasta la fecha tiene un promedio de treinta clientes mensuales, que lo visitan constantemente para darles entre revisiones y mantenimiento preventivo tiene tres personas que trabajan con el en el taller la finalidad con el crédito es tener su vehículo personal en buen estado ya que le sirve para movilizarse para hacer la compra de repuestos de manera mas rápida e incluso en muchas ocasiones tiene que trasladarse hasta donde se quedan los vehículos con desperfectos y repararlos en ese lugar para luego trasladarlos a su taller, el vehículo le es muy necesario por eso considera que tenerlo en buenas condiciones es importante .

loans.use: Mr. Ramirez needs to repair his automobile. With the loan he will buy rings for the motor and a set of caps

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Pham Thi L., 50 years old, joined TYM Fund (Kiva's partner) since 2007. She lives with her husband and two children in Lam town, Nam Dinh province. Her province is famous for casting copper. Before L., there have been a lot of women borrowing money to buy and sell copper. However, L. is still afraid of not being able to pay the weekly repayment. Until recently (2007), she decided to borrow 200USD. She uses that loan to buy and then cast copper. Her income is 8 to 10 USD per day. Her business is doing quite well, and this time Mrs. L. would like to borrow 575 USD to buy more materials, to increase her income and bring jobs for her two children.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị L., 50 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2007. Chị sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại thị trấn Lâm, Nam Định. Ở một làng nghề truyền thống đúc đồng, trước chị L. đã có rất nhiều chị em vay vốn về kinh doanh mặt hàng này. Nhưng chị vẫn ngại về cách hoàn trả hàng tuần. Đến năm ngoái chị mới quyết định xin vay 200USD. Trong năm đầu chị đầu tư mua đồng về đúc mỗi ngày cho thu nhập từ 8-10USD. Thấy công việc tiến triển thuận lợi, sang năm thứ 2 này chị Lam mạnh dạn vay thêm 575USD về để mua được nhiều nguyên liệu hơn, tăng thu nhập và tạo công ăn việc làm cho 2 con.

loans.use: Buy copper to cast

loans.name: Vart

texts.en: Mrs. Vart T., 43, is a widow with three children and works as a cow broker. Normally she earns on average around $4 a day of profit. Two of her children work in the garment factory typically earns $90 per month. And her son-in-law works works as a motor-taxi driver, earning $3 per day of profit. Mrs. Vart T. is requesting a loan $500 from Kiva to purchase more cows so that she can be resold for a profit. ( Mrs. Vart T. took picture with her granddaughter).

loans.use: To purchase additional cows to resell for profit

loans.name: Fololina

texts.en: Fololina M. runs a plantation and vegetable garden business.  She’s a very hard working lady with 3 children. Her husband is unemployed but helping her in running her business. Fololina has paid back her debts and is requesting another loan of $500.  She will use the profits from her business to pay back her loan and for renovation to her bathroom. She’s a very active member in our program and motivates other members in her community.

loans.use: To purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married and has two children, ages 9 and 5. She owns a small food store, wich she opened in 2004. Every day, Veronica works from 7 am to 5 pm at her store and can earn a monthly profit of about US$40.

She now hopes to receive a loan to buy more food items for her sale.

loans.use: Purchase of food items for sale

loans.name: Rose Wamala’S Group

texts.en:
Rose W. is a 50-year-old married mother of three children, the youngest of whom is 16. She has been a member of MCDT for four years and has received nine loans in the past.

She owns a retail shop in Kampala where she sells various staples such as sugar, rice, oil, maize flour (posho), and millet. The business is profitable, though the profit is small. Still, the profit helps the family to pay for school fees and food and to help them improve their life and their future.

She will use a new loan to buy inventory for the shop and to add new items. It will also help her to deal with the current price increases for food items.

loans.use: Add new inventory

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en: Fadel, a 45-year-old married man, father of 3 children, lives in the area of Nabatieh in South Lebanon. Fadel is a car painter. He needs a loan for the amount of USD 1,000 to purchase painting equipment and therefore expand his business. Furthermore, he needs to pay the school fees for his elder child. Fadel has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for the past 2 years and always repays his loan on time.

loans.use: USD 1,000 to purchase painting equipment

loans.name: Rahel's Ujamaa Group

texts.en:
Rahel is 30-years-old, married with two children, ages 12 and 5. She began selling clothes in 2002. She works from 8AM to 6PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Rahel has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business.She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes to increase her inventory. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who also have businesses dealing with shop ownership and milk sales.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing for resale

loans.name: João André

texts.pt:
João André N. nasceu e cresceu em namaacha uma vila que faz fronteira com  Swazilândia, tem 34anos solteiro e pai de 4 filhos com idades compriendidas entre os 9 anos aos 3 meses, os dois primeiros filhos encontram se a estudar.
 Joao fez a 11ªclase e sai de casa dos seus pais  quando começa a trabalhar no centro de formacao de professores primarios como servente, mas não permaneceu por longo tempo devido ao mau relacionamento com os colegas. Seis meses depois joão começa a trabalhar como segurança na empresa de Telecomunição de Maçambique(TDM),é funcionario permanente a dois anos, trabalha em turnos de 24h, três vezes por semana e tem um ordenado mensal de 2,900.00mtn. Para aumentar a renda familiar Joao faz negócio de fabrico de blocos a 2anos e tem tido bons resultado. Compra por mês 30 sacos de cimento a 250,00mt cada e tem fabricado 40 a 50 blocos em cada saco dependendo do tamanho, os mais pequenos tem vendido a 11.00mt e os mais grandes a 13.00mt tem tido um rendimento mensal de 5.700.00mt. Com o negócio João conseguiu construir asua casa própria, comprou duas viaturas de caixa aberta que lhe ajudam a transportar o seu produto e ainda consegue poupar 1,500.00mtn por mês. Para alem da sua familia João sustenta seus pais que vivem em Inhambane enviando lhes 500.00mtn no fim do mês. 

Este é o segundo emprestimo de joao na hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva. O primeiro emprestimo de 10.000.00mtn ele usou para comprar material para o fabrico de blocos conseguiu pagar antes do prazo determinado . E pede este segundo de 15.000.00mt  para reforcar o seu negocio, assim que terminar de pagar este emprestimo, pretende pedir um terceiro para compra um camioneta para caregar areia.
texts.en:
João André N. was born and raised in Namaacha, a village on the border with Swaziland. He is 34 years old, single, and father of four children whose ages range from three months to nine years. The oldest two are in school. João himself completed the 11th grade. For two years, he has been working in security for Telecomunição de Maçambique (TDM) as a full-time employee. He works 24-hour shifts three times a week and earns 2,900 MT per month. To augment the family income, João has had a cement block fabrication business for the last two years. The business has shown good results. Each month he buys 30 sacks of cement at 250 MT each and manufactures between 40 and 50 blocks for each sack, depending on block size. He sells the smallest for 11 MT and the largest for 13 MT. The business earns 5,700 MT per month. With his business, João was able to build his own house, has purchased two vehicles to help transport his product, and is still able to save 1,500 MT per month. Besides his family, João supports his parents who live in Inhambane, sending them 500 MT at the end of each month. This is João’s second loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. The first was for 10,000 MT, which he used to purchase material for block manufacturing. He was able to repay the loan before the due date. He is requesting this second loan of 15,000 MT to strengthen his business. After repaying this loan, he intends to request a third to purchase a truck for hauling sand.

Translated from Portuguese by Steve Fogel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow his business

loans.name: Khadija's Kheri Liwe Group

texts.en:
Khadija is married and has three children ages 9, 4, and 1. She has run her own shop since 2006. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Khadja now hopes for a loan to buy more commodities for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling charcoal, vegetables, and other items.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business

loans.name: Orbelina

texts.es: Doña Orbelina R. S. tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera, con 3 hijos las edades  de sus hijos son de: 16, 28 y 14 años,  el mayor de sus hijos trabaja por cuenta propia sus otros dos hijos cursan la secundaria, su compañero de vida  es comerciante, los propósitos que ella tiene es que sus hijos tengan su carrera  y logren finalizarla ya que es muy difícil poder finalizar completamente los estudios debido a las diferentes dificultades económicas que se presentan, otro de los propósitos que ella tiene es poder mejorar un poco las condiciones de vivienda, la cual pretende ir mejorando poco a poco producto de las ganancias que le genere su actividad económica. Siendo esta la venta de mercadería como ropa nueva, cosméticos por encargo, comprando dos veces al mes  en Managua de acuerdo a los pedidos, el tiempo que doña Orbelina tiene de tener el negocio es de 20 años de estar activa dedicándose en tiempo completo a ella le gusta esta digna actividad  por la cual dice que no la cambiaria ya que trabaja en su casa y la mayoría de  sus clientes llegan a buscarla a su casa el financiamiento de esta será productiva para ella ya que obtendrá mejoras para su negocio y de esta forma obtener los mejores ingresos para su familia. Con la ayuda de los créditos pretende instalar una tienda en su casa de habitación mas adelante ya que sus clientes le conocen.
texts.en:
Mrs. Orbelina R. S. is 48 years old, single, and has three children who are 14, 16, and 28 years old. Her oldest child works and supports himself, but her other children are still in high school. Her life partner is a merchant. Her dream in life is that her children can finish their schooling which is very difficult to do since many economic difficulties present themselves which can keep them from finishing their studies. She also hopes to improve her family's housing conditions, which she has been able to do little by little from the income from her business. She works selling new clothing and cosmetics which she purchases twice a month in Managua depending on her orders. Orbelina has worked full-time in sales for 20 years; she loves her works because it allows her to work from her home where her customers seek her out. She is seeking a loan in order to finance her business which will help her increase her family's income. Through the loan, she will construct a small store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business

loans.name: Sarvinoz

texts.ru: Калонова Сарвиноз проживает в районе Шахринай.Не замужем. Живет со своими родителями. Ей 24 года и уже четыре года она имеет свой диллерский центр , где торгует картами. Хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить карты и других провайдеров. Эьто поможет ей увеличить доход , путем привлечения новых клиентов. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sarvinoz K. lives in the Shahrinaw District. She is not married and lives with her parents. She is 24 years old and has her own small business where she has sold phone cards for the past 4 years. She wants a loan in order to stock up on cards and different service providers. The loan will help her increase profits by attracting new clients. She will repay the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase telephone cards

loans.name: Josefa Nuvia

texts.es: La Sr. Josefa tiene 33 años de edad, habita en un barrio llamado héroes y mártires en la capital de Managua, Casada, su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada, con dos  hijos de 11 y 16 años de edad ambos están estudiando. Sus planes en el ámbito familiar es darles un porvenir y mejora a sus hijos .Doña Josefa vende cosméticos: ropa, zapatos, joyas de plata y otros. Desde hace diez años,  ella inicio su pequeño negocio con fondo propio. Con esta solicitud de préstamo espera  mejorar su economía con la compra de nuevos productos y así aumentar sus ingresos mejorando su nivel de vida y dándole a su familia un mejor futuro. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograr realizar sus objetivos de adquirir mayor clientela y vender más productos variados
texts.en:
Josefa is 33 years old and lives in the Heroes and Martyrs neighborhood of Managua. She is married and her husband works for a private company. She has two school-age children, ages 11 and 16. Her plan is to provide a better life for her children.

Josefa sells cosmetics, clothes, shoes, silver jewelry, etc. She began her business ten years ago with her own money. With this loan she hopes to buy new products and thereby increase her monthly earnings. This increase will improve her standard of living and provide her family with a better future. Thanks to loans from Kiva's partner AFODENIC she will meet her goal of acquiring more customers and selling a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing for children and adults as well as cosmetics

loans.name: Anar

texts.en: Anar is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan,Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region, in Yaglivend village. Anar was born in 1981. He is married, has two children. He has been selling foodstuffs for five years and is requesting a loan to purchase more foodstuff stock so he can increase his inventory and his income and better provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for a general store

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa Trabajemos en quechua.
Paulina es viuda, tiene 37 años y 5 hijos, Paulina vive en la selva ayacuchana, en la localidad de Monterrico en donde tiene una tienda de abarrotes en general, Paulina viaja cada 15 días a Ayacucho a realizar sus compras.
Paulina necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas.
Los sueños de Paulina son equipar con todo los artefactos su casa y mejora su negocio.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Llamkasum Communal Bank, which means "Let´s Work" in Quechua. Paulina is a widow, 37 years old and has 5 children. She lives in the forest zone of Ayacucho, in a place called Monterrico, where she has a general store. Paulina travels every 15 days to Ayacucho to make purchases. She needs a loan for 600 soles which will be used to buy soft drinks. Paulina dreams of equipping her home with all types of appliances and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos O. is 60 years old and married with 5 children. He sells dried yams for making yam flour. He is requesting a loan $700 to purchase more dried yam to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more dried yam to sell

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es: Saturnino C. García tiene 58 años de edad, su estado civil es casado. Don Saturnino no tiene hijos. La actividad económica de Don Saturnino es la compra de repuestos electrodomésticos usados. Hace más de cinco años que se dedica a este negocio y nos dice que no ha sido nada fácil mantener este tipo de negocio. Los propósitos de Don Saturnino son que su negocio obtenga un crecimiento y establecerse de manera permanente. El financiamiento que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que buscar los repuestos de manera más favorable y es para inversión de su negocio ya que así podrá ofertar a sus clientes el precio que piden por los repuestos. Su deseo más grande es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda para que el día de mañana su familia pueda disfrutarlo. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 2.000 cordobas.
texts.en:
Saturnino C. García is 58 years old and is married. Saturnino does not have any children. Saturnino's economic activity is the purchase of used appliance parts. For more than five years he has worked on this business and he tells us that it has not been easy to maintain this type of business. Saturnino's intentions are to grow his business and to establish it in a permanent way. The financing that he is requesting is to be used for working capital as he has to look for the parts in a more favorable way and it is to invest in his business so that he offer his clients the price for the parts that they request. His biggest wish is to make improvements to his home so that his family can enjoy it in the future. The amount that he is requesting is C$ 2.000 cordobas.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa W. is 50 years old and married with five children. Four of her children are grown-ups while her last born is in senior high school. She is old but struggling to provide for her family through the proceeds from her business.

Her husband is not that fit to work and earn income to support the household. Though her adult children are independent, they are not supporting her financially. She buys bags of rice to break and sell in smaller sizes. She sells through hawking, that is from house to house.

Things are not easy for her. She would like a loan to buy bags of rice in bulk so that she can be much better resourced to rent a store to trade. Her only hope is you. With the loan, she believes she can sell more bags of rice to support the family. Adwoa belongs to a village bank called ‘Independence’.

loans.use: Adwoa wants to buy bulk supply of cereals like rice.

loans.name: Faatoina

texts.en: Faatoina K., 35, is married with 7 children.  She has 1 year of experience in the pig farm business. She sells to the general public 6 days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 700 Tala (about US $231).  SPBD loans are Faafouina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase of farming materials

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Astou K. est âgée de 52 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce de tissu et d’huile de palme et pense le développer. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Astou K. is 52 years old, married and the mother of 7 children. Her activity is the sale of fabric and palm oil. She is thinking of expanding this business. This activity allows her to provide for her family's needs.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of fabric and palm oil

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en:
Kamil is a 52-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Kamil has been working as a car repairman for fifteen years. Kamil requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase spare parts and electrical wires for his work. This is his fourth cycle and he has always paid on time. 
Kamil is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Kamil decided on doing his business because he has experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and electrical wires for car repair business.

loans.name: Elba Victoria

texts.es: La señora Elba se dedica a la comercializacion de edredones, almohadas y gorras en la feria 16 de Julio ubicada en la Ciudad de El Alto, actividad que realiza desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana los dias de feria los cuales son jueves y domingos, aparte doña Elba en algunas ocaciones viaja a Caranavi (Sud Yungas) a vender este mismo tipo de mercaderia.  Ella vive con Hermogenes Botello su esposo, ambos trabajan bastante para poder sacar adelante a sus dos hijas ya que ambas estan estudiando en la universidad. Requieren el credito para adquirir una movilidad, la cual la pondran a trabajar como taxi.
texts.en:
Elba sells comforters, pillows and hats in the 16 de Julio market in the city of El Alto. To do this, she gets up very early on market days which are Thursdays and Sundays. Occasionally, she also travels to Caranavi (Sud Yungas) to sell the same type of merchandise. She lives with her husband, Hermogenes Botello, and they both work a lot to be able to support their two daughters who are both in college. They are requesting this loan to purchase a vehicle, which they will use to provide taxi service.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a vehicle, to be used for public service

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: En 2004, cette jeune femme qui est célibataire a commencé le commerce en détail de produits génériques. C’est avec le revenu de ce commerce qu’elle subvient à ses propres charges. Actuellement elle fait face à une rupture de stock et voudrait se réapprovisionner, elle demande par conséquent à WAGES un crédit pour acheter 165 boîtes de produits génériques
texts.en:
In 2004, this young woman, who is unmarried, started a retail business in generic pharmaceutical products. With the revenues from this business, she provides for herself. Currently, she is facing an inventory shortage and would like to stock up again. She is therefore asking WAGES for a loan to buy 165 containers of pharmaceutical products.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy generic pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary N. sells banku at Amissano. She prepares banku from maize. Banku is mostly eaten with okro soup, so she prepares okro and other soups. Mary has received no formal education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a teacher. Mary has been selling banku since 2002. She is responsible for paying school fees. Her loan will be used to buy maize and okro and other ingredients for the preparation of the food for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy maize and okro and other ingredients for the preparation of the food for sale.

loans.name: Catalina Sobeyda

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, la señora Catalina Sobeyda R. P. con mucho entusiasmo se dedica a laborar en su actividad de venta de artesanías como hamacas, sombreros, canastos, almohadas, entre otros.

Ella es una persona muy alegre y con muchas ganas de desarrollar su negocio y por esto es que ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones del negocio y acaparar más clientes para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Catalina Sobeyda R. P. works enthusiastically in the Chinandega department. She sells handicrafts like hammocks, hats, baskets, pillows, among others. She is a very happy person with a great desire to develop her business. That is why she has come to Ceprodel for a loan. This way she can improve business conditions and get more customers to obtain greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy handicrafts

loans.name: Loicith

texts.es:
La señora Loicith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 33 años, y madre de una hija, que aun dependen de ella.

Loicith, es una mujer luchadora que se dedica al servicio de Internet y a la venta de abarrotes, nos cuenta que se siente muy bien con lo que hace.

En la actualidad ya es conocida por sus clientes, que a diario acude a su Internet, cuenta con maquinas modernas, para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
