Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará cables de red, para implementar mejor su cableado y con parte del dinero también invertirá en la compra de abarrotes. 

Loicith, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante hasta donde Dios le de las fuerzas. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberla ayudado a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.

loans.use: Comprará cables, para mejorar su cableado

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shop commodities in bulk for hrebusiness

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, Provincia de Coronel Portillo, tiene 50 años y una hija mayor de edad, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y prendas de vestir. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Galácticas ll” desde hace tres años. Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, que invirtió en prendas de vestir, Marina necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles que será invertido en productos de belleza. El sueño de Marina es mejorar su negocio y comprarse un carro
texts.en:
Marina is an entrepreneurial and hard-working lady. She lives in the town of Pucallpa, Province of Coronel Portillo, she is 50 years old and has a grown-up daughter. She sells beauty products and clothes for a living. She has been a member of "Banco Comunal "Mujeres Galácticas II" for three years. Her first loan of 300 soles was invested in garments. Marina needs a loan of 3000 soles to be invested in beauty products. It is Marina's dream to improve business and buy a car.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in beauty products.

loans.name: Phin

texts.en: Phin P., 51, is married and resides with her husband in the Takeo province. She makes cow bells and also works as a farmer who is able to make for less than US$1 per day, while her husband is a blacksmith. He typically makes US$2 every day. Phin P. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to make two investments. First, she would put some money to reinvest in her husband business and the rest is used to purchase materials to make cow bells.

loans.use: Make cow bells.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura, de 43 años, es mujer muy alegre y luchadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 4 hijos; Jaime de 22, Paulo de 20, Jesús y Domenica de 14, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Para Laura la venta de licores es un negocio muy rentable, ya que tiene mucha demanda y sus ventas siempre son buenas, ella atiende en su propia casa y es desde este mismo lugar que despacha a sus compradores las cajas de licor que compra directamente de la fábrica, también lleva a pedido a las distintas provincias de la región.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede atender su negocio y dedicarse a las labores de su hogar al mismo tiempo, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es comprar los licores, ya que existe muchas bebidas adulteradas y tiene que saber diferenciarlas. 
Para el futuro, desea tener una tienda grande donde pueda vender de todo y no solo limitarse a los licores.

Es el sexto préstamo al que accede Laura con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus cuotas anteriores y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es muy alegre y siempre les da consejos a las demás socias. Con los dos mil quinientos soles solicitados comprará más cajas de licor para poder ofrecer una mayor cantidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Laura is a 43-year-old woman who is very happy and hard working. She lives in her own home along with her four children: Jaime, 22; Paulo, 20; Jesús and Domenica, 14; who are the motivation for all her efforts. Selling liquor is a very profitable business for Laura since the product is in high demand and her sales are always good. She tends to her home and that's also where she receives cases of liquor to sell direct from the factory. She also takes orders from distinct provinces in the region. What she most likes about her job is being able to tend to her business and also take care of her household duties at the same time. She has been doing this activity for five years and considers buying the liquor to be the most difficult part since there are many adult beverages and she has to know all the differences. For the future, she wants to have a big store where she can sell everything and not limit herself to just liquor. This is the sixth loan Laura has received from Kiva partner MFP, and she has been very punctual with her past payments and hopes to be again. She is a very happy member of her community bank and always gives advice to the other members. With the 2,500 soles loan she is requesting, she plans to buy more cases of liquor to be able to offer a wider selection to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more liquor to sell

loans.name: Chhouy

texts.en: Chhouy S. is a 47-year-old widow and mother. She was married, but divorced her husband when her four kids were young. She is a hard working woman who never wastes time in order to earn money to feed her school-aged children. She currently uses her old motorbike to pick up a variety of flowers to sell along the streets around the city. She usually makes $5 of profit a day to meet the needs of her kids, including studying fees and foods. Chhouy S. will be using a Kiva loan to accrue capital for her business of selling flowers.

loans.use: To accrue capital for selling-flowers business

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Danaya sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 28 ans et 3 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Konobougou, sous préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à des liens de voisinage et de commerce et font le commerce d’articles en vue de prendre en charge certaines dépenses de leur famille. 
Ces femmes viennent de commencer leur collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela dans le souci d’avoir constamment un appui financier pour leurs activités. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire et comptent l’utiliser pour acheter, des fruits, légumes et  une grande quantité de céréales pour la restauration. 
Les produits sont achetés sur place et  dans les villages environnants et sont revendus sur au marché et au bord du goudron à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 20 000FCFA  par mois. Les bénéfices seront partagés entre  la nourriture,  la santé et  les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group Danaya are married women who are on average 28 years old and have three children. They live with their husbands and children in large traditional families in the village of Konovougou, district of Barouéli, region of Ségou, Republic of Mali. They met through being neighbors as well as a shared interest in retail. They sell various products in order to take care of certain spending needs of their families. They women just began to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to have a constant financial support for their activities. They are on their first group loan and will use it to purchase fruits, vegetables and a large quantity of cereals/grains for restaurants. These products are purchased on site and in surrounding villages and are re-sold a the market or on the side of the road to a clientele composed of both women and men. They hope to each make a monthly profit of approximately 20,000 FCFA [approximately 45 USD] that will be spent on food, health products and other activities.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits, vegetables and cereals/grains

loans.name: Anderson

texts.es:
Nuestro socio ANDERSON pertenece al Banco Comunal “NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA” de la Asociación Arariwa de la Provincia del Cusco del Departamento del Cusco. Es conviviente, tiene 38 años y tiene dos hijos. 

El socio tiene una empresa donde alquila maquinaria pesada como cisterna de combustible y también hace el servicio de asesoria técnica en construcción de carreteras. Ya son varios años con el servicio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su labor. Nuestro socio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar equipos para el estudio de construcción de carreteras y software de maquinaria.    
  
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
ANDERSON, 38, is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA” communal bank. He lives with his life partner and has two children. He has a company that leases heavy road building equipment, like fuel tanker trucks. He also provides technical consulting in road building. He has been in this line of work for several years now and has done quite well thanks to the effort he puts into his work. He is a hard-working, enterprising father who gets his family ahead in life. He needs funding to buy road building study kits and appropriate software. He is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy road construction study kits and appropriate software.

loans.name: Adora

texts.en: Adora B. is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 56 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Adora owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP every four months. In 2005, Adora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her tenth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Afde Group No. 11

texts.fr:
L’Association des Femmes pour le Développement de l’Entreprise (AFDE) est une organisation de femmes commerçantes de petite échelle travaillant dans Thiès, une ville située à 70 Kms de Dakar. L'association a été fondée en 1993 par vingt femmes entrepreneurs pour augmenter leur pouvoir d'achat par le biais  d’une tontine (système de financement tournant dans lequel chaque membre cotise périodiquement une somme convenue et qu’on verse à tour de rôle aux différents membres). 
Cette politique ne permettant pas de financer au même jour tous les membres, elles décidèrent d’adhérer à l’IMCEC afin de s’octroyer du crédit sans des demandes de garanties. C’est ainsi que les membres sont divisés en  sous groupe de 5, avec une présidente désignée et une trésorière pour chaque sous groupe. Ces sous-groupes, au nombre de 52 en ce moment, peuvent être le même pendant de nombreuses années, mais changent souvent de membres selon le financement des besoins et d'autres considérations.
 L'AFDE organise des réunions de membre mensuellement où tous les sous groupes sont conviés et dirige une coopération pour ses membres, en leur permettant d'acheter du riz et d'autres produits à de meilleurs prix.
 L'AFDE est dirigée par une Présidente du nom de Madame Mame Diarra MAR et une trésorière Madame Ndeye Ndella Diouf toutes habitantes de Thiès. 


Madame Aïssata N. mariée et mère de 4 enfants est la présidente du sous groupe AFDE N°11. Entrée dans le commerce depuis 7 ans  par l’influence d’une amie, Madame N. âgée de 44 ans compte avec son travail augmenter le revenu familial très insuffisant afin de mieux améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants et de sa petite fille de 5 ans qu’elle a en charge depuis sa naissance. Elle vend des marchandises comme des fruits,  jujube …. Elle est dans ce sous groupe avec Madame CoumB. Laobé Bâ vendeuse de thiouraye (encens), Madame CoumB. Kanté vendeuse de charbon de bois, pâte d’arachide, huile de palme, Madame Awa S. vendeuse de produits cosmétiques et de Madame Fatou D. vendeuse de petits déjeuners. C’est dans le cadre de leur commerce qu’elles sollicitent un prêt de 500000 FCFA pour recevoir 100000 FCFA par personne.
texts.en:
The Association of Women for Business Development ( l'Association des Femmes pour le Developpement de l'Entreprise - AFDE) is an organisation of small-scale women traders who work in Thiès, a town which lies 70 kilometers from Dakar. The association was founded in 1993 by twenty female entrepreneurs in order to increase their purchasing power by means of a tontine (a revolving finance system whereby each member contributes periodically an agreed amount and these funds are passed on in rotation to different members). Since this policy does not allow for the financing of all members on the same day, they decided to join l'U-IMCEC (an association of mutual savings and loans institutions) in order to obtain a loan without being asked for guarantees. The members have thus formed sub-groups of five women, with a designated president and a treasurer for each sub-group. These sub-groups, of which there are currently 52, may remain the same for many years, but often change members in line with their needs and other considerations. The AFDE organises monthly members' meetings to which all the sub-groups are invited, and it manages a cooperative for its members, which allows them to buy rice and other products at a better price. The AFDE is run by a president whose name is Mrs. Mame Diarra MAR and a treasurer, Mrs.Ndeye Ndella Diouf, both residents of Thiès. Mrs. Aïssata N., married and mother of four children, is the president of AFDE sub-group N° 11. She has been running a business for the past seven years through the influence of a friend. Mrs. N. is 44 years old. She hopes that her activity will supplement the quite insufficient family income and improve living conditions for her children and her five-year-old grandchild she has under her care since she was born. She sells food products such as fruit, jujube, … Her sub-group also includes: • Mrs. CoumB. Laobé Bâ, who sells thiouraye (incense) • Mrs. CoumB. Kanté, who sells charcoal, peanut butter, palm oil • Mrs. Awa S., who sells beauty products, and • Mrs. Fatou D., who sells breakfasts. They are requesting a loan of 500,000 FCFA for their businesses, which will amount to 100,000 FCFA per person.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen their activities

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad, 31, who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their child, has been selling paint since 1999.  Ahmad is requesting a loan, his first from Al Majmoua, in order to purchase more paint to sell.  Ahmad is special in his work because of his skill and his variety of product offerings. His clients are his friends and neighbors, as well as other painters. He decided on this business because he wanted to have an independent job and had experience with painting. However, when he first started his enterprise, he had to face the competition. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase some paint to sell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La señora Flora es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” desde hace 2 años atrás, vive en  el distrito de Acora, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tiene 05 hijos. Ella  estudio primaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno y ovino.

Flora nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital para el desarrollo de su actividad.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar una vaca.

Su sueño para el futuro es aumentar sus ventas para así vivir mejor.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad de las socias para cada reunión.
texts.en:
Flora has been a member of the “San Pedro” Communal Bank for 2 years now. She lives in the Acora district in the province and department of Puno. She is 45 years old, married, and has 5 children. She completed her primary school education and makes a living purchasing and selling cattle and sheep. Flora tells us that her first loan from the Manuela Ramos Organization was for 300.00 soles, and it helped her to increase her capital for developing her business. She is now asking for a loan of 2,000.00 soles, which she will use to purchase a cow. Flora’s dream for the future is to increase her sales so that she can improve her standard of living. The thing Flora likes most about her communal bank is the punctuality of the members for each meeting.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a cow

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es: El señor Velásquez E. tiene 2 años de trabajar con esta institución financiera con la responsabilidad de codeudor, actualmente habita en la comarca San Miguelito, El Sauce, se dedica a la actividad agropecuaria contando con su propia finca, asimismo su ganado y tierras dedicadas a la explotación agropecuaria. Es necesario mencionar que tiene 15 años de experiencia de trabajar en las actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Mr. Velásquez E. has collaborated with this financial institution for 2 years as a co-borrower; he lives in San Miguelito, El Sauce. He is a farmer/cattleman; he has his own farm, cattle and farmlands which he uses for these activities. It must be mentioned that he has 15 years experience in the farming/cattle raising areas of expertise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two cows.

loans.name: Ablavi Hanu

texts.en: Ablavi Hanu N. is 28 years old and works in Lomé, Togo selling eggs. She is married to a carpenter and does not have children. She began her business in 2009 and is now asking for her first loan from WAGES. She will use this loan to purchase over 60 cartons of eggs. With this loan, Mrs. N. will be able to better serve her customers and continue to contribute to her family’s expenses.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs for resale.

loans.name: Suddacharige

texts.en:
Suddacharige is a 32-year-old married woman living with her husband and two sons, 10 years and 3 years old. Her husband is a tire mechanic, so she manages her business herself.

Suddacharige has a tailoring business in her area, which she started three years ago. She cooperates well with others and is always in a positive mood. She is very enthusiastic.

Suddacharige has requested a 15,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama N. goes to Techiman to buy onions in sacks for sale at Abura.  Ama has received senior high education.  She is married and takes care of five dependents. Her husband is a laborer.  She helps her husband in providing quality education for her dependents. Her loan will be used to buy more onions and tomatoes for sale. The tomatoes are going to serve as an additional vegetable to invest in. She hopes to use the new earnings from her business to reinvest back into her business. 

To be able to preserve the onions, they are spread out to allow air to circulate around them. When kept in a sack for a long time, they may rot.

loans.use: buy more onions and tomatoes for sale

loans.name: Mercuria

texts.en:
Mercuria R., 53, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. Married to Generoso R., a welder, the couple is blessed with four children. Mercuria makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her welding shop, together with her husband, for quite some time now.
Mercuria has been a regular member of Kiva partner, Center for Community Transformation (CCT), for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Her good repayment performance with her previous loans means she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her welding business.
To ensure the success of her business, Mercuria would like to apply for a loan of 30,000 PHP. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying equipment and welding materials. She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can buy her own house and lot.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy equipment and welding materials

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is married with two grown children, a son Ivan and a daughter Oksana. Lubov is a market entrepreneur from Mukachevo, Western Ukraine. She has been in the women's footwear sales business for 13 years. Lubov started with just one little stall and expanded her business to several mobile vending locations in the region. She chose this type of inventory due to stable demand for it. Lubov can be characterized as a dynamic and ambitious person. She sets challenging goals and likes to see tasks accomplished. 

Currently Lubov has 10,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. Her gross income amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas a month. Lubov is seeking an 8,000-Grivnya loan to increase assorted seasonal footwear merchandise for this summer. She is hoping to stay afloat in the competitive market despite all the gloomy economic prospects for the Ukrainian small business sector.

loans.use: To buy seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Trần's Group

texts.en:
T. Trần Thị is a 55-year-old woman who lives in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She leads a loan group which has eight members. Each receives a loan, but they all are responsible for paying back the loans of other group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of the group is Đông Mai nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01).

T. is married, has five grown children, and makes a living by running a general store. She has been in this line of work for more than 10 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from her work. In 2009, she joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business.  She has successfully repaid a loan for 5.152.000 VND which she used to buy additional products to sell.  She is applying for a new loan for 7.840.000 VND to invest in expanding her business. 

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:
1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) is 30 years old and requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to expand her retail store.

2.  Ngô Thị L. is 31 years old and requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to expand her furniture-making business.

3.  Nguyễn Thị H. is 25 years old and requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support her furniture-making business.

4.  Ngô Thị X. is 45 years sold and requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

5.  Nguyễn Thị H. is 28 years old and requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support her furniture-making business.

6.  Nguyễn Thị T. is 46 years old and requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

7.  Nguyễn Thị C. is 37 years old and requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support her food stall.

About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Trần Thị (20211010008) là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đông Mai nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại sản phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ C. dụng.


2.  Ngô Thị L. (0) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


3.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


4.  Ngô Thị X. (0) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


5.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


6.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


7.  Nguyễn Thị C. (0) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to expand a group of small businesses

loans.name: Dona Georges

texts.fr: D. Dona Georges  est né en 1975 à Aguégué, dans le département de l’Ouémé. Marié à KPATINVOH Félicienne, une coiffeuse, Georges  est père de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Georges  vit avec sa famille à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis près de huit ans. Le couple se partage les différentes charges familiales. Georges  a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Georges   vend divers produits (conserves de sardine, de tomate, lait, huile d’arachide, huile de palme, œufs, sachets, savons, pâtes alimentaires, etc.) dans sa boutique size à son domicile. Georges  exerce cette activité depuis environs cinq ans. C’est un ancien client de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu trois prêts qu’il a eu à tous bien rembourser. Georges  désire renforcer son activité et augmenter ses ventes, ce qui lui permettra d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu. C’est ce qui l’amène à solliciter auprès de ALIDé, un quatrième crédit.
texts.en:
Dona Georges D. was born in 1975 in Aguégué, in the district of Ouémé. He is married to Félicienne Kpatinvoh, a hairdresser. Georges has three children, all of whom attend school. He has lived with his family in Ekpè, in the commune of Sèmè-Podji, for eight years. The couple shares the family’s responsibilities and expenses. George stopped attending school before high school. To support his family, he sells a variety of products, such as canned sardines, tomatoes, milk, peanut and palm oil, eggs, pasta, soap and plastic bags. His boutique is located in his home. He has had this business for five years. A seasoned client of ALIDé, he has already received and repaid three previous loans. He has requested this fourth loan to strengthen his business and improve sales which will increase his income.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods for resale, such as canned sardines and tomatoes, pasta, soap and plastic bags

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: El señor Pedro José solicito un crédito anteriormente que fue para invertirlo en su negocio, Pedro tiene 52 años, el inicio hace 31 años esta actividad como es la carpintería,  aduce que su negocio ha crecido bastante, debido a que él ha sabido invertir en su negocio, ya que sus arduas horas de trabajo todos los días han dado resultado. Actualmente tiene muchos pedidos, que debido al poco capital que tiene no ha podido cumplir con sus clientes. El motivo del crédito será invertido en la compra de madera caoba, cedro, laurel, entre otros. Su sueño es llegar a tener un negocio grande distribuidor de productos de madera que venda al por mayor.
texts.en:
Señor Pedro José had a loan before and invested it in his business. Pedro is 52 years old, and started working as a carpenter 31 years ago. Since then his business has grown well, owing to his canny investment in the business and the long hours he puts in every day. He has a lot of orders at the moment, but due to a lack of capital he hasn't been able to satisfy all his customers. The loan will be used to buy wood, including mahogany, cedar and laurel. Pedro's dream is to grow his business into wholesale distributor of wooden products.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en: Ezekiel M. is thirty nine and divorced with two children aged thirteen and ten. He hopes to give his children a good education to the university level. His business is located at Mwingi town — an area served by the Thika Branch. He has been selling shoes to the local people for the last five years. He has employed one person. He says that his business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more shoes to meet his customers' demands. He sees himself as some day having shoe stores in the major towns in Kenya. He describes himself as very responsible, ambitious and social.

loans.use: To buy shoes for his store

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita M. is from the village of Bayabo East, Tumauini, Isabela. She is 27 years old. Merlita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Merlita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Merlita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Merlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Merlita is requesting another loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Merlita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.pt:
Maria Luisa D., nasceu na provincia de Maputo, casada, é mãe de 8 filhos de 16 aos 34 anos, somente 3 mais novos é que vão a Escola. Fez a 8ª clase do antigo sistema e não teve condições de dar continuidade. Vive na casa do estado com seu marido e responsabiliza se pela sua afilhada que vive com ela em sua casa.

Maria, após o divorcio do seu primeiro casamento, muda se para o Distrito de Namaacha onde teve uma proposta de trabalho e acaba fixando sua residência no mesmo Distrito. Trabalha a mais de 25 anos com a categoria de Técnica de Administração durante 8h por dia auferindo 3.612.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa. Conta com ajuda do seu marido que é seralheiro tendo iniciado a sua obra no bairro 25 de junho do mesmo Distrito, aproximando assim a hluvuku solicitando um empréstimo para dar continuidade da mesma.


Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Maria na Hluvuklu e primeiro com Kiva no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (tintas, cimento, barrotes e outros) para conclusão da sua obra. pois já passa muito tempo vivendo na casa cedida pelo estado e esta prestes a mudar se definitivamente para sua próprio residência. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros no futuro.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa was born in the province of Maputo. She is married and the mother of eight children ranging in age from 16 to 34. Only the three youngest go to school. She went to school until 8th grade (in the old system) and didn't have conditions to finish. She lives in government housing with her husband and also supports a goddaughter who lives with her. After the divorce from her first marriage, Maria moved to the Namaacha District where she had a job offer and ended up settling there. She has worked for more than 25 years as an Administrative Technician. She works eight hours a day making 3,612 meticais which she spends in household expenses. Her husband, who is a locksmith, helps her. She started construction in the "25 de junho" zone of the Namaacha District. She reached out to Hluvuku requesting a loan to continue such construction. This is Maria's third loan with Hluvuku and first with Kiva in the amount of 20,000 meticais. She intends to purchase construction materials (paint, cement, beams and others) to finish construction. She has been living in government housing for too long and is ready to move to her own home for good. She pledges to pay this loan on time in order to be able to have access to others in the future.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (paint, cement, beams and others)

loans.name: Adel

texts.ar: عادل شاب متزوج طموح، يعيش في منطقة صور مع زوجته وأولاده الثلاثة. يمل عادل سيارة فان يستخدمها في مصلحته التي يزاولها منذ العام 2000، وهي بيع القهوة، الشاي، النسكافة و الأراكيل المتجول بين قرى صور. يعمد عادل في أغلب الأوقات إلى إتخاذ مقر ثابت له يقصده فيه زبائنه المعتادون. نوعية منتجاته والنظافة في مهنته يشجع الكثير من الأشخاص، منهم الاصدقاء، الجيران وبعض السياح إلى شراء ما ينتج. سبق لعادل التعامل مع المجموعة، وهو ذات تاريخ إقتراضي جيد، وكان للقرض تاثير إيجابي على حياته، فقد حسن وضعه المادي جداً. في هذه المرة ينوي عادل إفتتاح محل لبيع الأجهزة الخليوية، بالإضافة إلى الصيانة. وذلك لزيادة مدخوله، وتحسين الوضع المادي والإجتماعي لأولاده وعائلته بالدرجة الأولى. يهدف عادل إلى توسيع نطاق عمله في المستقبل ليشمل مقهى صغير يجمع فيه زبائنه.
texts.en:
Adel is married and lives in Tyre with his wife and 3 children. He is ambitious, and is tired of his van, which he uses for the work he’s been doing since 2000; selling coffee, tea, and hookahs as a peddler, roaming from one village to the other in Tyre. Adel often settles in one location where his regular customers hang out. The quality of his product and his hygiene standards encourage many people, including friends, neighbors, and tourists, to buy his products. Adel has previously dealt with Al-Majmoua and has a good borrowing history. His previous loan had a positive impact on his life, as it significantly improved his financial situation. This time, Adel is planning to open a shop to sell and repair mobile phones, thus increasing his income and first and foremost improving the financial and social situation for his children and family. Adel aims to expand his business in the future to include a small café in which his customers can gather.

Translated from Arabic by Rebecca Saab Saade, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open a mobile phone shop

loans.name: Ganna

texts.en:
Ganna is married with a grown son and a daughter. She is an entrepreneur from Khoost in Western Ukraine. Ganna sells men’s and women’s footwear in one of the local marketplaces in her home town. She launched this venture seven years ago. Her experience and reasonable pricing policy have considerably impacted the growth of her trade. Presently, her net profit amounts to approximately $435 a month.  

Ganna is seeking a loan of 10,000 UAH to increase her assortment of merchandise and her turnover capital as a result. Ganna believes that good quality affordable merchandise will sell well among her middle class customers. Ganna can be characterized as an entrepreneur of integrity and responsibility. She is respected by both her loyal customers and fellow market vendors.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of her merchandise

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio T. is from the village of Bagong Tanza. He is 41 years old. Antonio is single and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Antonio owns & operates a business hauling junk & other waste material for local businesses and community members. Antonio has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Antonio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonio is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase used bottles and newspapers to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Antonio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay tuition fees for his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase used bottles and newspapers to sell

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.fr: G. Charlotte est née en 1974. Charlotte, analphabète, est mariée à BONOU Ado Pierre. Le couple a trois (03) enfants tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis quatre 04) ans à Gankpodo, l’un des quartiers de Cotonou, le capitale économique du Bénin. Charlotte vient en aide à son mari en assurant avec lui les différentes charges familiales. Charlotte prépare et vend de la nourriture (pâte de maïs, riz) à Agbodjêdo depuis onze (11) ans ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Charlotte achète les produits entrant dans la préparation de sa nourriture à Dantokpa , marché international du Bénin. C’est dans le cadre de l’évolution de son activité et de l’augmentation de stock de sacs de maïs, de riz que Charlotte sollicite ce troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs reçus auprès de ALIDé par Charlotte ont été bien remboursés. Charlotte enregistre parfois quelques difficultés lors de l’exercice de son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. G. Charlotte was born in 1974.  She is illiterate and is married to Mr. BONOU Ado Pierre.  The couple have three children, who are all in school.  The family has been living in Gankpodo, a district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Charlotte helps out her husband by covering along with him the different family expenses.  She has been making and selling food (cornmeal mash, rice) in Agbodjêdo for eleven years.  This enables her to support herself.  She buys the ingredients for making her food at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  

With regard to improving her business and increasing her inventory of corn and rice, she is requesting this third loan from ALIDé.  The previous loans Charlotte received from ALIDé have all been repaid.  She notes a few difficulties in operating her business.

loans.use: Buying sacks of rice and corn

loans.name: Tsevelmaa

texts.en:
Tsevelmaa J. is 57 years old and lives with her 24 year old daughter in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. She and her daughter live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her daughter is handicapped and receives a disability pension of 53,800 MNT per month.

Tsevelmaa operates a meat trading business in her town. She sells a variety of meats to her customers at a rented stall in the local market. Tsevelmaa started her business in 2000 after retiring from her career at a construction company. Her business currently operates at a stable level and she continues to make progress.

She hopes to grow her business in the future and her continued success is very important as she must support her daughter, who is disabled. Tsevelmaa is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat at a wholesale price.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza D. is from the village of Bangahan, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 56 years old. Esperanza is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Esperanza owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling breads & pastries, such as otap & piaya, in the local community. Esperanza has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Esperanza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Esperanza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Esperanza is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw ingredients & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Esperanza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw ingredients & working capital.

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en: Sourn T. is a married woman whose daily routine includes making baske. Sourn T. and her husband must buy raw materials to make baskets to sell at the market. They also buy baskets from other weavers at a reasonable price and resell them to gain extra profits. They have done this since 1985. Sourn T. is a mother who has only a child who is still in public school. In order to get additional income, Sourn T. will be using her loan to purchase more baskets to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for her basket selling business.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica tiene 22 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde que era niña se ha dedicado a la agricultura, desde entonces aprendió todas las técnicas agrarias, hoy junto a su esposo cultivan papa; asimismo cría y venden animales menores como: cuyes, de las cuales son vendidas en las ferias ganaderas de su zona. Ella considera rentable, la venta de cuyes, pues obtiene ingresos mas frecuente; ya que para obtener los beneficios que le deja la agricultura debe esperar meses para poder cosechar sus productos. Por lo pronto seguirá intensificándose en la siembra, así como aumentar la cantidad de animales que tiene actualmente. Es el crédito número 2 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono, asimismo contratará peones para que le ayuden en la siguiente campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Angélica, 22, lives with her husband and two children in her own house.  Since she was a little girl she has been farming; she learned all the farming techniques back then.  Today, together with her husband, she grows potatoes and also raises small farm animals like, guinea pigs that are sold at the local livestock markets in her area.  She considers guinea pig sales profitable because income is more frequent whereas she has to wait several months until harvest time to get benefits from farming.  For the time being, she will continue to strengthen her crops as well as increase the number of animals she has.

This is her loan #2 from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  Besides, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are responsible, mutually supportive people she knows.

She thanks all the people who will fund the loan she’s requesting which will be very useful for her business’ progress.  She will use it to buy sacks of manure as well as hire laborers to help her with the next planting cycle.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and hire laborers to take charge of the planting.

loans.name: God Gee Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “God Gee” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva to apply for a loan of SLL 1,000,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Hawa C. is the leader of this group. The twenty-two -year-old is married to a businessman and they have one child. Hawa has been a businesswoman for five years now; she sells palm-oil and rice. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: Buys palm-oil and rice at wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang H. is a 30-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Chhnang Province. She is married to Chan Nimal, age 32.  They have 5 children, all of whom are single.  One of them is a sewing worker and has a salary of about $70 per month.

Hang H. has a plot of farm land where she grows rice.  Her husband has been earning a living for many years by climbing the palm trees in and around his community (to collect oil). Palm-tree-climbing jobs are very common for the poor.  This family currently generates an income of approximately $3.75 per day. 

Due to the fact that rice harvesting season is coming, Hang H. has decided to seek a loan from Kiva to buy more rice while rice is commanding its lowest price. TH. she will sell it later wH. the price increases.

loans.use: To stock up rice while prices are low for later resale.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Hajara has a small retail shop, which she has run for one year.
To help expand her business, Hajara has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sugar and maize flour for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Hajara hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to become a doctor after completing her studies.
Hajara is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her positive behaviors.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar and maize flour for resale

loans.name: Mujeres Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres” nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, se fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
La Sra. Celia N., presidenta del grupo tiene 35 años, ella está domiciliada en San Lorenzo, es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y por sobretodo muy optimista. Ella se dedica al corte y la confección, por eso desea invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de telas, tul, hilos, agujas y todos los materiales necesarios en su rubro.
texts.en:
The communal Bank “Women” was born with the support of another communal bank that was working in the same place.

This committee is from the city of San Lorenzo, and set as their main goal that each member will grow in their businesses. They are well-known in the area as hardworking women.

Mrs. Celia N. is the president of the group, she is 35 years old and lives in San Lorenzo, she is an enterprising woman, hardworking and above all a very optimistic person. She cuts and makes clothing and wishes to use the loan to buy fabrics, tulle, threads, needles, and all the materials needed for her work.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, appliqués for clothes, threads, tulle, etc.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy N., aged 48, is a single mother of two children, Evelyn, aged 19 and in college, and Selmith, aged 16, in high school. She runs a quarry stone business as her primary business located at Lukenya quarry site. Her business of three years gives her a monthly profit of Kshs 10,000.

She was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office. This is her first loan with KADET LTD and she plans to use it to purchase quarry equipment and tools such as a cutting machine.

She hopes to get good returns which she will use to buy another quarry space. Nancy describes herself as hard-working and ambitious.

loans.use: To purchase quarry equipment and tools such as a cutting machine.

loans.name: Humberto Antonio

texts.es: Humberto Antonio tiene 39 años, por lo que su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de transporte de taxi. Hace más de 4 años, que se dedica a este negocio por lo que inicio con esfuerzos propios, por lo que tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, el se encarga de proporcionarle lo más necesario a toda su familia. Pues sus inicios fueron muy duros ya algunas veces como no tenía el capital suficiente, su automóvil no presentaba las condiciones necesarias. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de llantas, baterías, tapizado, entre otros arreglos. El sueña con tener otro vehículo que presente mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Humberto Antonio is 39 years old.  His business is providing a taxi service.  He has been in this business, which he started through his own efforts, for four years.  Humberto has 2 children in his care and he is in charge of providing for his whole family's most basic needs.  Initially things were very hard as sometimes he didn't have enough capital and so his car wasn't in a good condition.  He is requesting this loan to use as working capital.  He plans to buy tires, batteries, upholstery and to make some other repairs.  He dreams of owning another vehicle which is in better condition.

loans.use: to buy tires, batteries, upholstery and to make some other repairs

loans.name: Flor De Illimani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE ILLIMANI” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y tiene como presidenta a la señora Graciela.   Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos comercio, producción y servicio

La señora Graciela, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que participa por primera ves en una asociación comunal y en Pro Mujer. En la actualidad la tiene un negocio de orfebrería que trabaja hace 5 años, que aprendio mediante su mamá

El crédito que sacará ahora es para la compra material (plata piña), el que comprara de la joyería Leticia y venderá los fines de semana. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos. 

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y salud.
texts.en:
The “FLOR DE ILLIMANI” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo II Focus Center.  It has 8 members and Graciela is President.  The businesses of the women are varied.  Among them are commerce, production and services.

Graciela, communal bank President, states that this is the first time she’s participated in a communal bank and in Pro Mujer.  She has had a silversmith business that she learned from her mother for five years.

She will use the loan to buy pure silver from Leticia Jewelry Store that she will resell weekends.  This method of working allows her to earn income to support her family since she’s married and has two children.

When she’s asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers that she likes the training and the health services.

loans.use: to buy pure silver.

loans.name: Chim's Group

texts.en:
There are 18 people in this village bank loan group. Mrs. Chim was selected by the group members to be the village bank president. 

Mrs. Chim is 28 years old and single. She is a fisherwoman who is able to earn a small income.  In order to improve her standard of living, she is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy piglets for breeding and pig food.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for breeding and pig food

loans.name: Keun

texts.en:
Mrs. Keun S. (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Sarorn Prom, have been married since 1980 and have five children, four sons and one daughter. Three of their children are married and live in separate homes, one is a construction worker and the fifth is in school. The family lives along national road number two, about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Keun is a garment factory worker and her husband is a soldier. She is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for her son to get to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her son to get to work.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is from the village of Lunao, Gingoog City. She is 65 years old. Erlinda is widowed and has six adult children. Erlinda sells clothing & shoe products from Natasha & Avon in her community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2006, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 5000 PHP and was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. 

This loan will be her fifth from HSPFI. Erlinda is requesting 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like blouses & t-shirts. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI: 

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like blouses & t-shirts

loans.name: Cresila

texts.en:
Cresila is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Cresila has a retail shop that sells canned goods, junk foods, biscuits, beverages & detergents. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional canned goods, junk foods & beverages.

Cresila is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Cresila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, junk foods & beverages

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea is 32 years old; his wife, Mon, is 31 years old. They live in a village off National Road number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1999 and have three daughters. All of them are in school.  

Sophea sells kitchenware. He buys kitchenware from Phnom Penh market and sells in other places around Phnom Penh. His wife grows vegetables. Sophea is asking for a loan of $1,000 to expand his business by buying additional kitchenware for sale.   

Photo: Sophea and his wife.

loans.use: To expand his business by buying additional kitchenware for sale.

loans.name: Chuchi

texts.en:
Chuchi is 45 years old and married with four children. Chuchi works very hard to provide for them.

Chuchi runs a sari-sari variety store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Chuchi has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as rice, feeds and other groceries. 

In the future, Chuchi would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
La comunidad D. Papel Pata se encuentra a unos treinta minutos D. la ciudad principal D. La Convención (Quillabamba). 

En la comunidad D. Papel Pata conocimos a la señora Eva y ella nos cuenta que nació en la ciudad D. Huyro y que tiene 44 años D. edad, ella esta casada y fruto D. esta relación tiene seis hijos D. las cuales cuatro son independientes y dos todavía depenD. D. ella.  Actualmente, Eva vive en la comunidad D. Papel Pata y donD. desarrolla sus actividades económicas.  

Eva se dedica a la agricultura específicamente a la siembra D. cacao, café, naranja y otras cosas mas, ella lleva sus productos a la ciudad D. Quillabamba para vender a las personas que se encargan D. revender en la ciudad del Cusco. Eva también tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes en su domicilio, ella desD. las 5 D. la mañana abre la tienda para vender sus productos y permanece abierto el local hasta las 9 D. la noche. Eva en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, y otras cosas más.  

El banco comunal “Caminando Juntos” pertenece a la Asociación Arariwa (Cusco, Perú) y las reuniones D. los socios son cada treinta días en la comunidad D. Papel Pata del distrito D. Echarate provincia D. La Convención  del departamento del Cusco. (La comunidad D. Papel Pata esta ubicado a unos 45 minutos D. la ciudad D. Quillabamba).
texts.en:
The community of Papel Pata is located some 30 minutes from the main city in La Convención (Quillabamba).

The community of Papel Pata is where you would find Ms. Eva, who tells Asociación Arariwa that she was born in the city of Huyro and is 44 years old. She is married and has six children from her marriage, four of whom are independent. The other two are still dependent on her. Currently, Eva lives and carries out her economic activities in the community of Papel Pata.

Eva works in agriculture. More specifically, she plants cocoa, coffee, oranges, and other crops. She brings her products to the city of Quillabamba, where she sells them to people whose job it is to resell the products in the city of Cusco. Eva also has a small grocery store in her house. She opens the store at five in the morning in order to sell her products, and she remains open until nine at night. At this time, Eva needs a loan to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, and other items.

The "Caminando Juntos" ["Walking Together"] communal bank belongs to Asociación Arariwa (in Cusco, Perú). The group members meet every thirty days in the community of Papel Pata, which is in the district of Echarte, province of La Convención, and department of Cusco. (The community of Papel Pata is located some 45 minutes from the city of Quillabamba).

loans.use: to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, and other items

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 35 years old. She is a married woman with a 14-year-old child. She has been a rice farmer for 12 years. Her earnings from farming allowed her to start a sari-sari store. She sells canned goods and other various products to the people in her community.

Julieta is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, and other farm supplies. She hopes to achieve an abundant harvest. She also hopes for her child to finish college and have a bright future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Norayr

texts.en: Norayr is 49 years old; he lives in Ddmashen village, Sevan area, with his wife and his son. Norayr’s son is now serving in the Armenian, and Norayr’s wife works as a nurse at an out-patient clinic. Norayr graduated from Yerevan Veterinary Institut and has worked as a veterinarian at his native village for about 25 years. Simultaneously with his work as a veterinarian he has been engaging in farming since 1992. Norayr’s wife helps him on farm and together they breed cows, sheep, and pigs. Norayr sells to Sevan market’s sellers, and thus keeps his family. This is Norayr’s second loan from Nor Horizon and he is asking for 600.000 AMD to buy 5 or 6 sheep, some piglets, and also fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy 5 or 6 sheep, some piglets, and animal feed

loans.name: Crema

texts.en:
Crema works hard to support her family. She is married and has a shell crafting business in the Philippines.

Crema requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her shell crafting business. She has been in this business for 16 years.

Crema would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her shell crafting business

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Channa (shown in the photo) is a weaver, while her husband, Phalla, is a blacksmith. They have been married since 2002 and have two sons. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  
Channa is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Matola, provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 2 filhos que frequentam a escola. Fez o nivel medio e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta os pais enviando dinheiro para axiliar nas dispesas. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é comerciante e modista ha mais de 10 anos e tem um rendimendo de cerca de 12.000.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 16.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar tecidos para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Pretende solicitar mais valor para comprar uma maquina de corte e cose, para ampliar a sua actividade comercial ,irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Lidia was born in the city of Matola, in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique. She is single and the mother of two children, who go to school. She attended school through middle school but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. She lives in her own home with her family and also supports her parents financially, sending them money to help with their expenses.

She's never left Matola. She's had a shop for more than ten years and earns 12,000 meticals a month. She uses her salary for household expenses and is able to save a small amount in her bank account.
She has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 16,000 meticals, which she will use to buy clothing to increase the quantity of merchandise she carries.
She hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to buy a sewing machine to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mendsaikhan

texts.en: Mr.Mendsaikhan is 33 years old. He lives with his wife and two children. He has been working at a window and door manufacturing company for 15 years. He has plenty of experience, and has started to produce doors and windows by himself. With his commitment and experience, the demand for his product is growing rapidly. He needs a vehicle to deliver the windows and doors, so that he can earn his customers’ satisfaction and loyalty. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a mini truck.

loans.use: To purchase a mini truck for deliveries

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La señora valentina tiene 28 años D. edad, está casada con el señor Adrián, tienen 3 hijos Eva, José y rosario, quienes estudian, la mayor está cursando el primer año D. secundaria, los más pequeños segundo y quinto año D. primaria, se dedica a la venta D. pollos y refrescos, desD. hace mas D. 3 años, para tener un poco mas surtido su negocio.
Ella decidió iniciar con este negocio, buscando apoyar a su esposo con los gastos D. la casa y a su familia, también para mejorar un poco mas su solvencia económica, así asegurar el futuro y educación D. sus hijos, el crédito que recibió decidió invertirlo en la compra D. pollo, refrescos, aguas y jugos.
El deseo más granD. que tiene doña valentina para su negocio, es D. incrementar su inversión, para hacerlo crecer rápidamente, ya que quisiera poner una pollería, para así mejorar e incrementar aún más sus ganancias, y continuar apoyando a su familia.
Esta muy satisfecha por contar con el apoyo D. los donadores D. kiva, ya que gracias a esto ahora goza D. una mejor producción y surtido en el negocio, que le ayuda, para continuar ahorrando parte D. sus ganancias, puesto que así asegurara la educación superior D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
Valentina is 28 years old and married to Adrián.  They have three children, Eva, José and Rosario, who are all in school.  The eldest is in her first year of high school and the two younger children are in the second and fifth year of elementary school.  Valentina's business is selling chickens and soft drinks.  She has been in this business for more than three years and would like to better stock her business.  She decided to start working in this business as she wanted to support her husband with their household and family expenses.  She also wanted to improve their financial situation a little more so that they could guarantee their children's future and education.  Valentina invested the loan that she received in buying chicken, soft drinks, water and juice.

Valentina's biggest wish for her business is to increase her investment so that she can make it grow quickly as she would like to set up a poultry store so that she can improve and increase her profits even further and continue supporting her family.

Valentina is very happy that she can count on the support of Kiva lenders because, thanks to this, her business is now more productive and better stocked.  She is also able to continue saving some of her profits so that she can guarantee her children's higher education.

loans.use: to buy chicken, soft drinks, water and juice

loans.name: Claris

texts.en:
Claris is a 36-year-old businesswoman from Mtopanga, Mombasa. She is married and a mother of four children. She runs a tailoring business which has been in operation for the past year. 

Claris was recently introduced to KADET LTD, and this marks her first borrowing to finance her business. 

She plans to purchase cloth, thread, buttons, and zippers into her business. Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, thread, buttons, and zippers

loans.name: Llerme

texts.es: Llerme tiene 43 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora. Esta separada de su pareja pero vive en compañía de su pequeño hijo en la casa de su padre. La actividad que realiza Llerme es la venta de abarrotes en general, para lo cual cuenta con una bodega instalada en casa de su padre, ahí atiende a sus vecinos, de una manera muy amable y cordial. Tiene dos años dedicándose a esta actividad, y en todo este tiempo su hijo mayor es quien más lo apoyado en el negocio. En un incio su negocio lo realizaba en diversos lugares, hasta que abrió su bodega. Para ella, este negocio es rentale, gracias a ello puede ayudar en la economía de su hogar. Este sería el crédito número dos con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida con la oportunidad que le dan. Con el monto solicitado, compará más productos al por mayor como: azúcar, leches, arroz , huevos.
texts.en:
Llerme is 43 years old.  She is a cheerful and hard-working woman who is separated from her partner and lives together with her young son in her father's house.  Llerme's business is selling groceries.  She has a store in her father's house and there she serves her neighbors in a very kind and friendly manner.  She has been in this business for two years and, during this time, her eldest son is the person who has supported her the most in her business.  She used to carry out her business in a number of different places before she opened her store.  For Llerme, this business is profitable and it enables her to help towards her household finances.

This will be Llerme's second loan from MFP.  She feels grateful for the opportunity that she is being given.  She will use the sum she has requested to buy more products wholesale such as sugar, milk, rice and eggs.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, rice and eggs

loans.name: Emy

texts.en:
Emy is 34 years old and lives in Basac, Larena, Siquijor.  She is married and has two children. Emy is engaged in the purchasing of coconut and charcoal to earn a living. She has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of work.  

She has requested a loan amounting to 25,000 PHP  to purchase coconuts and charcoal to sell.

Emy has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for five months.  She hopes to grow her business and to have more customers. She hopes that she will have more savings for her children's future education.

loans.use: To purchase coconuts and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Busena

texts.en:
Busena is 30 year old a married woman with three children between the age of 9-3 year. All of them are in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan for four years.
Busena requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Urbano

texts.en:
Urbano is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has seven children. 

Urbano has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Urbano has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Urbano hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
This is Eden, 53, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Wilfredo. He is her business partner and father to her only child. Eden, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Eden operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Eden earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Eden hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Nahun

texts.es:
Nahun, de 31 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y con muchos deseos de superación. Convive con Segundina quien es ama de casa, fruto de esa unión tienen dos hijos de 9 y 4 años de edad, a los que quiere mucho, habitando su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Nahun es la agricultura para eso cuenta con un terreno de 20 hectáreas de extensión que compró hace 8 años tiempo que viene dedicándose a ésta actividad. producto que es comercializado en los mercados de su localidad. Asimismo cuenta con el apoyo de dos peones para las labores de siembra y cosecha, pagándoles un jornal de 20 nuevos soles por día a cada uno. Le gusta su actividad pues lo considera rentable ya que le ha permitido tener un ingreso económico para mantener a su familia, comenta que escogió éste oficio por la necesidad económica y la necesidad de tener un oficio. Ahora con la agricultura se siente cómodo y contento pues lo considera rentable, viendo más alternativas de cultivos. Tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y sembrar más extensiones de yuca ya que tiene bastante demanda. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, comenta sentirse agradecido por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo para alcanzar sus objetivos. 
Con el monto solicitado de 1000  nuevos soles, tiene planes de invertir en el sembrio de 01 hectárea más de yuca para poder atender la demanda que tiene este producto, por ello comprará semillas de yuca.
texts.en:
Nahun, age 31, is a hard-working man with a great desire to succeed. He lives with Segundina, who is a housewife. They live in their own home with their two children ages 4 and 9, whom they love very much. Nahun works in agriculture and has a 20-hectare plot of land which he bought eight years ago when he started farming. He sells his produce in the local markets. Two labourers help him with the sowing and harvest, and he pays them each 20 Nuevos Soles per day. He enjoys his work because it is profitable and allows him to have an income to support his family. He says that he chose this line of work out of economic need and the need to have a job. He is happy and comfortable with his job. He has a lot of selection in what he can plant, and therefore it is profitable for him. This will be his fourth loan with MFP. He tells us that he is grateful for this financial support so that he can achieve his goals.
With the requested 1000 Nuevos Soles, he plans to invest in sowing one more hectare of cassava in order to take advantage of this product's demand. In order to do so, he will buy cassava seeds.

loans.use: to buy cassava seeds.

loans.name: Jacquline

texts.en:
Jacquline is 43 years old and has been farming for 15 years in her home area of Muranga in Central Kenya. She is married and has two children, ages 16 and 13, who both attend school. Her farm currently produces coffee and vegetables for the local market.
