Jacquline has made a 63,600 KES loan request with Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says she will save the income to ensure the children are educated. She is focusing on having four dairy cows to produce more than 100 litres of milk per day.

She says the challenge to her business is fluctuating milk prices. She remains optimistic with the business prospects.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Monica Luz

texts.es:
Monica es una mujer de 37 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su menor hija, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella siempre ha sido padre y madre para su hijo; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Monica no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Pedagogía que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta preparar deliciosos postres y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Monica trabaja como empleada del hogar, realizando labores de lavado, limpieza y cuidados del hogar, adicionalmente también prepara pasteles y tortas para su venta, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, Monica se siente a gusto trabajando y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Monica se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una computadora, la cual le servirá de mucho para que su hija pueda mejorar sus métodos de estudios y también realice sus trabajos académicos, de esta manera Monica desea brindarle una buena educación a su hija y poco a poco gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo desea lograr su gran sueño de ver a su hija convertida en una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Monica is a 37 year old woman. She lives in the city of Ica, in the Parcona district with her youngest child, who she loves and who is her main reason for living. 

She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person, who devotes all her efforts to raising her family. She has always been the father and mother for her son. 

Unfortunately, because of a lack of economic resources and out of the need to work from a very young age, Monica was not able to study the professional career of pedagogy that she wanted to. In her free time, she likes to prepare delicious desserts, and on some occasions she cooks a tasty duck rice dish to share with her family.

By her own initiative, with much effort and dedication, Monica works as a housekeeper, performing tasks of washing, cleaning and taking care of the house. Additionally, she also prepares pies and cakes to sell. She works every day from the early hours of  the morning, and can do it for approximately 10 hours. Monica feels comfortable working and believes she does well because of her responsibility and the kind treatment she offers to others.

Monica feels very grateful for the Kiva loans, and thanks to the help provided, she will be able to purchase a computer. This will serve her very much, so that her son can improve his methods of studying and also complete his academic work. Thus, Monica wishes to provide her son with a good education. Little by little, thanks to her work and effort, she hopes to succeed in her great dream of seeing her son become a good professional.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Amahoriwacu Group

texts.fr:
Caritas  fait partie du groupe  Amahorowicu et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 42 ans et est mariée à P. Claver, un  commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 6 à 20 ans, tous  3 étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de  bananes et  de poissons (ndagara) depuis  11 ans. 

Elle est à son cinquième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de banane et  de poissons (ndagara) à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Caritas is part of the group Amahorowicu and lives in Gitega. She is 42 years old and married to P. Claver, a merchant. Together they have five children, from 6 to 20 years old, of whom three are students. 

Caritas has been doing commerce in bananas and fish (ndagara) for eleven years.

She is on her 5th Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of bananas and fish (ndagara) to resell, so as to earn more.

loans.use: to purchase a large amout of bananas and fish (ndagara) to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Norma Leticia

texts.en:
My name is Norma A.. I sell a great variety of women\'s shoes. I have had my business for three years. My sales are done by order. My clients are my neighbors and coworkers. My business generates enough profit to support my family. My goal is to increase my profits in order to remodel my home and pay for my daughter\'s education.

Loan Use: This loan will be used to purchase shoes, sandals and slippers

Mi nombre es Norma A. me dedico a la venta de zapatos para damas en gran variedad, tengo mi negocio hace hace 3 años, mis ventas son por encargos y mis clientes son mis vecinos y mis compañeros de trabajo, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener mayores ventas y asi poder remodelar mi casa y dale estudio a mi hija.

loans.use: Compra de Zapatos , sandalias, chancletas,

loans.name: Firudin

texts.en: Firudin M. owns a small gas station in the town of Khachmaz located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Firudin is looking for funding so that he can invest in a cover for his one pump gas station. He knows that people will pass his gas station when it is raining in order to go to another gas station that has a cover. He feels that a cover will increase his business and therefore his profit.

loans.use: To invest in a cover for his gas station

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Mrs. Queen O. is 39 years old, with seven (7) children. She sells fire wood to her community. She wishes to borrow $400 for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more firewoods for sales

loans.name: Merida

texts.es:
Merida is married, 36 years old, and has five children. Her husband works in the fields harvesting corn. She makes shopping bags called “Morraletas: which she sells near the marketplace of the city of San Cristobal. She belongs to the group “Chijilte 7”. The other group members are: Maria del Socorro Gonzales (who sells Morraletas), Cecilia Ines Hernandez G. (who makes and sells Morraletas), and Carolina Elizabeth Hernandez (who sells candies from her home). Merida, Maria and Cecelia will buy plastics (the material the use to manufacture the Morraletas) and would to change the basis where they weave the bags. Carolina will buy a larger assortment of sweets to sell with the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

MERIDA ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 5 HIJOS Y 36 AÑOS DE EDAD , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO EN LA COSECHA DEL MAIZELLA SE DEDICA A CONFECCIONAR BOLSAS DE COMPRAS (MORRALETAS ) Y LAS VENDE EN LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL EN LAS CERCANIAS DEL MERCADO. PERTENECE AL GRUPO CHIJILTE 7 . LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON : MARIA DEL SOCORRO GONZALEZ ( VENDE MORRALETAS ), CECILIA INES HERNANDEZ G. ( HACE Y VENDE MORRALETAS )Y CAROLINA ELIZABETH HERNANDEZ ( VENDE DULCES EN SU CASA ) MERIDA ,MARIA Y CECILIA VAN A COMPRAR PLASTICOS (QUE ES EL MATERIAL CON EL QUE CONFECCIONAN LAS MORRALETAS ) Y MADERAS PARA CAMBIAR LAS BASES DONDE TEJEN LAS BOLSAS . Y CAROLINA CON EL PRESTAMO COMPRARA MAS VARIEDAD DE DULCES PARA VENDER.

loans.use: To sell bags

loans.name: Hosiat

texts.en:
Hosiat is a pretty businesswoman. She is the mother of 5 children. She started her business in 1995, after the collapse of the USSR. Her little salary was not enough for supporting such a big family, and she decided to trade perfumes in the open-air place near the big shop in Ckalovsk, Khujand.

In the beginning she had a limited number of goods on the one table. It was a difficult time for her because she did not have any clients. Gradually she expanded her assortment and attracted many clients. Due her creative nature and sociable personality, she could find distributors of famous firms as Oriflame, Dove, Garineer and Kalina and concluded agreements with them for a long partnership. Today she has her own shop in Chkalovsk; additionally, she rented one stall of soft drinks for her daughter for the summer season. Now Hosiat wishes to buy this stall, and in the winter she wants to trade coffee and some kind of cakes here.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 25-year-old single, hardworking man who is paying school fees for his two younger sisters, who are now his responsibility. One is doing her ‘O’ level exams this year and the other is enrolled at a college in Nairobi known as K.C.C.T. Apart from his two sisters, his aging diabetic mother also depends on him in taking care of her medical needs.

Robert started saving money when he was still employed as a clerk at the Metropolitan Hospital in the city of Nairobi. This was in the year 2005; through hard work, sacrifice, and determination, Robert managed to save Ksh 200,000 (USD 3075). With this money he bought two computers, a printer and a scanner; with the remaining money, he rented a stall in the heart of the town centre. He then started operating his computer bureau business in the year 2006, where he provides services in processing documents. Robert is always busy due to the location of his business, and he has managed to attract a large clientele.

In recent times, he has had an increase in the number of customers who need to get photocopies of documents. Unfortunately, Robert has been unable to fulfill their needs, since he lacks a photocopying machine. Robert is therefore kindly requesting a loan of USD 775 so that he can purchase a photocopier. This will greatly boost his business since he will be able to provide photocopying services to his clients who are in great need of this service. Robert intends to repay the loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To purchase a photocopier machine

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel is a 35 year old widow who owns her own home. After losing her husband in an accident more than 10 years ago, Isabel took over his shop.

Thanks to her creativity, ingenuity, and hard work, she has been able to overcome all of the obstacles that have come up over time. The shop is now prosporus, and busy.

She is asking for this loan to purchase angle iron, elastic bands, and metal bars, etc.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Isabel de 53 años de edad, es viuda, y tiene casa propia. Luego de perder a su esposo en un accidente hace más de 10 años Isabel tomo el mando del taller que tenía su marido.

Gracias a la creatividad, el ingenio y las ganas de trabajar, logró superar todos los inconvenientes que se le presentaron a lo largo del tiempo. En la actualidad el taller es prosperó y los trabajos realizados en él son constantes.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de planchuelas, centro elásticos y varillas de hierro, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of angle iron, elastic bands, and metal bars.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
For the last twenty years, Mrs. Juanita M. has been selling basic grains in the city of Chinandega. She is a woman worthy of being imitated for after not being able to cover the expenses of her home being a housewife, she used her savings of about USD $100, which she had for emergencies, and started her business.

CEPRODEL has supported Mrs. Juanita, facilitating loans to her for the last two years. In spite of the strong competition in her type of business, her results have been improving and therefore it has been proposed to continue granting her credit. With these loans she can be able to reach her goal of being the best merchant in her business. She has obtained a total of 11 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 20 años en la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Juanita M. se dedica a la venta de granos básicos. Es una mujer digna de imitar por el hecho de que primeramente inició como ama de casa pero lastimosamente este negocio no cubría las necesidades de su hogar. Por este motivo decidió utilizar un ahorro de U$ 100 que guardaba para cualquier emergencia y de aquí nació su negocio.

CEPRODEL ha apoyado a la señora Juanita realizándole préstamos desde hace dos años y a pesar de la fuerte competencia en su negocio ha comenzado a ver mejores resultados por lo que se ha propuesto continuar con estos créditos para lograr alcanzar sus sueños de ser la mejor comerciante en el negocio. Ella ha realizado un total de 11 créditos.

loans.use: Sales of basic grains

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Đỗ Thị Phương, 40 years old, is one of the few members in the neighborhood who have favorable conditions running a business. Right from the day she joined TYM fund, she invested in a business selling pork, pork sausages, knuckes of ham. After a few years, her business has expanded. She now supplies to local restaurants as well as in neighboring areas. She has a lot of customers coming to her shop buying pork and take out food. Her income is quite stable. She has members from her family working for her as well as some of the women from her neighborhood. She is very busy but she always participates in her group activities. Her husband is very supportive of her. They have a 12 years old son. She wishes to remain a loyal TYM member for the years to come. This time she requests a loan of 1200 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đỗ Thị Phương, 40 tuổi, là một trong số ít thành viên trong cụm có điều kiện thuận lợi cho việc kinh doanh, buôn bán. Ngay từ khi mới tham gia Quỹ chị đã đầu tư vào việc buôn bán thịt lợn, quay giò, làm chả. Qua nhiều năm vay vốn đầu tư có hiệu quả, gia đình chị Phương đã mở rộng việc kinh doanh sản xuất nem, giò chả tiêu thụ cho khách hàng trong vùng và các vùng lân cận. Quán của chị có uy tín với mọi người nên lúc nào cũng đông khách đặt và mua hàng mang lại thu nhập rất ổn định. Do công việc nhiều nên anh chị phải thuê thêm nhân công, gồm anh em ruột thịt và một số chị em thành viên trong cụm, giúp cho chị em có việc làm và thêm thu nhập. Công việc tuy nhiều nhưng chị Phương vẫn luôn tích cực tham gia các công việc chung của cụm, chồng chị rất hiểu và tạo điều kiện cho chị. Anh chị mới có một cháu trai 12 tuổi. Chị luôn mong muốn được vay vốn lâu dài từ Quỹ, mức vay cho vòng vốn tới chị đề nghị là 1200USD.

loans.use: Buy pork, make pork sausages, ham

loans.name: Lutfillo

texts.en:
M. Lutfillo is 35 years old. He is married with four children. Lutfillo is a farmer. He produces agricultural crops like tomatoes, watermelons, wheat and others. He has been working the land for five years. When there is a hot season, his wife and the children help him in the field as you can see in the picture.

Each year Lutfillo grows crops sufficient for family consumption and for selling. Generating a stable income, Lutfillo is able to support his large family.

Today he requests 2000.00 Somoni (US$600.00) for the term of nine months. The loan shall be used for purchasing seeds and fertilizer. Lutfillo thanks everyone supporting him and promises to be accurate in the loan payment.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Narida

texts.en: Narida A. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan. She has lived with her family in Beylagan since 1993. She is 49 years old, married and has four children. She raises chickens in her yard and sells them in the Beylagan city bazaar. She has been engaged in this business more than seven years. She has applied to the Normicro Beylagan Branch for a KIVA loan of $400. She plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is married and has two children, ages 25 and 18. She owns a small restaurant and also earns money selling charcoal; she started this business in 2003. Every day, Hadija works from 6 am to 8 pm and can earn a monthly profit of about US$250 from the sales.

She now hopes to receive a loan to buy more charcoal and to increase the stock of goods for her restaurant business.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal and a stock of goods for a restaurant

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis is a young farmer who grows star fruit, a delicious fruit found in the jungles of his country. He started his farm with the help of his beloved siblings. Because of his labor of love and his many future goals for his family’s well-being, he would like to increase his work capital.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Luis, es un joven agricultor que se dedica a la producción de carambolas, exquisito fruto de la selva de su país. Incursionó en esta labor con la importante ayuda de sus queridos hermanos y debido a que tiene gran amor por su labor y muchas metas a futuro en bienestar de su familia desea incrementar su capital de trabajo.

loans.use: Increase capital to raise production

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia Y. De H., “Flor Del Cafe” community bank member, lives in the San Martín region, Moyabamba province, Soritor district, and her business is located in her house at 260 Jr Fray Martín in an environment especially equipped for the type of work she does, which is producing and wholesaling starch and its derivatives. She decided to go into business to help her husband pay the household expenses, manage her own income and be independent. Now she is the one sustaining the household by sending her product to the coast and keeping her regional customers supplied. Virginia will use the $500.00 loan, which she will pay back in four months, to buy sacks of yuca, which is the main element used in her production, and she will buy corrugated steel used for drying the starch and other production materials she needs so that she can meet her customers’ needs. Virginia is 59 years old and lives with her husband, who supports her in her work. She is very happy with what she is doing because it has opened up many opportunities. Her goal is to build up the business and hire people to help her in her work.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Virginia Y. De H., socia del Banco Comunal “Flor Del Cafe” vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de Moyabamba distrito de Soritor, su negocio se ubica en su propia casa, en el Jr Fray Martín Nro 260 en un ambiente acondicionado especialmente para este tipo de trabajo, se dedica la elaboración y venta de almidón y sus derivados al por mayor. Decidió iniciar en el negocio para poder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y así manejar sus propios ingresos y ser una persona independiente ya que por el momento ella es el sustento de su hogar, envía su producto a la costa así como también abastece a clientes de la región El crédito de S/. 500.00, el cual será devuelto en 4 meses comprará sacos de yuca, que es el elemento principal en su actividad, también invertirá en la compra de calaminas para el secado del almidón y otros materiales necesarios para la elaboración de esta producto, y así poder atender a su exigente clientela. Tiene 59 años, vive con su esposo quien le apoya en su trabajo, esta muy contenta con lo que hace por que le abrió muchas oportunidades, su meta es crecer en el negocio y así también poder dar trabajo a personas quienes la apoyan en esta labor.

loans.use: To buy corrugated steel and wholesale yuca

loans.name: Anna's Harakati Group

texts.en:
Anna is a married woman with 2 children aged 10 and 7. She became a caterer in 2008. Every day, she works from 9am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

In the past, Anna has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Anna now hopes for a loan to buy dishes and chairs for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with clothes and vegetable sales.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Señor De Acoria Group

texts.es:
The community of Acoria is a neighborhood in the Acoria district of the region of Huancavelica, the poorest region in Peru, located at an altitude of 2880 meters above sea level. The principal activities of the local people are agriculture, livestock production and commerce. The district is accessible through the Huancayo - Huancavelica railroad line.

Olga Corso is a single mother with 3 children, aged 3, 10 and 17; two of her children are in school. Her business is food sales; she has been in the business for 10 years. Initially she wanted to study but she did not have the support of her family. Then, with the birth of her children she had to go to work selling candy. Olga is requesting a loan for 400 soles (Peruvian currency) with which she will buy candy and pastries for her food stand. FINCA is helping her by providing her with this loan. She would like to apply for a larger loan in the future and understands that FINCA must first measure her capacity to repay. She dreams of supporting her childrens' studies.

Esterela C. Q. is a widow with 6 children, aged 5, 9, 13, 15, and 18. Four of her children are in school and the eldest is preparing to apply to the university. Estela's business is the sales of prepared seafood dishes; she has been in this business for more than 5 years. She started the business when her husband died since she saw the necessity of working to support her children. Estela is requesting a loan of 300 soles with which she wants to buy fish and pay the monthly expenses of her eldest son's studies. Her dream is that her eldest son will complete his studies and becomes a professional.

Ninfa Fernández F. lives with her life partner and her 2 children, aged 7 and 10. One of her children is in school. She sells Avon beauty products for women. She started the business a year and 8 months ago, when her sister in Huancavelica, a teacher by training who also sells Avon, suggested that she take up sales. Ninfa is requesting a loan of 600 Peruvian soles; the loan will provide her with capital to buy Avon products to sell. Her challenge is the running of her own business and her dream is to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La comunidad de Acoria es un barrio del distrito de Acoria perteneciente al departamento de Huancavelica (el mas pobre del Perú), ubicada a una altitud de 2880 m.s.n.m, las principales actividades son la agricultura, ganadería y el comercio. Al distrito se llega por vía férrea Huancayo – Huancavelica.

Olga Corso, madre soltera con 3 hijos, de 3, 10 y 17 años, dos hijos van a la escuela, su negocio es la venta de comida, la cual tiene 10 años de creación, inicialmente quería estudiar pero no contó con el apoyo de su familia y con el nacimiento de sus hijos tuvo que trabajar vendiendo golosinas en su tienda. Olga solicita un préstamo de 500 soles para comprar golosinas, pastelitos para la venta de comida. FINCA le ayudo con el crédito, aun quiere un monto mayor en el futuro, sabe que debe medir su capacidad de pago. Su sueño es apoyar en los estudios de sus hijos.

Estela C. Q., viuda con 6 hijos de 5, 9, 13, 15, 18 años, 4 van a la escuela y el mayor se prepara para postular a la universidad, su negocio es la venta de comida en base a pescado, que cuenta con mas de 5 años de creación, creo el negocio cuando falleció su esposo pues se vio en la necesidad de trabajar para mantener a sus hijos. Estela solicita un préstamo de 300 soles con el que quiere comprar pescado y pagar la mensualidad del estudio de su hijo mayor. Su sueño es que sus hijo mayor estudie y se vuelva un profesional.

Ninfa Fernández F., conviviente con 2 hijos de 7 y 10 años, uno va al colegio, vende productos de belleza para mujeres (Avon), el cual inicio hace un año y 8 meses, inicio en las ventas invitada por su hermana en Huancavelica, de profesión docente pero no ejerce su carrera. Ninfa solicita un préstamo de 600 soles así tendrá capital para comprar productos. Su desafío es administrar un negocio y su sueño es tener una casa propia.

loans.use: The communal bank Señor de Acoria is requesting a loan of 5100 Peruvian soles (1750 USD) for its members, who want to carry out their business plans and stock their businesses.

loans.name: Unity 2036-3 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Ludia J..  She is currently in the business of selling flour and is requesting a loan to expand the business.  

Ludia is 40 years old and is married with a husband who is an accountant.  She has 5 children ranging from age 9 to 21 and her children go to school.  Each week, Ludia makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.  

Ludia is joined in her small group by Margret Elusipa, Alice A., Rejoice A. and Josephine J..  Margret Elusipa has a business selling bread at the market and wants to expand her business.  Alice A. is currently operating a business selling local brew and wants a loan to expand her business.  Rejoice A. operates a business selling tomatoes at home and wants to buy a generator for sale.  Josephine J. is currently in the business of selling beans and maize flour at the market and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: expand the business

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es:
Hoy en día el negocio de pulpería requiere de mucha inversión por la razón de que hay mucha competencia y si no se invierte, difícilmente se podrá mantener el negocio en el mercado. Consciente de esto la señora Mercedes E. se ha dedicado a su negocio de pulpería atendido en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino.

Ella es una dama con la obligación de mantener a su amada familia siendo este el motive por el cual se ha preocupado por mejorar el negocio. Para ello solicita un crédito en Ceprodel esperando que este sea aprobado y así mejorar su condición económica y el de su hogar.
texts.en:
Nowadays a small store requires a great deal of investment because there is a lot of competition, and if one doesn’t invest, it is difficult to keep up in the marketplace. Mindful of this, Señora Mercedes E. works hard running her store out of her house in the municipality of Ciudad Sandino. She is responsible for the support of her beloved family. This is the reason she is anxious to improve the business. She is hoping that her request for a loan through Ceprodel will be approved so she will be then be able to improve the financial situation of her household.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Abdugafar

texts.en: K. Abdugafar is married, has 4 children, and is a farmer. Not fortunate enough to attend school, he very early on embraced working in the fields. Due to this work, he is somehow meeting the needs of his family. His wife also helps to support their household working with her husband. Today, exhausted from crude farming methods, Abdugafar brings in less and less income, which has a negative impact on his household. He is requesting a loan of 3500 Somoni for the term of 12 months in order to buy seeds and fertilizer to augment his crop yields. All of this will then allow him to increase his income and improve his family’s standard of living, especially his dear children for the sake of whom he is working hard. Abdugafar and his family are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Jaime tiene 30 años, es soltero  y vive solo. Se dedica a la venta de repuestos de carros y de diversas maquinarias para las empresas mineras, lo cual viene realizando desde hace 10 años y le va muy bien. Jaime tiene habilidad para los negocios y gracias a su carisma para ofrecer sus repuestos, hace de esta actividad, no un trabajo, sino un medio divertido y agradable de generarse ingresos económicos. Además él vende a precios módicos, por ello  los  mecánicos le comprar constantemente, lo más difícil es que cuando viaja a la ciudad de Lima, tiene encontrar los diversos repuestos, y le toma varios días de búsqueda, esfuerzo y e inversión. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Jaime tiene invertirá la cantidad solicitada en la adquisición de mayor cantidad de  repuestos y maquinarias para luego venderlos en su localidad.
texts.en:
Jaime is 30 years old, single and lives alone. He has sold car parts and various machines for mining companies over the last 10 years, and it has been going well. Jaime has a natural business ability, and thanks to his charisma, selling parts is not so much a job as it is a fun way to generate an income. Furthermore, he sells at low prices, so mechanics buy from him constantly. The most difficult part is when he has to travel to Lima to find various parts; it takes him days of searching, effort and investment. This is his first loan from MFP. Jaime will invest it in the acquisition of a greater quantity of parts and machinery to sell locally.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of parts for sale

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Greetings from Eric H. in Kanombe sector, Kicukiro district, Kigali, capital of Rwanda! Eric is 25 years old.

This entrepreneur started his business 5 years ago. He sells used shoes and he has a lot of customers in town and up country. Eric is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Rwf, which will help him to expand his business. This loan will be repaid in 8 months on a monthly basis.

Eric believes that once he gets this loan, his profit will increase.

loans.use: Expand his used shoe business

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch P., 34,  lives in Prey Mean village in Takeo province. She cultivates rice in a plot of land she owns. Her husband, Mr. Chhoem Sophal, retails chicken. He facing some difficulties in his business because he does not have his own motorbike to travel to purchase chicken for sale. Thus, Mrs. Touch P. decided to ask for a loan, to add to her savings, to buy a motorbike for her husband’s business. She has four children who are attending the local school. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to add to her saving to buy a motorbike for her husband’s chicken retail business.

loans.name: Alira

texts.fr: A. habite dans le quartier de’Agoè assiyéyé, elle a pour activité la vente de bouillie, c’est un commerce qu’elle fait depuis 2004, elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de wages et elle souhaite  se réapprovisionner en produits de première nécessité pour préparer sa bouillie plus précisement 2sacs de mil, 2 sacs de sorgho, 2 sacs de maïs et 2 bidons d’huile. Elle est mariée et à 03 enfants.
texts.en:
A. lives in the Agoè Assiyéyé district. Her work involves selling bouillie (porridge) which is a business she has had since 2004. She has never been the recipient of a WAGES loan, and she would like to supply herself with essential ingredients for making her bouillie, to be exact: 2 sacks of millet, 2 sacks of sorghum, 2 sacks of rice, and 2 drums of cooking oil. She is married and has three children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of millet, sorghum, corn, and oil

loans.name: Rafael Acargel

texts.es: El Señor Rafael Arcángel M. N. tiene 40 años de edad, su estado civil es soltero. Tiene 2 hijos y todos sus hijos estudian. La actividad económica de Don Rafael es ofrecer los servicios de carpintería. Hace más de cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que su papa le enseño este oficio y fue así como logro independizarse y establecer su propio negocio. Los propósitos de Don Rafael son de mejorar las condiciones de su establecimiento ya que el espacio que posee no es suficiente. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo por lo que es necesaria la compra de herramientas para la elaboración de muebles. Sus deseos son de aumentar su producción en la elaboración de más muebles y así podrá ofrecer a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 12.000 cordobas.
texts.en:
Mr. Rafael Arcángel M. N. is 40 years old and is single. He has 2 children, both of whom are in school. Mr. Rafael is a carpenter. He has spent more than four years in this business since his father taught him the profession and it is how he succeeded in becoming independent and in starting his own business. His goals are to improve the conditions of his establishment since he doesn’t have enough space. The money that he is requesting is for capital for his business, which is necessary so that he can buy tools to make furniture. His dreams are to increase his production of furniture and to be able to offer his family a better life. He is requesting C$ 12,000 cordobas ($625).

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for work

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina es socia del Banco Comunal Dos Mil.
Agustina es casada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Agustina venD. camote, manzanas, plátano, yuca, todos estos productos sancochados en el horno, sus ventas los realiza D. manera ambulatoria.
Agustina necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. camote, manzanas.
Los sueños D. Agustina son tener otro negocio y que sus hijos culminen sus estuD..
texts.en:
Agustina is a member of the Two Thousand Communal Bank. She is married, is 40 years old, and has 4 children. Agustina sells sweet potatoes, apples, plantains, manioc root as a street vendor, all of which are parboiled on the stove. Agustina needs a loan of 1,000 soles, money that she will invest in the purchase of sweet potatoes and apples. She dreams of having another business and that her children complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweet potatoes and apples

loans.name: Ulugoy

texts.en:
A. Ulugoy is 40 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is married and the loving mother of four children. Her father's hard and demanding character showed her, from the time she was a little girl, the significant value of work, and therefore she has been successful in various activities throughout her life.

Now she dedicates herself to raising and selling cattle and with the income she generates she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy and her best friends.

Ulugoy asks for a $1,000 loan with the term of nine months in order to buy more young cattle to later sell when they are fully grown. With this investment she will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life. Let’s support this dedicated mother's proposal.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es: Marleni es una mujer que a sus 23 años es madre de tres hijos, junto a su pareja, quien es un joven de 26 años, tratan juntos, de sacar a su familia adelante. Están viviendo en un cuarto alquilado, ya que por el momento no tienen una casa propia donde vivir. Desde que salió de su tierra natal en busca de mejoras económicas tuvo que dedicarse a múltiples oficios para solventar los gastos de sus hijas. Pero hace 2 meses ha iniciado un negocio de venta de comida, el cual realiza todas las noches en la puerta de su casa, ofreciendo sus platillos a las personas que transitan por la zona, desde las seis de la tarde hasta la media noche para luego descansar e iniciar por la mañana su trabajo limpiando casas. Estas actividades le ayudan a apoyar a su pareja, quien se dedica a la construcción, y juntos pretenden  progresar y aúnan sus esfuerzos con tal de otorgarles a sus hijas las condiciones necesarias  para su desarrollo. Para el futuro, Marleni desea tener un negocio de abarrotes dentro del terreno que muy pronto comprarán para construir su casa. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y fue acogida en su grupo debido a la responsabilidad que muestra. Los 800 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de algunos utensilios de cocina para mejorar la atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marleni is a 23 year-old mother of three, who, together with her partner who is 26 years old, tries to make her family get ahead. They live in a rented room, as presently they don't have a house of their own. From the time she left her birthplace in search of economic improvements she has been doing multiple things to be able to cover the expenses of her daughters. 2 months ago she started a business selling food from the frontdoor of her house to pedistrians from 6 p.m. till midnight, then she sleeps and starts cleaning houses in the morning. With these jobs she helps support her partner who is a construction worker and together they hope to get ahead and with the united efforts offer their daughters the necessary conditions for their development. For the future, Marleni wishes to have a generalstore on the land they soon will buy to build their house. This is her first loan with MFP and she has been accepted by the group as she is very responsible. The 800 soles will be invested in buying some kitchenware to improve service for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase kitchenware.

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.es:
Joaquina es socia del Banco Comunal Sumaq Huayta que significa Flor Bella.
Joaquina es conviviente, tiene 43 años y 5 hijos, Joaquina junto a su esposo se dedican a la ventad e medicina natural, tienen una tienda en una calle céntrica el cual es alquilado, actividad que realizan todos los días.
Joaquina necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de jarabe, aceites.
Joaquina sueña con brindar una buena educación a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y tener uh laboratorio de medicinas naturales.
texts.en:
Joaquina is a member of the Sumaq Huayta Communal Bank, which means “Beautiful Flower.” Joaquina is a common-law wife, 43 years old, and has 5 children. She works alongside her husband selling natural medicine. They have a rented store in a centrally-located street where they work every day. Joaquina needs a loan of 2,500 soles, money which will be used to buy syrups and oils. Joaquina dreams of giving her children a good education so they may become professionals, and of having a natural medicine laboratory.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy syrups and oils

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
La señora Ysabel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Mujer Riojana”, vive en la Provincia San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 54 años, 07 hijos todos ya independientes y con familia.

Con el fin D. generar sus propios ingresos económicos en su hogar, le nace la idea D. aperturar un pequeño negocio D. venta D. comidas por las mañanas, y por las noches con la venta D. salchipollo, ubicada en su misma casa, con un ambiente muy bien acondicionado. Hoy en día ha ganando mucha experiencia en este tipo D. actividad y se hizo muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  

Continúa con el mismo negocio atendiendo a sus clientes que a diario acuden a su local y es ella quien personalmente los conquista con su rica sazón y la amabilidad que la caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,500.00, invertirá comprando arroz, azúcar y papas en sacos, diversas verduras,  huevos y pollos en javas. También comprará algunos utensilios D. cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. 

Ysabel, se siente muy segura y con ganas D. seguir a adelante y segura D. una vida tranquila.  Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir con el cumplimiento D. sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Ysabel belongs to the La Mujer Riojana Community Bank. She lives in San Martin. She is a 54 year old widow. She has seven children who are all independent and have their own families. She wanted to generate her own income in her house. She got the idea to open a small business selling meals in the morning and “salchipollo” (a chicken and sausage dish) in the evening. Her business is in her own house, in a well equipped area. She has now gained a lot of experience in this type of business. She is well known and well regarded among her customers. She continues with the same business, tending to her daily customers. She personally won her customers with her delicious seasoning and characteristic kindness. With this loan for 2,500 PEN she will buy rice, sugar, sacks of potatoes, various vegetables, and crates of eggs and chickens. She will also buy some kitchen utensils to replace those that she has now. This way she will offer better service and attention to her customers. Ysabel feels very self-confident, and she has the desire to get ahead and have a peaceful life. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to making her dreams and goals come true.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients (potatoes, rice, sugar, vegetables, crates of chickens and eggs) for her meal preparation and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Oshutolu

texts.en:
A. is 53 years old and is the divorced mother of four children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria where she sells all kinds of juices, drinks and table water. She has been in this business for the past twenty years.

A. is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase all kind of drinks and table water to enable her to meet her customers’ demands. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, juice and table water to sell

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos tiene 33 años, vive con su pareja y madre de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace 10 años compró un motocarro, desde entonces se dedica al transporte de pasajeros por las distintas zonas de su localidad. Adicionalmente, desde hace 2 años tiene un bote a motor, donde cada fin de semana se dedica a la pesca. Carlos está muy contento con sus actividades porque le permiten mantenerse activo, además de administrar sus ganancias diarias para solventar los gastos de su familia. Para un futuro cercano, Carlos quiere tener un taller de mecánica, pues también es aficionado de esta actividad y la considera muy rentable, especialmente en la reparación de motos y motocarros, que son los vehículos que abundan en su región. Con MFP ya tiene 3 préstamos y a pesar de que algunas veces tiene diferencias con sus compañeros de banco comunal, Carlos permanece con su grupo porque sabe que esas pequeñas discusiones pasan, pero el deseo de progreso de él y de su grupo permanece. Con el dinero que solicita ahora comprará repuestos para mandar a reparar su motocarro, también adquirirá materiales de pesca para implementar su bote.
texts.en:
Carlos is 33 years old and he lives with his partner and mother of his 3 children. They live in their own home. Ten years ago he purchase a motorcycle car and since then he has been providing taxi services in the different areas of his region. Also, two years ago he got a motorboat and every weekend he fishes. Carlos is very happy with his businesses because they keep him busy and they give him the means to provide for his family. In the near future Carlos wants to set up a mechanic shop because he loves that kind of work and finds it very profitable. He is mostly interested in repairing motorcycles and motorcycle cars, being the most common type of transportation in his region. With MFP (Kiva Field Partner) has has had 3 loans and even though there have been some difference of opinion with his colleages at the Community Bank, Carlos remains with the same gruop because he knows these types of discussions happen. His will for self improvement and the success of the group remains. The funds that he is requesting will be used to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle car. He will also invest in the purchase of fishing gear to use with his boat.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle car and to purchase fishing gear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase hair extensions and beauty products

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.en:
Ingrid C. is from the town of Tukuran. She is 49 years old. Ingrid is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ingrid raises and sells pigs. Ingrid has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 11,000.00 PHP a month from these activities.

Ingrid joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ingrid has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Ingrid is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to expand shelter for the borrower's livestock. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Ingrid from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her livestock shelter

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en: Belinda B. is a 43-year-old woman who lives with her family in Malaria, Tala, Caloocan City. Her husband, Vicente, 45, is a mason. Their two children are both studying. Belinda has a small home-based general store where she sells food items like instant noodles and more. She is also into the direct selling of perfumes, cosmetics and women’s accessories. She earns a net income of P5,000 a month. Having been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative since 2006 is one of her treasured experiences. She currently needs a loan from the cooperative in the amount of P12,000 so that she can purchase stock for her store. She dreams of converting her small store into a grocery store someday. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her store
